review_text: The Zaunkoenig M2K is an outstanding FPS gaming mouse. It's astonishingly lightweight and has exceptionally low click latency, providing an extremely responsive in-game experience. Its feet glide very smoothly, and its cable is lightweight and flexible.

That it‚Äôs daring and unique is the least you can say. It weighs a mere 24 grams, has a polling rate of up to 8000Hz, is made out of carbon fiber, and is made specifically for fingertip grippers. However, it‚Äôs also extremely interesting despite the price.

The M2K has a long adjustment period; I used this mouse over a few weeks before feeling confident enough to review it. The 4k/8k polling rate did not work in Fortnite or Apex Legends. Overall, I don't think it's worth 350, but the quality is high.

I've owned the Zaunkoenig M2K for the past few months, and it is my daily driver. This mouse features an 8,000Hz polling rate and weighs only 24g, making it incredibly light. The carbon fiber shell feels like a high-quality product that enhances my gaming experience.

The Zaunkoenig M2K is incredibly light and a pleasure to use. It offers a great clicking experience with low latency. However, it requires a fingertip grip, which can be uncomfortable for larger hands. Despite the drawbacks, the performance is noteworthy, especially in fast-paced games.

This mouse is an awesome shape for fingertip and there aren't any other options remotely like it. The most popular fingertip mouse manufacturer, G-Wolves, has many shapes but none of them are anything like this. Really wish this would come back in stock. The only upgrade I would want is a lighter weight. Love this mouse.
This mouse is a great starter mouse to start with. The lightweight design and ergonomic shape make it very easy to use. I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a compact gaming mouse.

review_title: Great for aiming but can cause fatigue
review_text: I mainly used the M4 for a few months and found it excellent for precision aiming. However, I did notice that using it for long periods fatigued my thumb due to its size and fingertip grip design. Performance-wise it's amazing with strong battery life, but smaller hands will benefit more from this mouse.

review_title: Fantastic for CSGO and general use
review_text: After using the Keychron M4 for a while, I can't imagine going back to my old mouse. It greatly improved my performance in FPS games, especially in CSGO. The tracking is precise, and it feels light in hand for rapid movements. Plus, the battery lasts a long time, which is a big plus.

review_title: Small size could be a drawback
review_text: While I appreciate the lightweight and compact nature of the Keychron M4, I did experience hand cramps after prolonged use due to its small size. It's perfect for portability, but for extensive work or gaming, I feel like it might not be the best fit unless you have smaller hands.

At first, I had concerns about the Max as it has a similar size to G-Wolves' other smaller mice, but its wider, boxier shape was very comfortable for my larger hands. It blew me away with how well it felt and performed, especially in games like Overwatch 2.

The unboxing of the Fenris Max was an incredible experience, with unique packaging and a nice variety of extras. The raised hexagon pattern on the shell offers good grip, and its lightweight design truly enhances ease of use during gaming sessions.

While I found the Fenrir Max to be extremely comfortable with its lightweight and solid build quality, the side buttons and scroll wheel could be larger for improved usability, and the mouse‚Äôs true weight does exceed its advertised specifications.

The Fenrir Max is designed for fingertip grip and excels in that regard. After two months of use, I can say it's an excellent choice for anyone looking to minimize hand fatigue during long gaming sessions.

I have been using the Fenrir Max with a fingertip grip, and the control level has improved significantly for precise movements. However, it's only suitable for those who use fingertip grip and might not be comfortable for conventional grips.
Overall, this is a thoughtfully designed, well built, and multifaceted mouse. I will be keeping it; however, my 3s is on standby due to the software limitations of the 4's full functionality.
That's this mouse. I'll point out like others how slippery it is, but it's worse than that. It just feels gross, like slime compared to the 3.
The ergonomics are flawless. The ergonomics of the MX 4 are fantastic and are very similar to previous models. I can work 8 hours straight without noticing it's even there.

review_title: Impressive upgrades but with some downsides
review_text: The MX Master 4 has an incredible haptic engine, and while it‚Äôs by no means a necessary touch, it makes the mouse feel a lot more premium with its new actions ring feature.
Overall, it‚Äôs a solid mouse that lives up to the long and well-reputed history of the Master series. I‚Äôm excited about the new updates/features that Logitech added to the V4.

The shape is simple and fits medium or small hands best (great for quick flicks). The new HERO 2 sensor tracks perfectly, and the clicks feel snappy with new hybrid switches (though they‚Äôre a bit loud). It uses USB-C to charge, lasts up to 95 hours when set at 1 kHz polling rate, and works smoothly with Logitech‚Äôs G-Hub software.

Love this mouse so much, I bought it twice! One for the PC, and one for the laptop to take. I‚Äôve owned many mice, and this is the one. Very light, glides well, feels great and snappy, and battery life is great.

review_title: Logitech has never done me wrong
review_text: Best mouse ever!!! The mouse is super light, fills in my hand nicely since I have larger hands, and the response rate is unbeatable ‚Äì the best reliable mouse on the market!
Amazing mouse! Best I‚Äôve had so far. I went to this from a Razer mouse and I couldn‚Äôt be happier. It‚Äôs light, responsive, and even compatible with Logitech's power play!
Great product, rough price. No issues with the mouse, battery lasts weeks, great upgrades on the hero sensor, just a bit pricey.

review_title: Great value for the money, but I wish Keychron made something higher end
review_text: I bought this mouse for one reason: I was on my third MX Master 3 that became sticky to the touch after too much usage. I would describe it as good enough, but I would really love to see something higher-end from Keychron.

I have been using the Logitech Master 3S for a long time. The Keychron M6 1000Hz is a great choice and does what I need. It has a sleek design without RGB and supports 1000Hz polling rate for smooth gaming without any connectivity issues.

I'm delighted with this mouse. I returned the Logitech MX Master 3S because my Win10 machine kept freezing. This is like the Logitech but without any major drawbacks. The software could improve, but overall it works well for my needs.

I disassembled the scroll wheel to try and fix it. The left to right play was easy to fix, but the loud clicks in stepped mode were a real hassle to fix, making this mouse less desirable than I initially hoped.

review_title: Good, but has some design flaws
review_text: The mouse feels good in my hand but has some rattling issues with the scroll wheel. The different scrolling modes are useful, but the implementation seems cheap and loud compared to other mice I‚Äôve used.

Razer arguably makes the best products and this mouse is no disappointment. It is THE BEST all-around multifunctioning mouse. It has all the buttons you could want, Hyper scroll wheel, RGB, Bluetooth switch for multiple devices, the skates float, and mouse clicks/buttons are crisp. If you want the best and can afford it, just go ahead and buy it.

I‚Äôve been a long time G502 user and after several breaking or just plain not working after a while I decided to make the switch. Let me say, I‚Äôm loving this mouse! I prefer heavier mice, so if you‚Äôre one of those folks who like their mice to feel like air this isn‚Äôt it. Overall, if you like a mid-high weight mouse, mostly play FPS games, enjoy some RGB, and can afford it, this is the mouse for you.

I bought this to upgrade from my basilisk ultimate, and it didn‚Äôt disappoint. It feels like the scroll wheel issues have been addressed and the RGB feels cleaner. I love that it supports USB-C and has better wireless capabilities with faster DPI options.

review_title: Great mouse for gaming and work
review_text: I‚Äôve been using this mouse for a couple of weeks now ‚Äî and it feels great in the hand, with excellent precision. The RGB lighting looks awesome but isn‚Äôt distracting. It connects instantly and hasn‚Äôt lost connection once. In games, it‚Äôs a beast ‚Äî especially in shooters.

Its a solid mouse. I got it on sale for like 40 off so I'm beyond happy. The DPI clutch makes FPS games like Siege and Tarkov that much easier when lining up headshots. All in all, I highly recommend this mouse. Especially if you find it on sale.
Good quality and perfect for gaming. Lightweight and nimble, this mouse allows the user to make micro adjustments in milliseconds.
Really responsive and lightweight mouse! The texture and the quality of the materials used also felt premium for the price.
I ordered L7 Ultra and L7 Ultra+. The size difference, minor on paper, is noticeable. I like both. I have large hands, XXL, but I love to use these smaller mice.

review_title: Great mouse for a great price
review_text: Great mouse for a great price, you must download the MCHOSE software though and do a firmware update else wireless is significantly hindered.

review_title: Very solid build and great orange color keep your eye on this mouse
review_text: The MCHOSE M7 Ultra fixes and improves a lot over U2 though ‚Äî much better shape, better performance, better sensor, higher polling rate, better battery‚Ä¶ to name just a few.

Right now, I am loving the Pulsar X2V2. I have somewhat large hands (21x11) and I notice I'm holding it more relaxed and more fingertip style compared to the Viper V2 Pro. I'm switching them out a little, and if I can teach myself to hold it as relaxed as the Pulsar without creeping forward during gameplay, I would prefer it.

I previously liked larger back hump mice like the MM711 and GPW, so I picked up a used X2V2 for cheap. Now it's my main mouse! It provides stability during games, but the rear edges can be uncomfortable during long sessions. Overall, I'd recommend it for those looking for a lightweight gaming mouse.

My X2V2 had the squishy clicks that I had to fix myself, and the clicks were a bit sticky. However, it feels solid overall with a good weight and size. It's been working flawlessly except for the occasional click issue that seems to be a common complaint.

Highly recommend the Pulsar X2 variant! I‚Äôm a competitive Fortnite player, and I have found that this mouse works flawlessly after several months. None of them have creaking or sensor issues, even after continuous usage. It does feel light in hand, and that's great for quick movements.

I experienced significant tracking issues on certain mousepads, and the clicks could feel mushy at times. After using it for a while, I had to recharge mine almost daily which isn't great. The shape is comfortable, but the inconsistency in performance has been frustrating.

review_title: Incredible gaming mouse that tops its competitors
review_text: For $74.99, the OP1 8K is an incredible gaming performance mouse that tops its competitors in sensory and click latency today. Wired connectivity ensures that it delivers the best stability and performance.
The replacement for my old G700s. A mouse that meets my expectations thanks to its left-handed buttons. I find it very comfortable for long use.

The OP1 8K is a stunner of a gaming mouse, and it‚Äôs the first wired pointer to truly have me excited in a long time. Between its excellent clickers and its super streamlined sensor, this is a performance beast.

The Endgame Gear OP1 8k is a fantastic wired gaming mouse, pushing far more expensive wireless devices to be better in almost every way. Its 26K DPI / 650 IPS sensor might not match the paper specs of something from Razer or Logitech, but it‚Äôs supremely slick.

Overall, the OP1 8k offers excellent raw performance, features a maximum polling rate of 8000Hz, and has consistently low click latency. However, it lacks multi-device pairing and feels a bit small for larger hands.

The Endgame Gear OP1 8K delivers exceptional precision and control during intense gaming sessions. The lightweight design and the option to swap the main buttons' switches enhance the overall experience for competitive gaming.

review_title: Pricey but worth it for me
review_text: I used to always be on the lookout on the perfect mouse. I work from home and I am a gamer and the issue I always had was that the mice I'd like would be way too big for my hands or they'd have waaay too many buttons. These are perfect. No unnecessary buttons, light, fast. Contemplating getting a second one for my purse. Logitech if you're reading this, I would like it in pink. Thx.

This Logitech mouse works perfectly! It‚Äôs very comfortable to use, even for long hours. The clicks are smooth, and the scroll wheel is quiet and responsive. I love how fast and easy it connects‚Äîjust plug and play. The battery life is long-lasting, and it works great on any surface. Perfect for work, school, or everyday use. Highly recommended.

This mouse is awesome! It‚Äôs wireless, but it has no lag or battery issues. It‚Äôs also very comfortable and fits my small hand perfectly. The RGB lighting is beautiful and customizable, and the buttons are easy to program. The white mist color is very pretty and matches my laptop.

review_title: My hands used to cramp all the time
review_text: My hands used to cramp all the time with all my previous mice then someone suggested this to me and I tried it out and am in love with it. Not only do I get 0 hand cramps, response time is good (I play a lot of FPS games) and no annoying cords. Small mice for small hands are hard to come by, good ones that is. I plan on buying another one as a backup in case this one breaks!

review_title: Perfect for my small hands - and it‚Äôs adorable!
review_text: Perfect for smaller hands or individuals who are looking for a lighter mouse. Has helped relieve some of my hand/wrist discomfort during gaming from other bulkier and heavier mice I‚Äôve used in the past. It‚Äôs also super cute, which is a huge plus. I love this mouse! Great purchase.

It's very lightweight and has a good, comfortable shape for your hand. Very pretty design and LEDs! My complaints are that the bottom button on the left side is sticky and doesn't have a crisp click to it, and even when I turned off the LEDs in the software program, they're still on.

If you are a regular gamer, then this is the mouse for you. It feels great in your hand, and it is the lightest gaming mouse I have ever used. You can play for hours without tiring. The wireless connection is excellent, and the mouse is fast with no lag time. The battery life is excellent, it has a 200-hour battery life with fast charging.

This wireless mouse is awesome! It feels great in my hand, moves very well, and is super responsive. It is very easy to install, and it is great for gaming or normal computer use. Really great product, I highly recommend!

review_title: Great feeling, cool looking, super responsive
review_text: I like this mouse for my daily work and gaming habit. It has a good battery life so far, and it responds very well/quick. It has a great sensor for fast accuracy. Overall, very responsive, attractive, and great build quality.

review_title: Awesome grip on the mouse, feels very fast and precise
review_text: This mouse is fast and effective, handling all my needs for gaming. The grip feels great, and it's very responsive.

review_title: Good all-around wireless mouse with some quirks
review_text: The Rival 3 Gen 2 Wireless is a solid, flexible mouse. It has excellent battery life and an easy way to switch between devices.
My daughter and I really enjoyed this product. It fit nicely in our hands and works much better than the last one we had.
For the price, this mouse is solidly built and feels good to use. It connects seamlessly and has great performance overall.
This is my first SteelSeries product, and I'm impressed. The buttons have a nice feel, and there‚Äôs no lag or loss of signal.

review_title: Great mouse for a great price
review_text: Great mouse for a great price, you must download the MCHOSE software though and do a firmware update else wireless is significantly hindered.

I ordered L7 Ultra and L7 Ultra+. The size difference, minor on paper, is noticeable. I like both. I have large hands, XXL, but I love to use these smaller mice. Very comfortable, nice clicks, nice scrolling.

review_title: MCHOSE L7 Pro - An Exceptional Gaming Mouse
review_text: The MCHOSE L7 Pro is an outstanding mouse. It is lightweight, compact, and extremely precise. The sensor responds impeccably, and the latency is practically zero, which makes it perfect for fast-paced gaming.
Really responsive and lightweight mouse! The texture and quality of the materials used feel premium for the price. Ideal for prolonged gaming sessions without causing hand fatigue.

review_title: This mouse delivers flagship-level performance at a budget price
review_text: After three weeks of heavy use, the build quality remains solid with no degradation. It offers 0.2 milliseconds wireless latency and true 8000Hz polling, which makes it the best budget gaming mouse I‚Äôve used.
"X2H had the worst clicks of any mouse I‚Äôve ever tried. The main buttons felt very mushy, which was frustrating during gameplay. I really expected better from Pulsar."

review_title: A mostly subjective review of a gaming mouse I wish I could love.
review_text: On paper, this mouse should be perfect for me: it‚Äôs an extremely well-built, ambidextrous mouse featuring near-state-of-the-art wireless tech, awesome clicks, pristine skates, and a great scroll wheel. But every time I take it for a spin, my aim feels slightly off.

review_title: VAXEE‚Äôs first wireless release doesn‚Äôt disappoint.
review_text: I love the fact that this company is so focused on tryhard competitive gamers that they released a firmware update to make the mouse even snappier after its release, and the sensor implementation and wireless technology that‚Äôs driving this mouse are fantastic.

review_title: A great gaming mouse for competitive play.
review_text: This mouse has amazing wireless connectivity and build quality. I appreciate the competitive mode that optimizes performance. The battery life is also very good, charging quickly and lasting for extended gaming sessions without any issues.

review_title: Solid mouse but could be better.
review_text: The VAXEE XE Wireless is very nice in terms of build quality, but that coating can get sticky with sweaty hands. The buttons are fine but tend to have a slight rattle which can be noticeable during use.

The VAXEE XE Wireless has fantastic sensor performance and low latency, making it perfect for FPS games. However, it's slightly heavier than I expected, which may not appeal to everyone. Overall, a solid choice for serious gamers.

The Hyperlight combines a sub-40 gram design with exceptional build quality. Engineered to feel weightless and endure the toughest gaming sessions. Experience unparalleled lightness and superior durability.

review_title: As good as it gets without paying the Logitech tax. Almost perfect. Almost.
review_text: Hitscan Hyperlight immediately stood out because it is featherweight, fast, and far cheaper than the usual suspects. In practice it is very, very close. If Hitscan fixes one mechanical issue that has followed me across four different units, this would be my easy recommendation.

review_title: Hitscan Hyperlight after 1 month hardcore use.
review_text: The Hyperlight is a 40g Viper mini shape and it‚Äôs rocking the 3395 sensor with AK pulling capabilities. The main clicks are Omron Optical and the side clicks are TTC. If you are trying to pick up this Mouse, have no doubt you don‚Äôt have to worry about the quality, it's going to be absolutely incredible.

review_title: The mouse that flirts with perfection
review_text: The Hyperlight is a gaming mouse that leaves no one indifferent, in terms of both design and execution. Weighing in at just 39 grams, it boasts a rare lightness while offering appreciable sturdiness in its class. Its combination of lightweight design, reliable sensor, and comfortable ergonomics makes it a compelling choice.

This mouse is fantastic with its low weight, premium feel, and outstanding performance in gaming sessions. The shape is tailored perfectly for smaller hands and provides a comfortable grip for long durations.

review_title: "Excellent ergonomic mouse with a great selection of features"
review_text: "The Razer Pro Click V2 is an excellent ergonomic mouse made for general productivity. The device is lightweight, comfortable, and its buttons are satisfying to press. It has a high polling rate, and the scroll wheel supports both tactile and free-scrolling modes."

"While the Pro Click V2 is an innovative device with excellent features and build quality, its weight makes it less suitable for high-speed twitch gaming. I enjoyed using it for office work but found it cumbersome for competitive gameplay."

"I wanted to love the Razer Pro Click V2, but after extended periods of use, I found the ergonomics lacking. The angle feels awkward, leading to increased wrist strain. I had to return it and revert to my previous mouse."

"This mouse has transformed my work setup. Its responsive sensor and customizable buttons enhance my productivity. I can easily switch between devices, and it works perfectly for light gaming after hours. Highly recommend!"

"The Razer Pro Click V2 is a solid mouse with precise tracking and great connectivity options. However, reliance on Razer's software for some functions can be frustrating, particularly for switching profiles. It feels supportive and comfortable for prolonged use."

"The Scyrox V8 delivers exceptional performance for its price. It's ultra-lightweight, making it easy to maneuver in FPS games. However, the battery life is quite poor, draining fast when using higher polling rates."
"The build quality feels solid, but there's noticeable button wobble which can be distracting during gameplay. The shape is comfortable for claw grips, but palm grip users may find it lacking."
"Coming from a G502, this mouse is incredibly light and feels great in hand. The clicks are satisfying, and the scroll wheel, while needing some pressure, performs well in games."

"The Scyrox V8 is built for competitive play with a high precision sensor. It's very lightweight, which reduces fatigue during long gaming sessions. The lack of Bluetooth is a downside for multi-device users."
"Overall, the mouse performs well, but I wish the battery life was better. Using it at 8000Hz polling rate drains the battery quickly, which could be a concern for intense gaming sessions."

"The Pulsar X2H v3 is an excellent FPS gaming mouse. It has a shape that's optimized for claw grippers, with a tall rear hump that supports your palm and a cinched middle that helps you lock in your grip."
"I bought the pulsar x2h v3 and I returned it; the shape was okay but the main clicks were very mushy. It's disappointing given the hype around this model."
"Highly highly recommend a Pulsar x2 variant; it's perfect for competitive Fortnite players. The overall execution is good, and the shape provides great support for gameplay."
"I‚Äôve used the new pulser x2h V3 as part of my daily rotation for the last three months. The clicks feel much better compared to the original, but some quality control issues remain."
Nice smooth mouse. I have large hands and it fits pretty good. Excellent for claw, palm grip. Love how it feels and gameplay is great. It comes with glass feet too which is so cool.

The Pulsar TenZ Signature Edition gaming mouse feels great in hand and is perfect for claw grip. The lightweight design allows for swift movements while gaming. I appreciate the customization options available through the software. Highly recommended for FPS players.

review_title: Good quality but lacks unique features
review_text: This mouse is built well and performs as described, but I expected a bit more from a collaboration with TenZ. While it functions great for general gaming, it doesn't stand out visually or in features when compared to other brands.

The mouse has a great sensor and very responsive buttons. It‚Äôs light and comfortable to use for extended gaming sessions. However, I wish the battery life was longer as it runs out fast when using the 8000 Hz polling rate.

While the Pulsar TenZ is a solid mouse with good ergonomics and features, it doesn't necessarily offer anything groundbreaking compared to other models in the same price range. It‚Äôs reliable for FPS games but has room for improvement in battery life.

This is basically the viper mini wireless‚Ä¶just different name. And so if you love the viper mini then you will love this. I certainly do. It‚Äôs a fantastic mouse. Razer did good here. Still managed to keep it very light but added wireless capabilities and kept the cool RGB. Great battery life.

I really, really, like the Cobra HyperSpeed. I have bigger hands, and the smaller size of the mouse doesn‚Äôt bother me one bit. It is a wonderful middle-ground device for gamers looking for a few more features than what you‚Äôd find on mice like the Viper V3 Pro and DeathAdder V4 Pro.
While the product has impressive specs and technology, the ergonomics are simply not there for me. The way it's profiled is very awkward.
The Razer Pro Click V2 Vertical is a comfortable mouse for productivity tasks, providing a good ergonomic design, but it feels a bit heavy for fast-paced gaming.
I've been using vertical mice for years, and Razer has delivered a fantastic ergonomic mouse with the Pro Click V2 Vertical, especially for those with joint issues.
The Razer Pro Click V2 Vertical is a well-built mouse, but its heaviness makes it difficult to maneuver quickly, particularly in gaming situations.
The Pro Click V2 Vertical has remarkable sensor performance and customization features through Razer Synapse, but the weight may be a hurdle for some gamers.

review_title: Good quality and feel. I am a brute
review_text: Have had it for about 3 months. Comfort for school work and premium feel for gaming as well. Smooth and ergonomic. The material is soft and light. I scratch as a habit and I managed to slightly chip the paint on the button. I would recommend this to a friend.

review_title: Razer's Answer to the MX series from Logitech
review_text: I've had just about every Razer mouse they've released. Mamba and most recently the 2.0 version of DeathAdder. This Pro-Click has really great battery life. I charge a couple times per week, but probably could get by with just one. Ergonomically, this is way better for my hand than my previous favorite the DeathAdder. Finish is kind of a shiny/matte plastic and still looks as good as the first day I received it. For me, this competes and beats the MX Master series from Logitech. A great compromise between ergonomics of the Logitech productivity mice and the gaming stuff from Razer.

This mouse is awesome, comfortable, and so smooth. Highly recommend. It's quite responsive and I'm definitely enjoying using it for work and play. The ergonomics also make it a great option for long hours at the computer.

review_title: Razer Synapse doesn‚Äôt work on the latest iOS for Mac
review_text: I really wanted to love this mouse. I do love Razer products, but I just don‚Äôt understand how they can not upgrade their app so it can be used in the latest iOS operating system. After I got the mouse I realized that the Razer Synapse driver doesn‚Äôt recognize my mouse. Their customer service said that the newest Razer Synapse 3.0 driver is only available for Windows and they don‚Äôt know when they will have it for Mac. Really? That is unacceptable from a big company like Razer.

This mouse was OK for the majority of the time I was using it. There were times where it had connection issues and took a little while to resolve, annoying but manageable. Out of the blue, however, it just died, no input registry whatsoever. The sensor on the inside will light up but will not register any input. I initially thought it was out of battery and connected it to my computer, but it wouldn't come back. I‚Äôm stuck with junk because I was unable to purchase the extended warranty with it.
After weeks of testing Razer‚Äôs Viper V3 Pro Faker Edition mouse, I‚Äôve confidently found my new favorite PC gaming accessory. The performance is top-notch and it feels incredibly light.
The mouse itself is perfect. It's light, has an amazing software interface, and boasts the best sensor on the market. The unboxing experience was great as well.

"The build quality is amazing ... zero creaks or sounds when squeezed or during normal use ... The clicks are all good with minimal side wobble on the mains ... For a mouse this light I am really impressed it seems like Pulsar have figured it out for this release at least."

"Coming from the Razer viper ultimate at around 74 grams to the X2 Crazylight at 35 is a surreal experience, the mouse is basically as light as a feather to pick up and move it almost seems like it's not even there."

"The Pulsar X2 CrazyLight is a mouse that satisfies a lot of the more recent trends in gaming mice. Crazy lightweight, 8K wireless polling rate out of the box, good coating, satisfying optical switches, no holes and a mini form factor."

"I used the g305 since launch until last week. Finally, I decided to upgrade to the pulsar x2 crazylight mini. The response and tracking are better than the g305, but the shape feels familiar. The g305 is heavy by today's standards."
"Pulsar back at it again with a banger release, they are on fire this time around with super exciting stuff. Can the X2 Crazylight be the best small light mouse? Let‚Äôs find out...."
"I got my EC2-DW in and that‚Äôs the one I‚Äôm going with. It‚Äôs absolutely perfect. Build quality is outstanding and the clicks feel phenomenal. Perfect shape and size for my hand too."

review_title: "Shape is perfect imo and there are 3 sizes to fit your hand no matter how big or small"
review_text: "The shape on my EC2 is perfect for me. I prefer this medium size version as perfection even for my large hands. I'm aiming great in CS2."
"The BenQ ZOWIE EC2-DW is a solid mouse with great build quality. It's very lightweight yet feels extremely tough. My only gripe is they don't make an ultra-light model."

"I‚Äôve been using Zowie mice for a long time, including the EC2-DW, and I can highly recommend them. They have great ergonomics and durability. I've never experienced any issues with the build quality."

"ZOWIE's EC2DW is impressive with great wireless performance. The sensor feels accurate and responsive, making my gaming experience a pleasure. The shape fits well in my hand, but I prefer lighter models."

The Lamzu Atlantis is a surprising entry; I‚Äôm very impressed with how well the mouse performed, especially as a first-time product for the company. It's likely already a Top 5 mouse pick for competitive gameplay.

review_title: Lightweight and Comfortable for Competitive Gaming
review_text: I really enjoy the Lamzu Atlantis mouse; it's lightweight at 55g and offers precise tracking. The symmetrical shape fits well in my hand for a great claw grip experience. The battery life is decent, and it performs well in FPS games.

While the Lamzu Atlantis is generally a good mouse, I found that the sides caused discomfort during long gaming sessions. My pinky ached after using it for a few hours, which is something I haven't experienced with other brands.

review_title: Best value gaming mouse for claw grip
review_text: For me, the Lamzu Atlantis wins by a landslide in terms of the mice I've had. It is just perfect for my pincer claw grip, and I have huge hands. I appreciate the lightweight feel and excellent performance during gaming.

I hated the sides of the Atlantis Mini; they made me tilt my grip to avoid cramping my hands. After using it for only a few hours, my pinky started to ache. The design could be improved for larger hands.

The shape of the mouse and the ergonomic aspect matches perfectly to me. It feels like your hand goes on and it fits perfectly to your hand. The quality of the mouse feels super high quality, and I swear, this is the best mouse you will ever have in hand.

Having used a lot of different mice, the Thorn just fit my hand like a glove. It's incredibly lightweight and the clicks feel amazing, making my aim consistent and my grip stable. The shape means that my aim in FPS games is no longer a problem for me.

review_title: Lamzu Thorn Review: Ultra-Light Gaming Excellence
review_text: Users rave about the comfortable shape, especially those with medium to large hands. The ergonomic design supports both claw and palm grip. The ultra-lightweight build allows for quick flicks and accurate aim, making it a great investment for gamers looking for an ultra-light, high-DPI, and ergonomically designed mouse.

The Lamzu Thorn has quickly become my favorite mouse for gaming and work. It fits comfortably in my hand, and I've experienced no issues during long hours of use. The click feedback is satisfying, and the design aids my gaming precision significantly.

Great shape for claw grip users, but the clicks can be a bit loud. The wireless functionality is solid, and the battery life is impressive. I would recommend it to gamers looking for a responsive and lightweight option, though those with larger hands might want to test it first.
This mouse was used right away and I am in love. It‚Äôs very precise, easy to navigate, and it‚Äôs helping me tremendously because I was starting to feel like I may have arthritis.

review_title: Great Feel, But Buggy Execution and Sleep Pop-Ups Ruin the Flow
review_text: I purchased the HyperX Pulsefire Saga Pro Wireless Mouse in late March 2025, specifically for its ‚ÄúInstant Pair‚Äù feature, which was advertised to work seamlessly with the Omen Max 16 laptop. However, it became extremely laggy when connected, and I encountered frustrating sleep pop-ups every time it woke up.
This is a great gaming mouse that fits well in my hand. My only complaint is that it isn‚Äôt as responsive as other brands. Overall seems like a good value.

Really enjoy the ease of use of this mouse. Battery life is solid, up to 90 hours, easily rechargeable. The customization of this mouse is what makes it a standout, and overall it's great for gaming and everyday work use.

First, this mouse is CRAZY lightweight. Features are everything you‚Äôd expect from a quality gaming mouse. It connects via Bluetooth once you install the software, but comes with a USB dongle if your device doesn‚Äôt have Bluetooth.
After more than 3 and a half years of daily use, the product is still as good as new. With a battery that lasts perfectly for very long periods.

review_title: Modular, but not the most comfy
review_text: First off, having the interchangeable side plates makes it awesome for switching between games that have different key bind needs, but I found that without a place to rest my thumb it became quite a stretch hitting the upper and forward most buttons. Second it was a bit short. I don‚Äôt have huge hands, but it felt like it.

review_title: Great for MMOs, but does take a lot of practice
review_text: Being able to use mouse buttons for skills and keyboard keys for things like targeting mobs and party members opens up a completely new flow. It took me a few days to figure out how to find the right button on the mouse, but now I am pretty accurate. I still have fumbles after some hours, but they are getting fewer by the day.

I've been using the Razer Naga series for over a decade. My first Naga lasted 6 years. My second lasted 2 months. I tried other mice, but ultimately had to come back. The Naga Trinity brings me back to my 6-year mouse, except much more responsive, and far better features. The 12 buttons dramatically change the gaming experience.

review_title: Best mouse I have ever owned.. hands down
review_text: It is fantastic. Response time is good and has 12 programmable buttons. I bought it for MMORPG's but it's really good for FPS games and others. Fits the hand very well. I have been super impressed with it.

I love this mouse. 3 face plates for different styles/needs. High DPI for large movements. RGB can be tuned and synced with other RGB applications. Great software. A little pricey compared to other mice, but definitely recommend. Will be looking into getting a wireless one as well!

review_title: Still working great after a year
review_text: The best desktop mouse ever. One mouse for multiple systems, multiple connectivity options, and customizable buttons to suit individual needs. Working while charging through USB is a plus!

I am so impressed with this mouse! It is extremely customizable and has really helped to improve my efficiency during work. The horizontal scroll wheel is great for video editing as well as Photoshop!

review_title: The button under the thumb is very awkward for me to use
review_text: I have one complaint holding me back from giving this mouse a 5-star review. The button under the thumb is very awkward for me to use. I think this is a matter of personal preference, but I still recommend it.

Great mouse, very comfortable especially if you use it for extended periods, and the battery life is also great. Programming all the buttons is super easy, and it works seamlessly across multiple devices.
I‚Äôve been using the MX Master 2S for a while now, and I love its comfort and battery life. It works well on various surfaces and has features that make my workflow easier.

I really like the mouse. It‚Äôs not the most ergonomic option but not bad at all. I really appreciate its versatility and sleekness in the design. Mine did stop working after a few days but I was able to get a replacement from Best Buy immediately and there have been no issues since.

The two main features of this mouse are the flexible body and the touch pad ‚Äúbuttons.‚Äù When traveling, you can flatten the mouse, and in doing so, it powers off. Great feature to save batteries and having to remember to switch off when running out the door. Good mouse, looks slick but a bit pricy.

review_title: Convenience and profile cannot be beat.
review_text: This is my second Arc mouse & I tell you what‚Ä¶ I doubt I will ever find any other mouse that works better for my needs. My favorite part is being able to store it inside the zipper pocket of my small planner. The connection never gives me issues and the batteries last for so long with this mouse.
Love how it feels in hand and excelente response to desired actions. It is ideal for traveling since it fits easily in my bag and is very easy to use.

review_title: Love the Microsoft Surface Arc Mouse
review_text: I really like my new Microsoft Surface Arc mouse. It is very easy to use and ergonomically designed. The mouse also is very easy to fit in my thin travel bag making it ideal for traveling.

review_title: My go-2 mouse that is perfect for gaming
review_text: And, with the fast ms response time for gaming, and contoured mold to your hand like a "glove" what more could you want? Oh, I prefer this than the wireless because its direct connection is better for gaming and less interference from radio frequencies. So, its cheaper than the wireless version, which is fine, if you dont do intense gaming.
Ergonomic and easy to use. I love the quick DPI change for aiming in shooters. Weight feels right. Great gaming mouse, great price!

Also having the dpi sniper switch to lower dpi when you hold it was a nice little extra but I ended up switching it to my mount key. Overall I love this mouse and am still using it with my brand new PC build. Also, the Logitech software is awesome and lets you download profiles other people have made for every aspect of this mouse.

Great mouse for the value. If you don‚Äôt have issues using wired peripherals, don‚Äôt hesitate to look into this one, especially for competitive gameplay. Highly customizable, easily adjustable weight, and the software isn‚Äôt the worst either. Highly recommend.

review_title: Best mice ever for the price
review_text: This is perfect! This is the smoothest mice I've ever used. Very comfortable. Easy to install and use it. The best part is the weight, you can put how much weight is perfect for you.

I had the original version of this mouse, the G900 that was getting a little worn out after nine years and losing battery life, but I really liked it so I was very happy to see that this G903 Lightspeed mouse has the exact same physical design but with updated modern internal components that give the mouse faster response time and lower latency than the G900, and I can really tell the difference, it's great!

My favorite mouse. I actually bought this to replace my last G903 that I wore out after 6 years of gaming. Enjoy the wireless freedom during fast gaming. The battery lasts weeks. Enjoy the placement of the programmable buttons and just a nice functional gaming mouse.
I love the compatibility and ergonomics of this little object. Super clean to use with ease. No regrets on the purchase.

I've been using this mouse every day since 2020, and I'm completely satisfied with it. The pluses: lightweight, robust, dirt-repellent coating, accurate sensor, imperceptible latency, small dongle; good battery life (1 week with backlight deactivated on G Hub) and 2 hours recharge time for a 100% charge. A great ally for games and office sessions.
I bought it because I'm on the move a lot and the battery does the job very well and doesn't take up too much space.

I tried the more recent "Superlight" model but it is really too light. So I settled on this excellent model, which deserves its accolades. The wireless works very well since I received it, the RGB is cool, ergonomics are pleasant, and the sensor is reliable. I recommend it, accurate in FPS and nice in MMO or RTS, a must have at home.

review_title: Excellent mouse for gaming and production work!
review_text: Excellent mouse for gaming and production work! I haven't been able to run the battery out because it's so efficient. I use it almost every day for hours on end, and never once has there been any lag or delay from the mouse to the computer. It's light, and quick to move around. You can change the sensitivity anytime with a click of a button (located just under the scroll wheel) Excellent mouse, highly recommend!

The Logitech G305 LIGHTSPEED is fast, responsive, and lag-free. The HERO sensor tracks smoothly, and the lightweight design makes it super comfortable. Battery life is amazing on a single AA. No RGB, but the sleek white look is a win. Perfect for gaming and everyday use‚Äîhighly recommend!

review_title: Absolutely amazing mouse for the price point
review_text: It promptly ousted my G502 as my go-to gaming mouse. It offers remarkable comfort, portability, and convenience of usage whether I'm playing a game or at the workplace. Not to mention, this mouse completely erased my wrist pains over the last year. I was truly impressed by its battery longevity, among other things.

This mouse is a beast. Super responsive, no lag at all thanks to the LIGHTSPEED tech. The 12,000 DPI HERO sensor makes it feel super smooth whether I‚Äôm gaming or flying through work stuff. It‚Äôs lightweight, clicks feel sharp, and battery life lasts forever (like months on one AA). Only downside? No Bluetooth and no flashy RGB‚Äîbut honestly, I‚Äôll take performance over lights any day. Solid 9/10. Would buy again in a heartbeat.

Overall, this is a great mouse especially for the price. I mostly play Valorant and Fortnite, and it performs really well in both games. It's lightweight, compact, and fits my hand perfectly (I have relatively small hands), so I really appreciate its smaller size. The only issue I've encountered is with the scroll wheel. Sometimes it double-scrolls, which can be frustrating.

I was skeptical about wireless mice, but the Razer Viper Ultimate changed my mind. It's lightweight, responsive, and the battery life is excellent! The customizable buttons and ambidextrous design make it perfect for any gamer. I play FPS games, and the performance is top-notch, no lag at all.

The Razer Viper Ultimate feels great in hand and is very responsive. However, I found the side buttons to be too sensitive, leading to accidental clicks during intense gaming sessions. The charging dock is a nice addition, but it would be perfect if the buttons had better placement or feedback.

I switched from a wired mouse to the Viper Ultimate and haven't looked back since. The wireless connection feels just as good as wired, and it's incredibly light. The RGB lighting is fun, and the charging dock keeps everything ready to go. Highly recommend it for competitive gaming!

review_title: Good features but uncomfortable for larger hands
review_text: While I appreciate the performance of the Razer Viper Ultimate, I have larger hands and find it difficult to use comfortably for extended periods. The mouse is responsive and works beautifully, but if you have larger hands, you might want to consider a different model.

The Razer Viper Ultimate has surpassed all my expectations. It's incredibly lightweight and comfortable, and the battery life is impressive. With its high DPI and smooth tracking, I can perform precise movements in all my games. Definitely worth the price for serious gamers!

Dominate your MMO gaming sessions with the Logitech G600 MMO Gaming Mouse, featuring a customizable button layout, high-precision sensor, and ergonomic design, providing comfort and precision for extended gaming sessions. The only downside is that it has a cable and lacks a wireless version.

I absolutely love this mouse and have been using this model since the early 2000s. I can't imagine using any other mouse and the price for what you get is unparalleled. I have 4 of these mice in my household. The g-Shift button is just so much of a game changer.
Excellent product. Works great and meets all my expectations. I particularly appreciate the number of programmable buttons. It makes everything more efficient during gaming sessions.

I can't say enough good things about the G600. It's large size is amazing for me, as it‚Äôs the first mouse I haven't had to claw grip. The third mouse button for your finger feels very nice, and once you get used to it, it's hard to go back to a normal mouse.

Somewhat larger than I expected, but still works well. Might not be an ideal choice for someone with smaller hands, yet it has many extra buttons on the side for macro use, which is a major plus for MMOs.
Excellent mouse, bought for a promotion, works quickly and accurately. You can choose any backlight, very pleased. I would recommend this to a friend.
Overall great gaming mouse with a lot of variable DPI settings depending on your gameplay sensitivities. I would recommend this to a friend.
Light and LED look nice, love that it is wireless. No random software needed; it worked with the signal RGB easily.

review_title: Great mouse but resistance wheel gets stuck
review_text: This mouse is probably one of the best I‚Äôve used. Feel wise, it‚Äôs awesome. The RGB is a nice touch as well. Although I wish the battery lasted longer.

Impressive wireless gaming mouse with excellent responsiveness, a comfortable ergonomic design, and a customizable experience. The optical switches feel crisp, and the 20K DPI sensor delivers precise tracking.

review_title: Good mouse but no charging dock is a bummer.
review_text: Overall, great mouse, the shape is wonderful, the sensor precision is fantastic. If it were a tad lighter, it would be perfect; however, that weight gives you a bit more precision upon a left or right mouse button click.

Amazing mouse for the price (when on sale). Super comfortable and feels quality. Only thing I'd say is if you were paying full price, I'd rather have the Logitech G604 for just a little bit more (or even the same price). But if you can get it on sale, absolutely.
Very fast and durable. I bring my laptop and this mouse just about everywhere. I have had this mouse for about two years, dropped it a few times, and it still works and looks brand new.

I purchased this mouse to replace my Razer Mamba that I bought in 2012 (that worked beautifully for 8 years!). I am personally a big fan of wireless peripherals, especially when there is no noticeable drawback in performance. This was an easy purchase for me and would highly recommend this to a friend.

Crazy good value for an entry wireless gaming mouse. When it goes on sale, just get one, it's a great backup, or even a main gaming mouse when you have a tight budget. Ergonomics are decent, and it's easy to change DPI.
Pretty responsive for a wireless mouse. The buttons on the sides work pretty well. I would recommend this to a friend.

The item is good itself, came in good packaging and everything you would expect. It glides very well, fits my hand well, but the way my ring finger and pinky sit at the side of the mouse is uncomfortable since it doesn‚Äôt have the inward design to it.

This is just going to be a short review going over some QC issues I‚Äôve had with the mouse. The removable shell had a TON of wobble, and the left M1 button felt awful. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this to anyone based on my experience.

review_title: Great work mouse for a gamer
review_text: I do not do wireless mice generally but wanted to get rid of the wire at work while still using a mouse I use at home. This was fantastic especially for the price point. Feels great and the battery is long enough to not worry about it.

review_title: Razer DeathAdder V2 X HyperSpeed Wireless
review_text: The Razer DeathAdder V2 X HyperSpeed is a fantastic gaming mouse! It's super responsive, lightweight, and fits perfectly in my hand. The battery life is incredible at 235 hours, making it perfect for gaming and everyday use‚Äîhighly recommend!

Welcome back Deathadder!! This version has fixed sensitivities, and the battery lasts forever. The positioning of the buttons is much improved, reducing accidental presses while gaming. Overall, it‚Äôs a great product for FPS games at an affordable price!

I love this mouse! So easy to use, connects so easy and quick! I use this mouse for my iPad since I use the Logitech Combo Touch with my iPad and it just works great with it. I love that it‚Äôs Bluetooth that way it easily connects without having to purchase extra cables to insert the mouse adapter that would usually help it connect to your device! It‚Äôs such a convenience, I would definitely recommend!

5 stars, no notes. An excellent little mouse to take with you when you're working on the go! I love the color, the option to use Bluetooth or the USB receiver to connect, comfort during use, and quiet click. I have the matching wireless keyboard and it makes a really great set.
My old mouse was big, bulky, and loud as ever. So I wanted to find a mouse that was affordable, fit perfectly in my hand and quiet. I got all that in this mouse. It is definitely a must have!!!
This has been with me for 2 years and I love that it is versatile. Can be connected via Bluetooth or USB. No noise when clicking and I never had a problem when I accidentally drop it.

I absolutely love this mouse. I only bought it at first because I needed a mouse that had a thin profile and wouldn‚Äôt take up too much room in my laptop bag on a business trip. Not only does it fit perfectly, but the pink color is perfect (and always draws compliments) and it‚Äôs so quiet!!! That was an unexpected benefit.

This mouse works well and feels great. The indentions on the buttons make it easy and comfortable to set my fingertips on them. The scroll wheel rolls smoothly and the wide textured surface provides a nice grip.

If you are debating between the Razer Viper Mini and the Glorious Model O, get the Razer Viper Mini. The Viper is cheaper, lighter, and doesn't have honeycombs. This mouse is insanely light for not having honeycombs and glides extremely smoothly.
Came from a G403 & DA Elite, and I have to say it's much smaller and lighter than both. It‚Äôs a good mouse that glides smoothly with their new mouse feet, and the sensor works perfectly for me.

review_title: Really good small light weight mouse.
review_text: The Viper Mini is a phenomenal mouse. The quality you‚Äôre getting for an extremely affordable price is shocking. 60 grams achieved with no holes makes this product a personal favorite of mine.
Right out the box, the mouse is super sturdy and lightweight. A claw grip is recommended, and all buttons were quite tactile. The RGB was great while the Razer software made it easy to customize.
The Logitech G PRO X SUPERLIGHT is an ultra-lightweight wireless gaming mouse that excels in performance. It fits comfortably in my hand and delivers exceptionally low click latency.

The Logitech G703 LIGHTSPEED is an exceptional gaming mouse that combines precision, speed, and comfort. Its LIGHTSPEED wireless technology delivers ultra-low latency, making it feel just as responsive as a wired mouse. The HERO sensor ensures pinpoint accuracy, whether you‚Äôre in competitive FPS matches or working on detailed creative tasks.

The Logitech - G703 LIGHTSPEED Wireless Optical Gaming Mouse is a good mouse. The sleek design and size of the mouse is perfect for working and gaming. The accuracy of the mouse is perfect and gives me precision for creating and editing designs.

review_title: Reliable mouse at a good price point
review_text: Pleased with this mouse. The battery life is excellent, and the device is fast and responsive. GHub software also makes customization easy. However, it does not have a storage compartment for the USB receiver, which can be a minor inconvenience.

I upgraded from a wired g502 spectrum and I couldn't be happier. The mouse weighs significantly less and makes it easier for me to flick on people. Not to mention the insane battery life of the mouse. The battery stayed charged for a week straight and had 16 percent at the end of it.

This mouse was great at first, but didn't survive a year unfortunately. As with many Logitech mice, this one inherited the dreaded double-click issue that plagues so many of this brand mice. It was great while it worked, but I cannot recommend it due to this problem.

review_title: So Good, I Bought It Three Times!
review_text: After having carpal tunnel surgery, I needed to find truly ergonomic products. This mouse has been an absolute game-changer. It's so good that I now own three of them‚Äîfor work, home, and travel! The trackball is incredibly responsive and the customization options are perfect.
Fantastic for someone who has any wrist pain from using a normal mouse. The different levels of angles lets you adjust to your most comfortable fit. Extra keys can be configured for custom actions.

I really love this mouse. It took a little practice to learn how to use it but it has been great. The trackball is effortless and has great optional buttons. The battery life is great. This is a must-have.

This was a great upgrade from a standard wireless mouse for me. I use 32" triple screens for sim racing, and navigating that amount of surface area was bothersome. Have limited room for a mouse pad I was constantly having to do the pickup and swipe to move the cursor across the width of the three screens.

I'm constantly accidentally hitting the Device 1/Device 2 button. It's also very easy to trigger the "Precision" button, making you think that your mouse has frozen. The wedge-shaped platform made to tilt the angle of the trackball is a stroke of genius.

I recently switched from the glorious model o- (wired) and switched to the wireless version for an upgrade. I love how it comes with everything you need!! From the dongle for the usb, to the cord to connect your mouse! I've had this mouse for about 2 months now, and can‚Äôt complain at all. For this I have to give this product 5 stars!

Fairly good build quality on the model I have (White Honeycomb Shell) but have heard of some QC issues. Beyond that, the software works fine and boasts 76 hours of battery life. If you are looking for something with a tad bit more weight but not too straining I'd recommend it. Beyond that, it seems to perform well in most games I played with it as well as Aim Trainers.

Wish the mouse was better. I'm on my third one in under two years as they keep failing. Pros: Very lightweight, good tactile feedback from the scroll wheel. Cons: Small battery, it takes double or triple the length of time to charge compared to other brands, horrendous software, faulty design with the scroll wheel. I highly recommend this mouse for gaming, but expect it to fail in less than a year.

review_title: Great for the money with a few compromises.
review_text: The switches took a few weeks to feel really tactile, and the right mouse button feels a bit different when you actuate it. I use it for work and gaming and don't use the lighting. I can get through the work week without charging but have to plug it in at some point on the weekend for a few hours.

review_title: Fantastic gaming mouse from a fantastic company
review_text: I love this mouse. Fits my hand perfectly and is very light. Glides like a dream. Worked with no issues. Build quality is good; however, I did have the wheel break. Called Glorious and they sent me out a replacement immediately - didn't even have to return the broken one. Great company, great customer service, great mouse. Highly recommend.

I just received the Cooler Master MM720, and it represents a proper direction for Cooler Master. It's incredibly lightweight at around 50 grams, has excellent build quality, and I love the way it fits my hand. Every curve is in the right place, making it an absolute joy to use during gaming sessions.

review_title: Great Lightweight Mouse for Claw Grip
review_text: The MM720 is very comfortable, especially for users with a claw grip. The lightweight design makes it easy to maneuver, and the optical click latency is top-notch. However, side buttons can be tricky to reach depending on your grip. Overall, a solid choice for FPS gamers looking for an ultra-lightweight mouse.

review_title: Impressive Performance at a Low Price
review_text: The Cooler Master MM720 is surprisingly effective for its price. It offers fluid movement and a super lightweight design. The build quality feels solid, and I appreciate the customizable RGB lighting options. However, the placement of the DPI button is an issue when trying to make quick adjustments during gameplay.

This mouse is unique in its design but feels great in the hand. The additional ring finger support is a game changer, and the sensor performs excellently. However, the shape might not suit everyone, especially if you're used to standard ergonomic mice. Overall, it's a fantastic mouse for its price.

The MM720 is the most comfortable mouse I've used. It fits my hand perfectly, and the lightweight nature allows me to game for hours without fatigue. The scroll wheel has a nice tactile feel, and the customizable features are a big plus as well. I love it for both gaming and day-to-day use.

I‚Äôve been using the Logitech G Pro X Superlight for a month, and I love the lightweight design; it's perfect for fast-paced gaming sessions. However, small hands may struggle with side button access.
The Pro X Superlight feels incredibly responsive with its HERO 25K sensor, and the slide quality is superb. My only issue is the lack of Bluetooth and RGB lighting.
I absolutely love my Logitech G Pro X Superlight! It‚Äôs lightweight, comfortable, and has amazing sensor accuracy. It‚Äôs not overly complicated, which is perfect for my gaming style.
The Logitech G Pro X Superlight is a solid mouse with great performance. However, for the price, I expected more features like RGB lighting and additional buttons. Still, it's very comfortable.
The Razer Viper 8KHz is a fantastic gaming mouse. It has a lightweight design, impressive 8000Hz polling rate, and excellent responsiveness, making it stand out from other mice.
The Razer 8K Viper Mouse delivers amazing performance that truly impressed me. It has great tracking accuracy and precision thanks to the 8K sensor.

review_title: Perfect mouse for medium size hands
review_text: Its optical switches are supposedly more durable and accurate, which is a plus. The cord is not stiff, and it doesn‚Äôt snag when playing games.
Dealing with multiple broken mice in about 1 year of use isn't worth the time or money. I won‚Äôt be going back to Razer products for a while.
The Best Mice for the money, the 8000 polling rate feels smooth, but it doesn't work with all games, and you need a really good PC for that.

I‚Äôve had Corsair mice and keyboards since I‚Äôve started pc gaming. I‚Äôll never go back. They feel great and they‚Äôre durable cause I can‚Äôt tell you how many beers I‚Äôve spilled on these and after a good clean they still work phenomenally.
I love this mouse but, the mousewheel notoriously breaks. I've become so dependent on the side buttons and I wish they'd restructure how the mouse wheel is made.
Works great, good amount of buttons on the side for MMO use and still feels decently light. ICue software can be confusing for setting up keybinds.
Little big but I have small hands. Love that the position of the buttons are adjustable. Makes the size difference almost negligible.

This mouse was a replacement for a previous Corsair mouse that had lasted for years! This upgrade was a great decision and we have not been disappointed! The DPI adjustments, buttons on the side, etc. are just perfect.

Great mouse, very responsive and looks great next to a white laptop or setup. The battery lasts a long time and you can choose double or triple A. No qualms with this mouse, I‚Äôve also dropped it off my bed onto hard floor about 20 times with no issue.

This mouse is light weight, fast, responsive and extremely well built. It has no downside that I can think of. It has long lasting battery life and is comfortable to use for productivity and gaming. Seriously, if you are looking for a less expensive great wireless mouse for your desktop or laptop computer, snag one of these. You won't be sorry. Heck, I'm even using it while writing this review!

review_title: I bought this mouse over Christmas
review_text: I bought this mouse over Christmas when it was on sale. It's my first wireless mouse and I'm glad I made the jump. It's quite light. It can use both AA and AAA batteries which is brilliant. I like the mousewheel, it's satisfying and doesn't collect dirt like my old Logitech mouse. My main gripes are that the mouse wheel doesn't have tilting and no endless scroll.

I have a G305 for my desktop and purchased this as a mouse for my laptop. I can honestly say that this mouse is much nicer than the competition and is regularly on sale at or below the price. It will be replacing my G305. I like that it has Bluetooth and 2.4ghz connections. It also can accept AA and AAA batteries!

As someone who spends hours on end gaming, having a reliable and high-performing mouse is crucial for me. The Finalmouse Starlight-12 Phantom is light as a feather yet sturdy enough for intense gameplay.

review_title: Great performance, but a few issues
review_text: While I love the lightweight nature of the Finalmouse Starlight-12, I have encountered some quality control issues, particularly with the scroll wheel being slightly off-center and the right-click button occasionally sticking.
The performance of the Finalmouse Starlight-12 is outstanding! Its lightweight design and sensor accuracy make it a joy to use in competitive gaming settings. It's like an extension of my hand.

I've had a love-hate relationship with this mouse. While the lightweight design and wireless functionality are fantastic, I'm concerned about the overall build quality, particularly the cheaper-feeling bottom shell.

The Finalmouse Starlight-12 delivers great battery life and impressive sensor performance. However, the lack of companion software for customization and some quality control issues are disappointing for such a premium product.
Impressively light and responsive. Fits in my hand very well, and the click and click resets feel great. Battery life is just okay, but I won't complain with how light the mouse is.
Excellent mouse. Low latency, solid build quality, and lightweight. The only downside is that the software isn't the most accurate for battery life reporting.
This mouse works amazing right out of the box. It's great for anyone with medium to large hands, but there's a software update issue that Glorious hasn't fixed yet.
Extremely responsive and very comfortable. I experienced a rare issue where the mouse can only be used when plugged in, but it‚Äôs a beautiful mouse overall.

I‚Äôve bought many Logitech mice in the past before but this mouse definitely takes the cake! Very light weight and its ergonomic shape helps while still able to retain a firm comfy grip! It‚Äôs wireless but there‚Äôs no latency connection if you use the USB dongle that‚Äôs also comes with, very responsive. I‚Äôd definitely recommend this mouse just based on it‚Äôs price, comfortability and sleek black design.

This mouse is an absolute game-changer for anyone serious about gaming or productivity. The ergonomic design ensures long-lasting comfort, even during marathon gaming sessions, and the precision of the sensor is simply unmatched. Every movement feels smooth and accurate, making it perfect for both FPS games and detailed design work. The customizable buttons and RGB lighting add a personal touch, and the build quality is rock solid. It connects seamlessly and has a reliable battery life, which means less downtime and more productivity.
Amazing mouse battery life is long lasting with just a AA battery fast responsive can be used either with 2.4ghz dongle included or Bluetooth hasn‚Äôt let me down at all connects instantly.
I have had about 20-30 mice the past 5-6 years. This one is by far the best wireless mouse I have owned. Battery lasts long, great sensitivity and build quality. BT or WiFi.

Very good mouse, tested to replace the previous one and adopted for its comfort! I put all the weights on right from the start and that's what suits me best, but the modularity is nice. I'm taking one star off for the price.

The Corsair M65 RGB Ultra Wireless strikes a fine balance between speed and control. Its comfortable design allows for long gaming sessions, and the customizable weights are a great feature. However, it may not be ideal for ultra-light mouse enthusiasts.

Overall, I'm very satisfied with this mouse. It's solid, precise, and as customizable as you like. The only downside is the iCUE software; it can feel more like a beta version than a finished product sometimes.
The mouse is very good and responsive, but I think the ergonomics could be improved. The heavy weight was not ideal for all users, even though the customizable weights are a thoughtful feature.
The battery life is excellent, and the performance is solid for FPS games. My only issue has been with the side buttons, which sometimes feel awkward to reach during intense gameplay sessions.
I have been using it for a month and I have no complaints about it. I would recommend this to a friend.
This is the only compact mouse that has a free scroll wheel and onboard memory... It feels responsive and the clicks are silent.
Overall this mouse is fantastic. The clicks feel so quality and they are so quiet. The side mounted buttons are very small and loud.

review_title: Silent clicks and scrolling - truly the best mouse
review_text: Best mouse ever made because it's the only one that has these features: Silent free scroll wheel, silent clicks, and works with 1 or 2 AA batteries.

review_title: Quiet‚Ä¶but not quite. Wait for v2

The mouse is extremely lightweight and perfect for my small hand. The charge time on one single charge would last me a month. Definitely recommend.

"The build quality of the Vaxee NP-01S is exceptional. It's well-constructed with a smooth finish, and overall, it feels very professional."

I can‚Äôt believe how much the Finalmouse Starlight-12 Poseidon Small has improved my gaming experience! The lightweight design and precise tracking make it perfect for fast-paced games.

review_title: Great little mouse for wrist issues
review_text: This is a great little mouse for those with wrist issues or those just wanting something different. I've used a couple different vertical mice before and got to liking them. However, once you do, these are really comfortable to use and do help out with any wrist issues you may have.

The Logitech Lift for Mac is an excellent ergonomic mouse designed for comfort and productivity. The vertical design is surprisingly comfortable, reducing wrist strain even during long work sessions. It pairs seamlessly with macOS via Bluetooth, and the customizable buttons are great for optimizing workflows. The mouse feels smooth and responsive, with precise tracking on various surfaces. Plus, it's compact and lightweight, making it perfect for travel.

I love my mouse! I have a pink one at home and this white one at work; it really does help your wrist, especially if you have to sit hours on the computer. I personally love it and it is easy to use, but other people that use my computer hate it because it can take them time to figure out the mouse.

I'm a graphic designer and I'm on the computer all day. I thought it would be difficult to get used to the style, but it wasn't at all and it's helped my elbow pain. I also like that I can keep it paired with multiple computers using a switch. Recommend!

Overall, this mouse exceeded my expectations. Quiet clicks, enough buttons for my workflow, cool features like horizontal scrolling and customizable extra button settings, and of course the ergonomic design.

review_title: Best ergonomic mouse on the market
review_text: Keeping it real and telling it how it is. If you like ergonomic mice, you're not going to find a better one than right here with the Pulsar Xlite V2. If your hands are big enough to dig the grip, at $80, it is a steal.

After testing various gaming mice, the Pulsar Xlite V2 stands out as the most comfortable and efficient option for FPS gaming. The ergonomic design fits my hand perfectly, and the lightweight build makes it easy to maneuver quickly. I can't recommend this mouse enough for serious gamers.

One star off because the software is convoluted and doesn't work as intended, for me at least. You're supposed to be able to set custom keybinds or macros to the buttons and save it to the internal memory of the mouse.

This mouse makes my existing mice, including one well known brand that I thought was already lightweight, feel heavy. Little to no effort is needed to move this mouse around, and the fact that it is cordless eliminates the tug from it being tethered.

Overall great mouse. The battery lasts about 70-80 hours with the RGB on, the weight is also about right. This mouse weights a little above 70g so if you are looking for a lighter mouse like the superlight or a honeycomb mouse this will not be for you.

I‚Äôve been a loyal fan of the Logitech MX Master Mouse, owning three generations of it‚Äîand for good reason. The near-silent clicks are a game-changer, especially during late-night editing sessions or noisy client meetings. Customization is great, and the battery life is incredible.

While the MX Master 3S has good ergonomics and a customizable design, I've experienced some inconsistent scroll behavior. It is ideal for productivity but not the best option for fast-paced gaming due to its weight and latency.
Ultra-light mouse! Very long battery life, DPI as advertised, very good value for money. It's perfect and everything exudes quality and attention to detail.

"I absolutely love this mouse. I never thought a more expensive mouse would make such a difference but WOW !!!! Amazing difference. My aim is seriously so much better."

review_title: Perfect||This reviewer received promo considerations or sweepstakes entry for writing a review.

The Razer Orochi V2 is a very good wireless gaming mouse. It's lightweight, feels well-built, and is ideal for a fingertip grip for medium or large-sized hands, though it's also suitable for smaller hands using a claw or palm grip. It connects wirelessly with its USB receiver or via Bluetooth and uses either a single AA or AAA battery. It also has extremely low click latency, a CPI with a wide range adjustable by increments of 100, and a low minimum lift-off distance.

While Razer has primarily been known for their flashy gaming accessories, the Orochi V2 is perfect for work and travel. It‚Äôs lightweight and durable, connects via Bluetooth 5.1 or Razer Hyperspeed Wireless, and provides great performance on both fronts. The battery life is substantial, and it's very convenient for those needing a portable option for both work and game.

The Razer Orochi V2 is excellent for both gaming and office use. It‚Äôs lightweight and the click response is great. I‚Äôve used it for diverse tasks from gaming to productivity, and it handles everything seamlessly. "I'm using an xm2we from Endgame Gear for a bit more than a year now and I'm very satisfied. Not sure about longevity but so far no issues."

This is truly one of the best mice I have ever used. The combination of low weight and ergonomic design makes it perfect for long gaming sessions. Functionality and aesthetics are on point with this mouse.

I‚Äôve been using the Pulsar X3 for a few weeks now, and it has quickly become my favorite mouse. The shape fits perfectly in my hand, and it performs excellently in competitive environments. Highly recommended!

Overall, the Attack Shark X3 has a decent overall shape and design that accommodates different hand sizes. Though it's best for causal play, I would not recommend it for competitive gaming due to slight click latency.

I‚Äôve used the Pwnage Trinity CF for months and it‚Äôs been fantastic. Extremely low click and sensor latency make it ideal for any competitive landscape, and it feels great in the hand even during extended use.

The Pwnage Trinity CF offers an amazing weight distribution and responsiveness. It connects flawlessly via the 2.4GHz receiver, and the weight-saving cutouts don't seem to compromise build quality much.

The ATTACK SHARK X3 felt decent at first, but I started noticing side-to-side wobble after a while. The overall build quality might be a hit and miss, so be careful if you're a heavy user.
For the price, the ATTACK SHARK X3 is an excellent gaming mouse. It has a great design, long battery life, and it feels better than many expensive options in the market.

I enjoy the EC2 for its comfort and precision. The only issue I've encountered is with the mouse feet, which could glide more smoothly.
The Zowie EC2 is a game changer for anyone serious about FPS gaming. It's designed to fit the hand perfectly and provides excellent control.

"When they say 'Huge', they most definitely mean huge. By far the largest mouse I've owned. The quality seems excellent. Buttons are plentiful and easy to reach. Control with the trackball becomes very good with a bit of practice."

review_title: Excellent mouse, except for loud clicks

If you prefer a smaller mouse or one that fits within your palm, this is not for you. Once I got used to its size and utilizing the extra buttons, it quickly became my favorite gaming mouse.
