This mouse is fantastic for any game that requires a lot of keybindings. The battery life is impressive, and the charging base is a nice addition to its durable build.
The ASUS ROG Keris Wireless is a lightweight and incredibly well-built mouse. Its ergonomic shape is perfect for fingertip gamers, and I love the low click latency for FPS games.
While the ASUS ROG Keris Wireless lacks in the number of side buttons needed for MMO gameplay, its performance is solid. The build feels high quality, and it operates very smoothly.
This mouse feels very well-built and has an ergonomic shape that is comfortable for extended gaming sessions. However, I wish the CPI could be adjusted in smaller increments.
I like the feel and responsiveness of the Keris Wireless, but I found the software to be limited in function. It‚Äôs decent for casual gaming but not a fit for competitive players.
Even though it‚Äôs a bit bulky, the ASUS ROG Keris Wireless is an excellent choice for travel. I enjoy using it both wired and wireless, especially with the convenience of Bluetooth support.
I bought this mouse, and to this day, I have no regrets. It has a grip on each side for very good hold. The size fits small and medium hands perfectly.

I've been using the Logitech G603 wireless mouse as part of my primary setup for over two years now and it‚Äôs still going strong. It provides a great wireless mouse experience without looking too flashy. Both have a powerful feature set with decent build quality while not being too expensive. Great product!

The G603 has a very comfortable design and is built with high-quality materials. The feature set is impressive, offering both Bluetooth and proprietary Lightspeed wireless connectivity. It fits nicely in my hand and provides excellent performance in games.

The battery life on the G603 is remarkable. Logitech claims up to 500 hours on high settings and it holds up well. I haven't changed the batteries in months despite daily use. The performance is great for both gaming and office tasks.

While the G603 is an excellent mouse overall, I find it quite heavy compared to other gaming mice. For fast-paced games, it can be a little cumbersome. It has a great sensor and connectivity options, still making it a decent choice.

review_title: Good for Both Work and Gaming
review_text: As a casual gamer, I appreciate that the G603 works well for long office hours too. The buttons are customizable, and it‚Äôs reliable. Although, I wish it had a lighter build and more buttons for gaming purposes.

Customers highly value the G403's lightweight design, ease of use, and comfortable size. It‚Äôs designed perfectly for prolonged use and the customizable features are a huge plus. Highly recommend for gaming and general use.

The G403 HERO mouse is my favorite because of its precise sensor and ergonomic design. It fits perfectly in hand and feels very solid. The DPI settings can be customized, making it great for FPS games.

This mouse has all the features a gamer could need including customizable RGB lighting and various DPI settings. It‚Äôs comfortable for long sessions, and the build quality is what you would expect from Logitech. Great investment!

I've had the G403 for a few months and while I love the performance, I've noticed the scroll wheel can be less responsive at times. It‚Äôs generally a solid mouse, but just small tweaks would make it perfect!

The G403 is amazing for gaming. The buttons are responsive, and it‚Äôs very lightweight which helps in long gaming sessions. The customizable settings through Logitech Hub are also fantastic. Overall, I believe this is a top-tier mouse.

review_title: Very Nice Mouse for Gaming and Normal Use
review_text: I really love this mouse! It does take time to get used to using it. Logitech is a good brand. This is the best mouse by far I have owned. It's fast and has great software that sets it up for cloth and hard surfaces.
Personally, this mouse is one of the best out there. It is amazing and since it‚Äôs wireless there are no cable issues! I would recommend this to a friend for its responsiveness and weight.
Coming from a G700s, this is an improvement in most ways. It's designed to be lightweight and the internal battery gets good life. One of the best sensors on the market.
Upgraded from the G502, and I notice no latency while in wireless mode. Buttons are responsive, and the ability to use it wired is very handy for long gaming sessions.
The G900 is an upgrade from my G502. I can‚Äôt live without the hyper-fast scrolling, especially in large documents. The customization options are excellent.

The G-Wolves Skoll SK-S ACE Edition is an amazing ultra-light gaming mouse. It's extremely lightweight, and it's among the lightest mice I've tested. It feels well-built and has a flexible cable which I appreciate for extended gaming sessions.

This mouse is great for FPS gaming, especially for its low click latency. It feels well-constructed and smooth-gliding, but gamers with extra-large hands may find it uncomfortable. Overall, an excellent choice for fast-paced games.

review_title: Great for smaller hands and palm grips.
review_text: The Skoll SK-S ACE Edition fits perfectly for palm grip users with smaller hands. It provides great control and responsiveness, making it ideal for gaming. The ergonomic shape is one of its best features.

review_title: Good but has minor flex issues.
review_text: The mouse is very lightweight and ergonomic, but I did notice some flex when applying pressure on the sides. Overall, it performs well, but the build quality could be improved for durability.

I've been using the G-Wolves Skoll for competitive gaming, and the performance has been flawless. The adjustable CPI and low lift-off distance help with precision aim, making it a great tool for any gamer.
The G-Wolves Skoll SK-S ACE Edition is comfortable and very lightweight, making it easy to use for long gaming sessions. However, it lacks a wireless option, which can be a downside for some users.

The build quality is solid, but the plastic feels a bit cheaper compared to other premium gaming mice. The performance is good with low lift-off distance, but it doesn't meet all expectations for hardcore gamers.

I love this mouse! It is lightweight and designed for maximum performance. The low click latency and customizable buttons make it my go-to for first-person shooters. Highly recommend it for anyone serious about gaming.

Very impressed with the G-Wolves Skoll SK-S ACE Edition. The lightweight design offers fantastic maneuverability, and it has a good build despite the lightweight construction. Ideal for competitive gaming.
It‚Äôs a good mouse with a great design, but I‚Äôve encountered some minor issues with comfort during extended use. The lightweight aspect is a huge plus for fast movements, though.
The Endgame Gear XM1 is easily one of the best mice I've used. The ergonomics are perfect for claw grip, making long gaming sessions more comfortable. Highly recommended for all types of gamers!
The build quality of the XM1 is impressive, and the sensor performance is top-notch. It's suitable for both gaming and everyday tasks, but I wish it had more customizable buttons for gaming.
While I enjoy the lightweight design and the way it feels in my hand, I find the XM1 to be lacking in additional features that other gaming mice offer. It‚Äôs functional but could be better.
The XM1 is superb for FPS gaming with its precise tracking and light weight. The shape is comfortable, but it may not suit everyone, especially those who prefer larger mice.
I love how the XM1 fits in my hand! The design is excellent for prolonged use, the sensor performs exceptionally well, and it just feels right during gameplay. I would definitely buy it again.

review_title: Good mouse, great for casual gaming.
review_text: I've had the Razer Abyssus Essential for a while now, and it's been a reliable mouse for casual gaming. It is lightweight and fits comfortably in my hand. However, it lacks some features found in more expensive models.

review_title: Decent, but not meant for pro gamers.
review_text: The Razer Abyssus Essential is a decent mouse for casual use. It's comfortable, but I found that it doesn't have enough precision or responsiveness for pro gaming. Good for beginners though.
I love the Razer Abyssus Essential. It's simple, effective, and fits comfortably in my hand for long gaming sessions. The tracking is consistent, and it's a great budget option for gamers.
The Abyssus Essential offers great value for the price. The build quality is solid, and it's lightweight. It might not have all the features of high-end mice, but it does the job well.

While the Razer Abyssus Essential performs well for basic tasks, it lacks modern features like programmable buttons and RGB lighting, which are common in newer models. It‚Äôs reliable but could be better.

The Sharkoon Light¬≤ 200 is a fantastic mouse, especially for gaming. It's super lightweight, which makes it easy to maneuver during intense gaming sessions. Just wish it had better software support for customization.

I‚Äôve used the Sharkoon Light¬≤ 200 for several months and love it. Great performance, comfortable grip, and quick response time. Truly an excellent mouse for both gaming and general use; exceeded my expectations.
The Sharkoon Light¬≤ 200 performs well in games, but the build quality feels a bit average. I noticed some flex in the mouse when I applied pressure. It‚Äôs still a good choice for budget gamers.
Overall, the Sharkoon Light¬≤ 200 is very comfortable for daily use and gaming. It provides good accuracy and the grip is commendable, but I experienced some occasional connectivity issues.
I absolutely love the Sharkoon Light¬≤ 200. The responsiveness is impressive, and it adapts well to different games. The ergonomic design makes it easy to use for hours without discomfort.

Been using a trackball mouse for years and wanted to update to a wireless. This is the only company I found making one usable for left-handed people. Easy set-up, no problems. Even included Energizer batteries and not some off-brand foreign kind. Price was very reasonable.

It was much more acceptable than I had imagined. This has many ways to program it to fit your personal needs and style. I am a techy geek and demand a lot of my equipment. I am predominantly left handed but do my graphics ambidextrously. I use the roller ball in my right hand and have my drawing pad in my left.

review_title: Not too bad for trackball enthusiasts
review_text: This trackball mouse is very comfortable in hand. Although the touch scrolling is innovative, it was not fine tunable for me. Additionally, I needed more buttons on the mouse. Overall a great mouse though.
This wireless trackball mouse is perfect for the office or your on-the-go office. Great battery retention. Rolls smoothly. Allows me to be productive.

Not as nice as the old Logitech Wireless Trackman. But those are selling "Used" on eBay for over $600 because of how popular they are and haven't been made in a long time. This was a good second choice for a wireless trackball.

review_title: MY NEW FAVORITE WIRED GAMING MOUSE!
review_text: I like this more than the Pulsefire Haste which was my previous favorite wired gaming mouse! The Gamesense Meta mouse has exceeded my expectations with its comfort and performance.
This mouse is great! It feels solid and responsive, making it one of the best I have used for gaming. Highly recommended.
I had some issues initially but the customer service was perfect. After getting the replacement, my mouse is working great and I am very satisfied.
The Gamesense Meta is a solid mouse with a good sensor and excellent switches. It's an impressive addition to my gaming setup. The build quality feels premium.
I have been using the Gamesense Meta for a while, and I can confidently say that it's fantastic for both FPS and MMO games. The accuracy is great, and it's comfortable for long sessions.
The SteelSeries Prime Mini is almost perfect for competitive gamers, but some design choices may not suit everyone. It feels lightweight, and the cable offers minimal drag.
This mouse performs well in gaming scenarios. The buttons are very responsive, but I wish the DPI switching was more accessible during gameplay.

review_title: Comfortable for Small to Medium Hands
review_text: The SteelSeries Prime Mini is surprisingly comfortable for longer gaming sessions, especially for those with smaller hands. The slight improvements in ergonomics make a noticeable difference.
The Prime Mini is lightweight and offers great control for competitive FPS titles like CS:GO. I'm impressed with the accuracy of its sensor.
I found this mouse very suitable for fast-paced games. It glides effortlessly on the mousepad, though it can take time to get used to its smooth mouse feet.
The SteelSeries Prime Mini has a solid build and feels great in the hand. It's lightweight, which makes it fantastic for fast-paced gaming.
If you have smaller hands, you'll appreciate the ergonomics of this mouse. It fits comfortably and is very responsive during gameplay.
The performance of the SteelSeries Prime Mini is very good. The buttons are nice and tactile, and I enjoy the aesthetic as well.
This mouse works well for me, but larger hands may need to be cautious about grip style. It's an overall solid choice for smaller users.
The SteelSeries Prime Mini works exceptionally well for FPS games, especially if you're using a claw grip. Just keep in mind the size if you have larger hands.

The DM6 Holey S offers a comfortable right-handed shape and is lightweight, but I experienced high click latency which affected my gaming performance. The build feels sturdy overall, but I had issues with the right-click button not registering clicks during testing.

This mouse is lightweight and suitable for various grip styles, making it comfortable for extended use. However, the high click latency is disappointing for competitive gaming. The drag of the cable is minimal, which is great, and it has a decent CPI range.

The Dream Machines DM6 Holey S is good for MMO gaming, but it lacks enough side buttons for a dedicated MMO mouse. It has great button customization options, and the mouse glides smoothly on my mousepad. However, it's wired-only, which limits its portability.

Overall, the DM6 Holey S is an impressive ultra-light gaming mouse; however, I found my unit had issues with the right-click failing to register clicks consistently. The software is decent for customization, but I wish I had more options for button assignments.

It's too bulky for travel, making it a hassle to carry around. While the mouse is generally comfortable and well-built for home use, the lack of wireless options is disappointing. Additionally, I found the quality control to be hit or miss based on my experience.

The DM1 FPS is a solid wired gaming mouse, offering good ergonomics and an ambidextrous shape that fits well for both right and left-handed users. However, it does have some quality issues, such as a loose scrolling wheel; overall, it performs well for FPS gaming.

I found the Dream Machines DM1 FPS to be a good option for gaming, but it doesn't have as many side buttons for MMO use. It's lightweight with a comfortable design, but the scrolling wheel could be improved for better precision.

I really like the design of the DM1 FPS. It's lightweight and provides good feedback on clicks. The ambidextrous shape works well with my grip, and the cable is flexible which is great for gaming without any drag. Highly recommend it!

While the DM1 FPS feels comfortable to use and has decent click latency, it lacks some features I expected. There's no way to adjust lift-off distance, and the software is rather basic and doesn't allow for custom profiles.

The DM1 FPS has a nice build, but I encountered some flex in the body. The scroll wheel feels a bit loose, and the side buttons sometimes actuate unexpectedly. It's a decent mouse if you can overlook these minor flaws.

The HP OMEN Photon Wireless Mouse works beautifully, providing a seamless experience whether wired or wireless. The multi-color changing feature adds a nice touch, making it visually appealing as well. Very satisfied with my purchase!

I really appreciate the versatility of the Omen Photon mouse. It provides solid performance in both charging modes and offers customizable options through the software. The only downside is the lack of Bluetooth capability, but it still meets my gaming needs.

This mouse has turned out to be a delightful addition to my gaming setup. The responsiveness is fantastic, and the ability to customize settings is a huge plus. Using it with my Omen laptop was simple and efficient.

I've been using the HP OMEN Photon for a while now, and it really exceeds my expectations. The mouse fits comfortably in my hand, and the RGB features are a great visual bonus. Definitely worth the investment!

Unfortunately, my experience with the OMEN Photon was not great as it stopped working the same day I purchased it. The buttons often stick, and I found it glitchy. Very disappointed with this product!

The HP OMEN Photon is simply amazing! It works seamlessly for my gaming and other tasks. The wireless functionality is a big plus, and it charges quickly, which I greatly appreciate. Highly recommend it!

This mouse offers great performance for gaming, though it feels a bit heavier than I anticipated, which could be a consideration for long hours of use. Other than that, the responsiveness is excellent.
I love the customizability of the HP OMEN Photon mouse. It offers quick changes and great responsiveness for gaming. Just wish it had built-in Bluetooth for easier connectivity.
The HP OMEN Photon mouse has proven to be a fantastic addition to my gaming setup! The customizable features and aesthetic appeal are great. Wireless charging is very convenient as well!
I‚Äôve had a very frustrating experience with the OMEN Photon mouse. It often glitches, and the buttons can get stuck very easily, making it hard to recommend this product. Disappointed overall.
I really like the aesthetic of the AORUS M5 mouse; the RGB lighting is vibrant and easy to customize. The performance is stellar with the sensor being incredibly responsive, great for gaming.
The build quality of the AORUS M5 is very good. It feels solid and well-constructed in hand. However, the software could use some improvements for better usability.
The adjustability of weight and DPI settings makes this mouse a great choice for any gamer. The ergonomic design fits comfortably in my hand during long sessions.
While the mouse hardware is fantastic, I found the AORUS Engine software to be less than intuitive, which detracts from an otherwise great experience.
The performance of the AORUS M5 is top-notch. There's no lag or jitter during gameplay, and the response time is perfect for competitive settings. Highly recommend!
The HK Gaming Mira-M is an excellent lightweight gaming mouse that feels well-built overall. Its ambidextrous shape is well-suited for all grip types and nearly all hand sizes.
The HK Gaming Mira-M is decent for MMO gaming, but it doesn't have nearly as many side buttons as a dedicated MMO gaming mouse.
The HK Gaming Mira-M is an excellent ultra-lightweight gaming mouse. It has a comfortable ambidextrous shape well-suited for all grip types and nearly all hand sizes.
The HK Gaming Mira-M has some known quality control issues including a slight wobble in the scroll wheel and noticeable side-to-side movement in the left- and right-click buttons.
It has a flexible paracord-like cable and feet that glide very smoothly, making it feel well-built and comfortable, although small hands might have trouble reaching the side buttons.
The MSI Clutch GM30 is light, comfortable, and has cool RGB lighting along with two responsive side buttons. It's not expensive, making it a good deal for gaming.
The ROCCAT Kain 100 AIMO is an excellent gaming mouse with a user-friendly design and intuitive control. It's perfect for long gaming sessions and very responsive.
The Redragon M601 RGB Centrophorus is a great value. It‚Äôs comfortable, came with weights for customization, and performs well for gaming. A solid option for anyone.
I'm satisfied with the Redragon M601. It's lightweight, programmable buttons are helpful, and the backlighting is an attractive addition overall for its price point.
This mouse has great ergonomics, the side buttons are useful, and the weights allow for great customization. It works well for gaming or everyday use alike.
Surprised how much I enjoy using the Redragon M601. Comfortable fit and solid response time, although the click latency is higher than I'd prefer for competitive gaming.
For my first gaming mouse, Redragon M601 fit the bill perfectly. Good design and decent performance for gaming, I'd definitely recommend it to newcomers.
I'll give it 5/5, but only because it did deliver what it promised. I wish they had a few more features on it. The sensor is great and tracks perfectly.
There's a lot that's not perfect about the Revel, but it has killer performance with the 3360 and a very low input delay. However, side buttons are a major flaw.

The Roccat Kone Pure Ultra is a fantastic mouse for claw grip enthusiasts. It's ergonomically designed and incredibly lightweight at 66 grams. I've enjoyed the soft touch and accurate button presses during gameplay.

review_title: Great Shape but Clicks Could Be Better
review_text: The Kone Pure Ultra has excellent ergonomics for claw grip users. However, the mouse clicks feel a bit heavy for my taste and require more pressure than I'd like, which can interfere with my gameplay.
I love the lightweight design of the Kone Pure Ultra. The accuracy with the Owl-Eye sensor is impressive, providing great performance during intense gaming sessions.
This mouse fits very well in my hand, particularly for long gaming sessions. The design is attractive, and it glides smoothly on the mousepad, making it an excellent choice for FPS games.
I had high expectations for the Kone Pure Ultra, but I was disappointed with the side buttons' placement. The mouse feels great overall, but those buttons are hard to reach.
It‚Äôs comfortable to use over long sessions without feeling fatigue. The buttons are well placed, enhancing overall gameplay without any awkward reaches.
The Kone AIMO Remastered features a solid build quality and good ergonomics, making it comfortable for extended use. I've enjoyed the customization options available through the Swarm app.
I've had the Kone AIMO for a few weeks now, and the customization options are fantastic. The RGB lighting is vibrant, and the mouse feels great while gaming.
This mouse is larger than I expected, which is great for those with bigger hands. However, it may not be suitable for small hands since it feels somewhat bulky.
The Kone AIMO is a good all-around mouse but doesn't excel in any particular area. It works well for FPS and MOBA games, but I wish it had more programmable buttons.
The Kone AIMO is a worthy successor to the original Kone. Beautifully designed and very responsive, it's perfect for serious gamers looking for an edge in competitive play.

The ROCCAT Kain 200 AIMO is my new main mouse. The build quality feels solid, and I love the Titan Click buttons. They are the best I've ever tried. It fits perfectly in my palm grip, making it very comfortable for long gaming sessions.

After switching from the Viper Ultimate, I found the Kain 200 to be an excellent choice. The ergonomics are great; it feels nice in hand, and the sensor performance is on point with no lag during intense gaming. Highly recommended for palm grip users!

The shape of the Kain 200 AIMO fits well for my hand size, and the buttons provide good feedback. However, I had some initial trouble with the gliding feet on certain mouse pads. Overall, it's a high-quality product for the price.

While I appreciate the aesthetics and the initial feel of the Kain 200, I found that the stock glider pads are subpar. They can feel like they drag across some surfaces, which detracts from the otherwise smooth experience.

The Kain 200 AIMO has been fantastic so far. The buttons feel responsive, and the battery life is impressive. The RGB settings are a nice touch as well. Overall, a great wireless mouse for both gaming and casual use.

I was surprised with the performance of the Mad Catz R.A.T. 2+. For such a budget-friendly mouse, it handles gaming well and feels fairly comfortable. The adjustable design is a unique feature that sets it apart from others.

The Mad Catz R.A.T. 2+ offers adjustable features, which I love, but the buttons can be a bit too stiff for my liking. It took me some time to get used to the ergonomics as well, but it's decent for casual gaming.

My experience with the Mad Catz R.A.T. 2+ has been great! The tracking is right up there with more expensive mice, and it feels comfortable during long gaming sessions. Highly versatile due to its adjustable parts.

I really like the shape of the R.A.T. 2+, it fits well in my hand and doesn't cause fatigue. The sensors work flawlessly, and it has a nice solid feel while gaming. Just wish it had more customization options.

The Mad Catz R.A.T. 2+ works adequately for gaming, but I found it a bit heavier than other alternatives. The built quality is good, but I expected better sensor performance on lower sensitivity settings.
Cooler Master is stepping up their quality with the MM530. It's great for gaming due to its comfortable shape and good grip, though it may feel slightly budget compared to premium options.
I found both the MM520 and MM530 to be good entry-level gaming mice, providing decent performance and comfort for those looking for affordable options.
The PMW 3360 sensor in the MM530 performs well, allowing for accurate tracking during gameplay. It has a comfortable design, particularly for palm grip users.
While the MM530 is functional and performs adequately, I noticed that the materials feel cheaper compared to other high-end gaming mice.
I would recommend the Cooler Master MM530 as it's a solid choice for gamers on a budget. It has good tracking and a comfortable grip.

review_title: Amazing Mouse at a Great Price
review_text: The ASUS ROG Gladius II Core delivers excellent performance and customization features for gaming without breaking the bank. Recommended for serious gamers.
The ergonomics on the Gladius II are exceptional, making it comfortable for long gaming sessions. It tracks accurately and has great button feedback.
This mouse suits a variety of grip types and hand sizes, providing excelente feedback and control during intense gaming moments, and the RGB lighting is a nice touch.
I pair the Gladius II with my other ASUS gear, and the ROG Sync feature performs wonderfully. It's a great all-around mouse for serious gamers.
The ability to replace the switches on the Gladius II is a fantastic feature. It allows for personal preference to keep the feel exactly how you like it.
The ASUS ROG Keris II Ace is one of the best mice I've used. It‚Äôs lightweight, comfortable, and fits perfectly in my hand with excellent grip.
The mouse feels well constructed with a comfortable shape. It allows for fast movements and precision, essential for competitive gaming.
I appreciate the lightweight design of the Keris II Ace. The sensor responds quickly, making it suitable for FPS games without any latency issues.
The sensor's accuracy is top-notch, providing reliable tracking on both hard and soft surfaces, making it my go-to choice for gaming.
The HyperX Pulsefire Raid offers excellent performance without being overly expensive. It's comfortable and allows for quick action during fast-paced gameplay.
I love the programmable buttons on this mouse. It makes it easier to play MMO games since I can set up my skills efficiently.
The Pulsefire Raid feels sturdy and built to last. I've had no issues with durability, despite extensive use during intense gaming sessions.

It has adjustable weights at the bottom suited for any type of muscle memory, full RGB lights on the logo and by the scroller, and it also has the neat RGB on the DPI selector which is quite cool. Quality is top-notch as you can expect from Corsair.

One of the best feeling mice I've used in a long time. The DPI is crazy high at 12K and the software Corsair provides is excellent. It allows for extensive customization of settings, making it ideal for any gamer.

This mouse is awesome, very well made. It has a nice weight to it and it's great for large hands. The build quality is remarkable, and it's a great compliment to the other Corsair RGB products in my setup.

Another great product from Corsair. Fits nicely in the hand and the adjustable weights are fantastic. The surface calibration is unmatched, and I love the customizable RGB zones. Just an all-around excellent gaming mouse.

If you're looking for a mouse for gaming or casual work, get this! You can feel the quality in this mouse and the RGB lights really pop. I am extremely satisfied with my purchase and would recommend it.

The BenQ ZOWIE S1 is a solid gaming mouse that's built to last. I find it comfortable for palm grip, although it might be a bit challenging for those with smaller hands. The click latency is great and it glides well on mousepads. However, I wish it had more customizable settings.

While the ZOWIE S1 feels well-constructed, it doesn't cater well to smaller-handed gamers. The buttons are slightly hard to reach for claw grip users. It performs decently in FPS games, but the cable could be more flexible. Overall, it's good but not perfect for everyone.

The S1 is excellent for FPS gaming! The shape feels great for palm grip, and the click response is solid. I've had some minor issues with the stiffness of the cable, but that's not a dealbreaker. Overall, it's a reliable choice for serious gamers.

I really like the feel of the ZOWIE S1, but I was disappointed with the lack of customization options. With only four default CPI settings and no software, it feels a bit limited for my preferences. It's a good mouse, just not very adaptable.

The S1's design is comfortable, especially for larger hands. However, I found it to be heavier than I prefer for an FPS mouse. The glide on the mousepad is nice, but the cable stiffness affects the overall experience a bit.

The BenQ ZOWIE ZA13-B offers a comfortable grip for gamers who like to use claw grips. The ambidextrous design is really handy, making it suitable for both left and right-handed users. It's light to move around, which enhances my gaming experience significantly.

I‚Äôve used the ZA13-B for a few months now and it‚Äôs fantastic. The build quality feels premium, and the optical sensor is accurate, which has improved my aiming significantly. The lack of software is a non-issue for me. I love its simplicity.

This mouse is great for competitive gaming! The ZA13-B feels sturdy and has low latency, allowing for quick reactions. I‚Äôve had a good time using it with various gaming genres, but it might not be the best for long hours due to grip fatigue.

While I appreciate the build quality and performance of the ZA13-B, it lacks the additional side buttons that I am used to in other mice. It works well for FPS games but is somewhat limited for MMO gaming. Still, it‚Äôs comfortable and responsive.

The ZA13-B is a reliable mouse with great design. It's easy to adjust DPI settings and feels good in the hand. My only complaint is the weight; it feels slightly heavier than I anticipated. Overall, a solid choice for gamers.

The ZOWIE FK2-B is an exceptional gaming mouse. I love its symmetrical shape, which fits well in my hand. It makes intense shooting games more enjoyable due to its accuracy and quick response time. My only issue is the cable could be less rigid.

Switching to the FK2-B really improved my gaming sessions. It‚Äôs very lightweight and glides smoothly over my mousepad. The ambidextrous design works perfectly with my grip style, making me more comfortable during long hours of play. Highly recommend for FPS players!

I tried the FK2-B and while it performed well, I found it too small for my hands. It feels well built, but for those with larger hands, I'd recommend the FK1 instead. The latency is great, but I struggled with grip comfort.

The ZOWIE FK2-B has a great design and feels excellent during gameplay. However, it lacks customization options as it does not come with software. The default CPI settings are fine, but I would have preferred more flexibility for my gaming style.

The FK2-B is a solid choice for casual gamers. It has a good grip and navigates smoothly. While I found it suitable for FPS games, I felt it could be improved for MMO games due to the limited number of buttons. Overall, still recommendable.

The BenQ ZOWIE FK1+-B is perfect for larger hands! The low-profile design and well-placed buttons make it easy to use during long gameplay sessions. It feels sturdy and responsive, which has really improved my gaming performance. Highly recommend for serious gamers!

I found the FK1+-B to be comfortable and reliable for FPS games. It has a smooth glide on mousepads, although the weight is a bit more than I expected. A solid mouse that performs well in competitive environments and is great for palm grip users.

The ZOWIE FK1+-B feels good and has low click latency, but I wish it had more customization options. The cable is pretty rigid, which can be distracting during gameplay. Still performs well in fast-paced games; just not the most adaptable mouse.

Really happy with the performance of the FK1+-B. It‚Äôs perfect for first-person shooters! The build quality is impressive, and it responds well during intense moments. The only downside is the lack of wireless option; it could be improved for on-the-go use.

This mouse is incredibly robust and feels durable. The FK1+-B has a nice weight to it, and I appreciate the responsiveness during gameplay. I largely play FPS games, and I've noticed considerable improvement in my aim. It‚Äôs a fantastic choice overall!

The BenQ ZOWIE ZA11-B is a well-rounded mouse suited for all grip types. It's comfortable for long gaming sessions, and the build quality feels solid. The response time is quick, making it great for competitive gaming. However, larger hands might prefer a bigger option.

I've been using the ZOWIE ZA11-B for a few months, and I love it. The sensor is very reliable, and I noticed better tracking compared to my previous mouse. It adapts well to different games, especially FPS, and feels great in hand.

The ZA11-B has an effective design that works well for both casual and serious gaming. It glides smoothly over various surfaces, and the buttons respond quickly. My only minor complaint is that it could use additional side buttons for more functionality.

The ZA11-B is an excellent mouse for gaming, but I wish it had more customizable features. The default settings are good, but I would like the option to tweak more aspects for my specific gaming style. Still a solid mouse, just limited customization.

I appreciate the sturdy build quality of the ZOWIE ZA11-B. It feels like it will last for a long time and doesn't flex during use. The overall performance is solid for FPS games; however, it might not be the best for MMO gaming due to fewer functions.
Great mouse! Love the colors and feels very smooth. Buttons aren‚Äôt too loud. I would recommend this to a friend.
Works as it should. Nice and light. Glides like butter on a quality mouse pad. RGB is a cool touch. I would recommend this to a friend.
It's a pretty good mouse .. actually better than I expected for the price..it's lightweight..looks nice. I would recommend this to a friend.
The Roccat Burst Pro is a nicely put together gaming mouse. It's very light, ergonomic, responsive, and fast. However, the software has some issues.
I am a mouse/peripheral enthusiast with a lot of experience. This mouse is extremely comfortable and natural. At 68g, it's one of the lightest mice I've tried.
Great mouse...The price is a bit high, considering material used, but it‚Äôs one of the better mice on the market. The mouse is smaller than other mice.
If you don‚Äôt mind the holes in the design, the SteelSeries Aerox 3 is a well-built and sturdy gaming mouse, but rivals have more advanced sensors.
The SteelSeries Aerox 3 is very lightweight, responsive, and offers great performance during intensive gaming sessions. I really enjoy using it on FPS games.
This mouse has met all my gaming needs. Lightweight, comfortable to grip, and has fantastic sensor performance for competitive gaming. Highly recommended!
The SteelSeries Aerox 3 has excellent performance, although it's smaller than other mice. My larger hands slightly struggle with grip, but I still enjoy it.

review_title: Great for Strategy and MMO Games
review_text: Great gaming mouse, but a little bit huge and heavy. Once I got used to the size and utilizing the extra buttons, it quickly became my favorite gaming mouse.

Excellent wireless performance with low click latency and customizable buttons. However, I find the weight to be a bit too much for lengthy gaming sessions.
A very well-built mouse suitable for office work. However, it is quite bulky and not ideal for users with smaller hands. Overall, a solid purchase.
The buttons are a bit tricky to access if you have medium-sized hands. The overall design is appealing, but I expected a better use of space for the controls.
I have been using the Expert Mouse for a very long time. The wireless version connects easily, and I love being able to customize the buttons.
My first encounter with a Kensington Trackball was in 1994. The new wireless version makes switching between my laptop and PC a breeze. Very ergonomic and comfortable.
This is my third purchase of this mouse. Each has lasted for several years of daily use. The customizable buttons are a fantastic feature.
The large ball and scroll ring make navigating so smooth. However, setup for the software can be a bit complicated. Overall, very happy with the product.
This mouse has made a huge difference for my hand comfort while working long hours. I highly recommend it for anyone suffering from wrist pain.
The SteelSeries Rival 600 has outstanding ergonomics and excellent performance. However, its weight may not be suitable for everyone, especially during travel.
The customization options available are impressive, but the mouse is relatively heavy. It's a great choice for serious gamers looking for a wired option.
While the build quality is excellent, I found it quite heavy for prolonged use. It performs well with low latency for gaming sessions.
The Rival 600 is fantastic for FPS games with its responsive clicks and comfortable grip. It's a wired mouse, which is great for consistent performance.
The ergonomics are outstanding, but if you have small hands, this mouse may not be the best fit for you. The features are well thought out.

I have this mouse for about 1 year at first I had software problems but I fixed them and now that I can change the dpi, program the keys and changing the colors I really love it for a mouse that weighs 125g it's great it might be on the heavy side but it's again great.

This has been the best mouse I have ever purchased. With the interchangeable plates for both sides and the simple to use software to be able to configure the button, this mouse is a must have! The only minus I would say is that the cord can seem to be stiff but easy to work around.

My overall experience is great! I have used this mouse for 1 day and loved every second of it. ALL the buttons are completely customizable. The light patterns are customizable once you have downloaded the software. Definitely top-end, 10/10.

review_title: Great Ergonomics for a Good Price
review_text: I found this mouse to be comfortable for a palm grip for medium and large hands. The different side panels are useful, and I appreciate being able to customize the RGB lighting and DPI settings. However, its wired click latency can be a downside for competitive gaming.

The Havit HV-MS760 is well-built with swappable side panels, but the wired click latency is quite noticeably higher than other gaming mice I've used. Ergonomically, it's only suitable for medium to large hands, which may not be the best for everyone.
I've had this mouse for a little more than a week now, it feels good to the grip. I like the 2 extra modular parts for it, and its sensitivity options. I would recommend this to a friend.

The Logitech G915 LIGHTSPEED is inherently luxurious with its low-profile mechanical switches. It offers exceptional performance for gaming while maintaining a sleek design that looks great on any desk.

If you‚Äôre like me, you messed around with every mouse on display at the store until you found the right one. Well, this is the one. Corsair‚Äôs Glaive Pro is the perfect size and weight, comes with 3 interchangeable thumb grips, and 2 mouse buttons to bind to any action in any game you‚Äôre playing.

Excellent speed, comfortable grip with 3 different thumb rest options included that are attached by strong magnets for easy changeover. Using the free downloadable ICUE software from Corsair, you can customize the lighting to your liking and also configure all the buttons as well as the cursor speed. By far the best mouse I've ever used. A must buy for gamers and at home workers alike. I would recommend this to a friend.

It works great, fits my hand well. It comes with two different grips for it. The 5 lights on top indicate how fast your mouse pointer moves on your monitor. You can control the light color using the ICUE program on Corsair's download. I would recommend this to a friend.

I had been looking for a mouse for a long time and I absolutely love this mouse! It's really sensitive and comes with a lot of customizable options. It‚Äôs very comfy in your hand when you're using it. I would recommend this to a friend.

The Corsair Nightsword is a comfortable gaming mouse with RGB lighting and an ergonomic design thanks to its slanted shape with a thumb rest. However, its sensor is quite inconsistent; it overshoots when moving the mouse fast and undershoots when moving it slow.

While the Corsair Nightsword RGB has a comfortable shape and thumb rest, it isn't recommended for people with small hands, as it‚Äôs a bit big. The sensor's consistency seems off, and the latency is slightly higher than most wired gaming mice, but it still offers decent performance.

The Corsair Nightsword's cable is a bit stiff and catches on desk supplies easily. However, it has great customization options through the iCUE software and is well-built, making it a solid choice for gamers who prefer a heavier mouse.

The Corsair Nightsword works surprisingly well for whip aiming, especially in shooters. Its adjustable weight system with six drop-in weights allows it to cater to a wide range of preferences, though it feels a bit heavy even without added weights.

I found the ergonomics of the Corsair Nightsword to be well thought out, especially for claw grips. The RGB lighting is a nice touch, and the performance is generally reliable, even if a few buttons feel a bit wobbly.

I bought a SteelSeries Rival 710 and it was dead out of the box. This Corsair Glaive RGB is as good if not better than the SteelSeries. It fits well in my hand and features responsive buttons, perfect for gaming.

Overall, I have been very pleased with the Corsair Rival 710. The performance is great, and it competes well against other gaming mice. It feels sturdy in the hand, and the RGB customization options make it fun to personalize.

I've found the Corsair Rival 710 to be incredibly comfortable for long gaming sessions due to its lightweight design and ergonomic shape. It has good build quality but the software could use some improvements.
This mouse works well for a range of genres like FPS and MMO games. The sensor is responsive, and handling feels natural in my hands. Try it out if you want something in the competitive range.
The Corsair Rival 710 has held up well over time. It offers decent DPI settings and customization through software. The side buttons are useful, though the mouse wheel could be improved.

The Dell Alienware AW610M is a well-built gaming mouse that performs well, but it's heavier than I expected. It has great ergonomics and a decent sensor, making it suitable for extended gaming sessions.

While the Dell Alienware AW610M has a solid design and customizable features, I found its battery life to be average at best. It charges quickly but doesn‚Äôt last as long as I would‚Äôve liked during use.
The Alienware AW610M has a comfortable grip and nicely designed RGB lighting. It feels good in hand, but the software for customization can be a bit cumbersome to navigate at times.

I was initially unsure about the ergonomics of the AW610M, but after some usage, it feels very comfortable for long gaming sessions. However, the weight can affect quick movements in fast-paced games.
The Dell Alienware AW610M has exceptional response times and a responsive sensor. The customizable buttons and RGB settings make it a perfect choice for any gamer looking for reliability.

I was excited to try the Corsair M55 RGB Pro, but it felt cheap and didn‚Äôt perform as expected. The eight programmable buttons are somewhat misleading as they are not all easily accessible, making customization awkward.

The Corsair M55 RGB Pro is an average mouse that doesn't stand out much from its competitors. It's comfortable in hand but lacks the features that higher-end models have. Not a bad option, but I expected more.

For everyday use, the Corsair M55 RGB Pro works fine. The sensitivity is decent, and it has a solid feel while gaming. However, serious gamers might want to look for something more responsive and feature-rich.

The M55 RGB Pro is just a basic gaming mouse that offers some nice features, but not much else. Its RGB lighting is limited and the overall design feels rather plain compared to other gaming mice on the market.
One issue I had with the Corsair M55 RGB Pro is its software. It can be glitchy, causing issues with saving button layouts and DPI settings. It's disappointing for a product from such a known brand.

I was on a Sensei Raw, very happy with it but I wanted to change to a more ergonomic mouse... I naturally stayed with Steelseries, and went for the Rival 310. The least I can say is that I am VERY happy :) Perfect ergonomics, the grip is great, ultra precise and the steelseries engine is still great for customizing the beast.
Nothing to criticize...perfect sensor, perfect ergonomics, sober drivers...THE mouse for right-handed people...so it has the luxury to be better than a zowie...a big BRAVO to SteelSeries!

review_title: Even better than the Rival 300? Yes, it is possible!
review_text: As a former owner of a Rival 300, I can confidently say that this Rival 310 is incredibly light and you can feel the difference. The coating is very pleasant to the touch and the clicks are made naturally without "sticking" the fingers. It's perfect for e-sports.

I tried Razer and Logitech pro mice before but this little guy here is amazing for FPS games. It is light and accurate. It fits larger hands the best so beware if you have smaller hands. Overall, a fantastic product.
The Razer Basilisk is the best mouse I‚Äôve used for FPS games. The sensor is precise and the weight feels perfect for quick movements. I love the customizable commands and RGB lighting options.

As an MMO player, I find the Rival 500 incredibly useful. The multitude of buttons really enhances gameplay and helps me manage my abilities seamlessly. The ergonomics are amazing, resulting in less wrist strain during long sessions.

The Rival 500's vibration feature to signal cooldowns is incredibly effective. I've never had a mouse that provides tactile feedback in gameplay before, and it's made a significant difference in my gaming performance.
I've used numerous mice for FPS gaming, but the G-Wolves Hati is the best yet! It‚Äôs light, responsive, and the perfect shape for my grip style. I can‚Äôt recommend it enough for competitive play.
The G515 is a huge disappointment for me. It lacks the features I expected, and the build quality feels cheap. I had higher hopes.
The Logitech G515 Lightspeed TKL is a fantastic wireless gaming keyboard. It‚Äôs incredibly responsive with excellent battery life. Highly recommend it for gamers!
I‚Äôve been using the G515 for a few weeks now. It performs well for gaming, but the keycaps could be better. Overall, it‚Äôs solid.

review_title: Okay, but not worth the price
review_text: The Logitech G515 is decent, but I expected more features for the price point. It‚Äôs good, but not great when compared to competitors.

The SteelSeries Apex Pro Gen 3 is the best keyboard I've ever used. The OmniPoint switches are incredibly responsive, and I love the customizable features!
While the new features of the Apex Pro Gen 3 are nice, I was disappointed by the lack of a USB passthrough. Overall, it's still a great keyboard.
After switching to the Apex Pro Gen 3, typing has become so smooth and satisfying. The customization options for actuation are a game changer!
I‚Äôve been using the SteelSeries Apex Pro Gen 3 for gaming, and it feels incredibly natural. The keys actuation customization is superb for FPS games!
The SteelSeries Apex Pro Gen 3 has a great feel, but it's heavier than I expected, and the cable could be more flexible. Overall, it‚Äôs decent.
The Lemokey P1 HE mechanical keyboard is an excellent option for all tasks, including typing and gaming. It's well constructed, using premium materials, and feels like it'll last a lifetime.
The P1 design and magnetic switches make the Lemokey P1 HE one of the best magnetic options on the market, with a competitive price among high-end gaming keyboards.
The Lemokey P1 HE impressed me with its build quality, superior typing experience, and great sound dampening. It rivals keyboards that cost much more, making it an outstanding choice.
After testing the Lemokey P1 HE, I can confidently say it is a fantastic gaming keyboard. The versatile features and smooth typing experience make it a joy to use.
I love mechanical switches, but after using the P1 HE, I may have found a new favorite. It's loaded with features for gaming and works great for productivity, too.

review_title: A Solid Keyboard with Minor Flaws
review_text: The Sony INZONE KBD-H75 has a solid build quality and performs well in gaming, but it lacks a wrist rest, which would have improved comfort during long sessions.
I‚Äôve found the INZONE KBD-H75 to be very comfortable for long gaming sessions, and the low-profile keys allow for quick responses, making it one of my preferred keyboards for gaming.
This keyboard is decent for its price point, providing a good balance of functionality and performance. However, the RGB lighting is not as vibrant as I had hoped.
The KBD-H75 has been fantastic for my esports needs. The wireless connection is stable, and the keyboard feels very responsive with a satisfying switch feel.

review_title: Good Performance, Needs a Wrist Rest
review_text: While the performance of the Sony.INZONE KBD-H75 is great, the absence of a wrist rest detracts from the long-term comfort. I recommend it for short gaming sessions.
The Logitech G915 is a beautiful slim keyboard that doesn‚Äôt compromise on functionality. It offers customizable lighting and great ergonomics, making it perfect for long gaming sessions.
While the G915 performs exceptionally well, and the wireless technology is lightning-fast, I wished it included a wrist rest for added comfort during extended use.
Once I started using the Logitech G915, I was blown away by the satisfaction of typing on this keyboard. The tactile switches offer a perfect amount of resistance, making typing a pleasure.
The G915 is a fantastic keyboard; however, I think it's on the pricier side for what it offers compared to other keyboards in the market. Great performance, though.
The Corsair K65 RGB MINI is an excellent gaming keyboard with its compact layout and RGB lighting. The key switches work perfectly for both typing and gaming, making it very versatile.
Corsair has succeeded with the K65 RGB MINI, providing a solid aluminum frame and responsive keys. RGB customization options are a great addition for any gamer who loves personalization.
I love the compact design of the Corsair K65 RGB MINI. It performs flawlessly for gaming while being easy to carry around. However, it took me some time to adjust to the layout.
The K65 RGB MINI by Corsair is good, but I found the key spacing somewhat awkward at first. The RGB lighting is, however, stunning and adds life to my setup.
I use the Corsair K65 RGB MINI for both gaming and work, and it is fantastic for both. The compact design, combined with great performance, makes it a worthwhile purchase.

review_title: One of the Best Analog Keyboards
review_text: The Wooting Two HE is an excellent analog keyboard that provides a unique experience. The adjustable actuation points are fantastic for gaming, making it my go-to keyboard for FPS games.
I've been using the Wooting Two HE for a few months now, and it's completely changed how I play. The smooth actuation and versatility in terms of customization are outstanding.

review_title: Excellent for Gaming, Minor Learning Curve
review_text: The Wooting Two HE is a solid choice for gamers. It took some time to get used to the analog feature, but once I did, it felt so rewarding in-game.
Overall, the Wooting Two HE is a good keyboard. However, the software could be more intuitive for customizing settings and profiles. Yet, the hardware performs excellently.
This keyboard provides an amazing typing experience, and the analog features are a game-changer. It's definitely worth considering if you're into competitive gaming.

review_title: Perfect keyboard for what I wanted
review_text: Love feel of the Cherry MX keys. They have the exact same feel as my MSI Titan laptop‚Äôs Cherry MX keys. Easy to switch between computers because of the hardware Bluetooth buttons. This has all the features I wanted and nothing I didn‚Äôt. Feels sturdy and well-made, too.

After owning several keyboards, I have to say that this one is my END GAME choice. I use this for work and gaming - excels at both! The quality is great, though, not a fan of the glossy plastic up top. The switches feel great, and the RGB lighting is fantastic.

Amazing, 10/10! Its wireless, the clicks are amazing, and the response time is instant. Weighs next to nothing, and the aesthetic is unbeatable. The battery lasts for 50 hours, but it goes to sleep after 10 minutes. Literally everything I was looking for in my first gaming keyboard!

review_title: Very nice gaming keyboard, but pretty pricey
review_text: The keyboard is very well made. It has an aluminum black top that looks slightly brushed. The rest of the keyboard is black plastic that feels durable. It's great for regular typing and gaming but pricier than I feel it should be for a keyboard.

This was a great cherry MX mechanical wireless RGB keyboard. The battery lasts for days on a single charge with impressive backlit options. It's also very responsive when typing, but the aluminum finish attracts dust quickly. Overall worth the high price for its features.

This is a great cherry mx mechanical wireless RGB keyboard. The battery lasts for days on a single charge with the backlit color glowing while typing most if a day on it. Its always accurate when typing on and feels very satisfying to type on.

review_title: High end Keyboard with great feel!
review_text: I wanted a great feeling tactile keyboard with feedback. That‚Äôs exactly what I got! This keyboard does it all! I am not a fan of linear mechanical switches, so I bought this and the feel is night and day better! Great for gaming and regular use!

Really nice keyboard. Very low profile and premium design. Typing takes a bit more force like other reviewers mentioned, but the sound is actually clicky. The battery lasts forever. However, it is very pricey.

Really good keyboard that lasts forever! Low profile and sleek. Can‚Äôt complain about anything. It‚Äôs much quieter than my brown keys and good for daily use. I recommend this keyboard to anyone looking for a reliable and quiet mechanical keyboard.

review_title: I dreamed of this keyboard as a child.
review_text: 100% worth every penny. I use the G-Keys and scroll wheel to automate my music production and gaming with different settings. I recommend this keyboard to all of my friends and I wouldn‚Äôt be happy with any other one.

Keyboard is very comfortable to type on. The padding for my wrists makes all day use a very comfortable experience. There are many short cuts, my favorite being "dictate" to easily speech to text my notes after client conversations! Highly recommend!
I actually like the comfort of the wavy keyboard for my fingers as well as the soft pad which really helps for resting my wrists.
The wave works well and is easy to adapt to. The bluetooth wifi set-up was easy. The palm-rest helps relieve the wrist and hands.
Attach palm rest is a great. Helps with issues I‚Äôve been experiencing when typing for long periods of time. I would recommend this to a friend.

review_title: Compact but still comfortable Ergo Keyboard
review_text: This keyboard has been the best keyboard I have ever purchased absolutely phenomenal. It helps with comfort and ergonomics when typing for long hours.
The Keychron Q1 HE is an amazing keyboard. The customizable features are excellent for gamers seeking precision, plus the build quality is top-notch.
I was impressed by the weight and sturdiness of the Keychron Q1 HE. The keys feel nice, and the layout is well-designed for my gaming needs.
The typing experience is phenomenal! The Hall effect switches really deliver a smooth and tactile feel, making it enjoyable for long typing sessions.
While the Keychron Q1 HE performs excellently, I found it a bit too heavy for my preferences when traveling to gaming events. It‚Äôs not portable.
The Wooting 80HE offers excellent customizability and performs well for games. However, I found the layout takes some time to get used to.
This keyboard is fantastic! The ability to customize actuation points is a game-changer. It feels responsive and smooth while playing fast-paced games.
I love the design and build quality of the Wooting 80HE. It's aesthetically pleasing and provides a solid typing experience for both work and play.
The NuPhy Field75 HE has an excellent typing experience with its compact design and responsive keys. It‚Äôs perfect for both work and daily tasks.
I appreciate the lightweight design of the NuPhy Field75 HE. It fits perfectly into my bag, making it easy to carry around, but the key layout takes some adjustment.
The GLORIOUS GMMK 3 PRO HE has been a revelation for my typing tasks. The sound of the keys is very satisfying, and it feels very premium.
I really enjoy the customizable aspects of the GLORIOUS GMMK 3 PRO HE. The lighting effects and key mappings are fun, enhancing my setup visibly.
This is a very sturdy, well built and comfortable keyboard. I've had the G915 and I would take this one over that one considering the nice magnetic switches. I would recommend this to a friend.
Keys are new feel to me, but other than that, I enjoy its responsiveness and the software is easy. I would recommend this to a friend.
Solid keyboard and nice switches! Logitech after years is finally in on the analog switches game. I would recommend this to a friend.

One of the most comfortable keyboards I‚Äôve used in a while, not raised too high or too low. All the customizations are amazing too. So if you‚Äôre into FPS or any comp game, GET IT! I would recommend this to a friend.

The Keychron K2 HE is an exceptional keyboard! Its wireless connectivity makes it super convenient, and the build quality feels premium. The type feel is smooth, and I'm just in love with the customizable actuation points, making it versatile for any game. Best investment for my setup!

I love the wireless features of the Keychron K2 HE! Pairing with multiple devices is seamless, and typing feels very responsive. However, the software could be more user-friendly. Overall, it's a great keyboard for both gaming and work!

The K2 HE delivers impressive performance, especially with the adjustable actuation points. It feels great typing, and the Hall effect switches make a significant difference during gaming. My hands feel less strained during long typing sessions. Highly recommend!

I appreciate the aesthetic design of the Keychron K2 HE! The wood accents are beautiful and add a nice touch to my desk. However, I wish it had a dedicated volume knob for easy adjustments while gaming. Still overall satisfied with this purchase.

Typing on the Keychron K2 HE feels like a dream. The double-rail magnetic switches make it buttery smooth, and I love the customization through the web app. It‚Äôs an impressive product that combines style with functionality. I'm very happy with my choice!

The Corsair K70 PRO TKL is my favorite keyboard for gaming! The performance is outstanding, with a solid feel under fingers. I appreciate the customizable RGB lighting and the smooth keystrokes. This keyboard has improved my gaming experience significantly, and I highly recommend it!

I have used this keyboard for a few months, and I‚Äôm impressed with the build quality. The keys feel responsive, and the customization options are great. However, the software can be a bit clunky at times. Overall, it's a solid choice for gamers!

I purchased the Corsair K70 PRO TKL for competitive gaming, and it‚Äôs amazing! The key response is quick and precise. The customizable lighting adds flair to my setup, and I love the wrist rest feature. I couldn‚Äôt ask for a better keyboard.

The K70 PRO TKL is quite comfortable for long gaming sessions. The keys are nice and quiet compared to other keyboards I‚Äôve used. My only complaint is the price is a bit on the higher side. Still, I think it's worth the investment if you're serious about gaming!
This keyboard has a very good key feel. Whether I'm typing or gaming, it performs exceptionally well. The keys are responsive and have a nice sound that isn‚Äôt too noisy.

Switching to the Corsair K70 PRO TKL was an excellent decision for my gaming setup. The build is high-quality, and the RGB lighting is vibrant. It performs excellently with almost no latency, making it a dream to use. Highly recommended for gamers looking for precision!

The Ducky One X is an excellent mechanical keyboard with its full-size layout! Each keystroke feels satisfying, and the customizable options are fantastic. Perfect for both gaming and typing tasks. I adore the sturdy build and the vibrant RGB lighting. Highly recommend!

I find typing on the Ducky One X very enjoyable. The keys are well-placed, and the tactile feedback is satisfying. However, I wish it had more options for RGB customization. Overall, I‚Äôm pleased with the purchase and would recommend it!

The Ducky One X is my favorite keyboard I've ever owned! It has a unique design, and the key feel is wonderful. Transitioning from laptop to this keyboard is so satisfying, especially with gaming. I absolutely love the vibrant colors of the RGB lighting!

The Ducky One X is a solid performer for gaming and typing. It‚Äôs got great build quality and feels durable. I do find the software a bit hard to navigate at times, but overall, it's been a great addition to my setup.

The Ducky One X is worth every penny! The customizable keycaps are a nice touch, and the typing feel is impressive. I love the variety of lighting presets and how it transforms my desk setup. A great investment if you're a mechanical keyboard fan!

I came to appreciate the compact size of Halo65 because it doesn't skimp on style and quality, and it takes up less space on my desk. The build quality is excellent, and the RGB lighting is well-executed. Overall, I highly recommend it if you're looking for a quality mechanical keyboard.

The Halo65 HE excels in gaming performance with outstanding latency and a rapid trigger feature. It's smooth and responsive, but the typing noise can be a bit on the louder side for some users. Still, a great choice for gamers.

The build quality is quite impressive with an aluminum plate, and I felt the keyboard was very stiff with no flex. The south-facing LEDs are a nice touch, but I wish the keycaps were shine-through for better visibility in low light.

review_title: Good as a First Mechanical Keyboard
review_text: The NuPhy Halo65 HE can be considered an entry-level product, especially for first-time mechanical keyboard buyers. It offers solid sound-absorbing material and a pleasant keystroke sound, but the options for switches are currently limited.

I think I found the new king of magnetic switch keyboards with the Halo65 HE. Its performance is outstanding with an 8000 Hz polling rate, and the typing experience is quite satisfying. This keyboard is definitely worth its price.

The NuPhy Air75 V2 is an excellent keyboard for on-the-go use. It‚Äôs lightweight and easy to fit on a laptop. The key switches are smooth, and the extra battery life is a huge plus. This keyboard has really impressed me.

I love the typing feel of the Air75 V2. It has a great combination of low-profile design and satisfying feedback. Connecting it to my devices was seamless, and the RGB options are fantastic! A solid keyboard choice for home and travel.
The ability to connect with multiple devices using Bluetooth is a major selling point for the Air75 V2. It offers great customization via QMK/VIA, making it perfect for both work and play scenarios.

This keyboard is ideal for writers who want a portable option with great performance. The low-profile design really alleviates wrist pain while typing, and the backlighting options are visually pleasing. Highly recommended!
After using the Air75 V2, I can't go back to standard keyboards. The typing experience is wonderful, and it's great for travel. Its slim profile doesn‚Äôt compromise on functionality whatsoever.

The Lofree Flow is not only stunning to look at, but the typing experience is incredibly satisfying. The keys feel great under finger and the sound is nice and soft, making it a joy to type on for extended periods.
The design of the Lofree Flow really stands out. It's very minimalist and fits well on my desk while providing a comfortable typing experience. However, I wish it had more customizable RGB options.

I find the Lofree Flow keyboard to be excellent for typing. The tactile feedback is great, and I appreciate how quiet it is. It's easy on the fingers, though I wish there were more switch options available.
The cost may seem a bit high, but when you consider the design and quality of the Lofree Flow, it's a great investment. The keys feel solid, and the build quality is exceptional.
I just love this keyboard! The typing sound is satisfying, and I enjoy how light and portable it is. If you want a low-profile mechanical keyboard, the Lofree Flow should definitely be on your list.

The Aesco A67 is a good gaming keyboard that provides excellent performance. The build quality feels good, and the keys respond well during long gaming sessions. I appreciate the adjustable typing angle as well.
I find the Aesco A67 to be a reliable keyboard. It's durable and has a simple design that does not distract you from your work or play. However, I wish it offered more lighting options.

The Aesco A67 is versatile enough for both gaming and productivity. The typing feedback is decent, and I like how it's designed. It's an affordable choice for anyone looking for a functional keyboard.
The Aesco A67 is one of the best keyboards I‚Äôve used in this price range. It‚Äôs reliable and sturdy, though I expect better customization options for the keys.
The Akko MOD007-HE PC has an impressive build quality that feels premium. The typing experience is superb, and the actuation options are great for both writing and gaming. Highly satisfied!
I love the customization features of the Akko MOD007-HE, especially the ability to easily swap out switches. The ergonomics are good, but it could use better lighting options for the keys.
Ever since I switched to the Akko MOD007-HE, typing has never been more enjoyable. The keys feel responsive, and the sound they produce is just perfect. I can highly recommend this keyboard!
The Akko MOD007-HE PC has quickly become my go-to gaming keyboard. The sensitivity and customization options give me a competitive edge in gameplay. This keyboard really stands out!

I appreciate the quality of the components used in the Akko MOD007-HE. It's sturdy, and the key feel is what you‚Äôd expect from a high-end mechanical keyboard. A bit pricey, but worth it for the quality.

My thoughts on the Geonworks Venom 60 HE after a few days of testing versus the Wooting 80HE. The performance is stellar, providing remarkably low latency, but it's not exactly a night and day difference compared to other elite performance keyboards. It feels good during gaming sessions but might not justify the high price for everyone.

The Geonworks Venom 60 HE is an outstanding choice for customization enthusiasts. It requires some assembly, but once built, it delivers exceptional performance and typing quality. If you take the time to choose the right components, the final product can be tailored specifically to your needs. Definitely worth it for avid gamers!

This keyboard offers great performance, but the requirement to build it yourself can be a bit daunting for beginners. While the end result can be fantastic, the learning curve is steep, and the instructions could use more detail.

I have been using the Venom 60 HE for competitive gaming, and it performs brilliantly. The responsiveness and latency are outstanding, making it an excellent choice for fast-paced games like Fortnite. However, it may not cater well to office tasks.

I built my keyboard using the Venom 60 HE PCB, and I am amazed by the build quality and feel. The typing noise is quite loud, but with proper foam and dampening material, you can achieve a quieterprofile. Overall, it's an exceptional product for those who love custom keyboards.

The MCHOSE Ace 60 Pro is a solid performance keyboard featuring great build quality. I love the responsive feel of the switches and how I can customize the actuation points. However, the software could be improved for better usability.

I really like the compact design of this keyboard that fits well into my gaming setup. The rapid trigger feature works perfectly for my needs in competitive play. Definitely met my expectations for a 60% keyboard.

The MCHOSE Ace 60 is nearly as good as the Wooting keyboards in terms of performance but at a much lower price point. It supports rapid inputs and feels great while gaming.  It does not feel flimsy, but the material could be a little more premium.

The features and customizability of the Ace 60 Pro are excellent, but I found the stock switches to be somewhat underwhelming. I had to swap to other switches for a better experience. It's a decent keyboard but not perfect.

I bought the MCHOSE Ace 60, and for its price, it's an incredible deal. The keyboard features analog capabilities and a reliable connection. However, I do wish it had better software for customization.

The MonsGeek FUN60 Ultra offers an incredible combination of performance and aesthetic. I love the aluminum case and the smooth feel of the keys. It has great battery life and makes for an excellent gaming companion. Highly recommended!

review_title: Good for Gaming, A Bit Heavy
review_text: The FUN60 Ultra is one of the best keyboards I‚Äôve used for competitive gaming. The polling rate is impressive, but the keyboard feels a bit heavy when carrying it around. Overall, a solid product!

I appreciate that the MonsGeek FUN60 Ultra supports hot-swappable switches, allowing me to use different types according to my gaming need. The RGB lighting is decent too, adding a nice touch to my setup.
While I love the hardware of the FUN60 Ultra, the online software experience can be frustrating. I‚Äôve faced some bugs while trying to adjust settings, but the keyboard works fine overall.
This keyboard is incredibly affordable for what it offers. The build quality is robust, and the features support great gaming performance. I have no regrets about my purchase!
The NuPhy Halo96 delivers great build quality and impressive latency. The typing experience is smooth, making it a great choice for gaming or programming. The high-profile design adds comfort too.

I really appreciate the gasket-mount design that provides a soft typing experience. The RGB lighting is bright and looks stunning. However, I wish the keycaps were shine-through for better visibility in dark rooms.

The NuPhy Halo96 is well-built with excellent acoustics. It connects wirelessly with multiple devices, which is a huge plus for multitaskers. Typing feels satisfying and overall, it‚Äôs an exceptional keyboard.
A decent entry-level mechanical keyboard with significant features, but it feels slightly cheap due to the switch feedback and average lighting quality.

review_title: Impressive but Needs a Wrist Rest
review_text: The Halo75 provides excellent typing feedback and looks stylish. However, its tall profile means it‚Äôs best used with a wrist rest that unfortunately isn‚Äôt included. Still, it‚Äôs a great keyboard overall.
I couldn‚Äôt be happier with the Halo96‚Äôs performance. The typing sound is pleasant, and it performs well in both gaming and office tasks. The design is beautiful and it feels solid as well.

The Logitech Combo Touch provides excellent functionality with its detachable keyboard and versatile kickstand. It's cheaper than Apple‚Äôs Magic Keyboard while offering great typing experience and protection for the iPad.

review_title: Good Build, Slightly Awkward on Lap
review_text: While the Combo Touch is sturdy and well-made, typing on your lap can feel awkward due to its design. However, it pairs instantaneously with the iPad and types well overall.
I appreciate the function key row that allows quick access to controls. The backlit keys are a nice touch, and the detachable keyboard feature is very convenient for on-the-go use.
The Combo Touch is a solid iPad case with a keyboard. However, it lacks some of the finesse of pricier options. The kickstand could also use improvements for lap use.
I find the Logitech Combo Touch to be a fantastic keyboard case for my iPad. It offers ample protection and the keyboard feels great for typing. Definitely a great value for the price.

I spilled some juice on my Chromebook keyboard, and it has never been right. I connected this excellent Logitech wireless keyboard, and I can type away all day. I can never go back to stock keyboards now.

I‚Äôve had two of these keyboards so far; the last one broke due to my mishandling. I‚Äôve put these things through hell while traveling, and they are amazing. The feel is way nicer than any MacBook I‚Äôve had, and the sound is super quiet but satisfying.

This is a great product for anyone who needs a portable and wireless keyboard. The key weight is very comfortable for daily use; it's comparable to a MacBook's. The multi-pairing option works perfectly, and it switches really quick.

I found this one and was skeptical at first. I thought I would miss the number keypad, but I don‚Äôt. The size is perfect for my desk and my briefcase when I travel. The backlighting is also an excellent feature for me!
Extremely smooth and sleek feeling! Love typing on this and I work on the computer 10-12 hours daily. It gives me great satisfaction and comfort while typing, making it my favorite keyboard.

The SteelSeries Apex Pro Mini is incredibly responsive thanks to its adjustable actuation points. While it‚Äôs small, it feels sturdy, and I enjoy the RGB lighting. However, it would take some time to adapt to the 60% layout.

I found the OmniPoint 2.0 switches fantastic for both gaming and typing. The customization options are overwhelming at first, but they allow for a tailored experience. The keyboard‚Äôs compactness makes it easy to fit on any desk.

While I enjoy the keyboard's build quality and actuation adjustments, I find it a bit too complicated with the numerous customization options. It also lacks a wrist rest, which would have provided more comfort during long typing sessions.

I've used this keyboard in competitive gaming and it truly shines. The adjustable actuation points are a game-changer, allowing for incredibly quick responses. The RGB is also vibrant and attractive, enhancing my gaming setup.

Transitioning to the Apex Pro Mini was challenging due to the compact layout. However, after a week of use, I have come to appreciate its layout and features. The feel of the keys is nice, and it's responsive for both work and gaming.

The Razer Huntsman V2 Analog is exceptional for gaming thanks to the adjustable actuation and responsive switches. It feels great to use, and the RGB lighting is gorgeous. This is definitely worth the investment for competitive players.

I‚Äôve had the Huntsman V2 Analog for a few months now, and I'm impressed by its accuracy and speed. The combination of analog keys with adjustable actuation gives me an edge in games. The build quality is solid, too.

While the adjustable actuation is a nice feature, I found the keyboard to be a bit bulky for my liking. It performs well in games, but I was hoping for a more compact design. The RGB lighting is a plus.

The Razer Huntsman V2 Analog delivers a great typing experience alongside its gaming capabilities. The analog feature makes for precise control in racing games, and the overall performance is impressive. The software makes customization easy.

I'm pleased with the build quality and feel of the key switches. The Razer Synapse software is also intuitive, allowing for unique profiles and lighting effects. However, it's a bit pricier compared to other models.

The Razer Huntsman Mini Analog is a fantastic keyboard. Its compact design doesn't compromise on features, and the adjustable actuation is perfect for all types of games. Highly recommend for any gamer looking for a quality small form-factor keyboard.

I bought the Huntsman Mini Analog mainly for portability, and it‚Äôs been excellent. The keys feel great, and the size is perfect for taking to LAN parties. Just wish it had more color options for the backlighting.

While the Razer Huntsman Mini Analog has great features, the size takes time to get used to. I miss dedicated function keys. It's solid for gaming, but I prefer a full-sized keyboard for everyday typing tasks.

I‚Äôm amazed by the performance of the Huntsman Mini Analog. The actuation sensitivity is excellent, making it adaptable for different types of games. It has quickly become my favorite keyboard for both gaming and general use.

The feature set on the Huntsman Mini Analog sets it apart from other compact keyboards. The adjustable actuation is something I didn‚Äôt know I needed until I tried it. Very comfortable and responsive as well!

The SteelSeries Apex Pro Mini Wireless offers a truly wireless experience without lag. The adjustable actuation points are fantastic, and the overall build quality is impressive. Definitely a top contender for any gaming setup.
