I found the Apex Pro Mini Wireless to be sturdy yet lightweight enough to travel with. The actuation customization allows me to tailor my gameplay. The RGB lighting is also vibrant, making it look great on my desk.
While the performance is solid, I think the price tag is a bit high for a 60% keyboard. It offers good features, but there are other options on the market that provide better value for the price.

The battery life on the Apex Pro Mini Wireless is impressive, allowing for long gaming sessions without worrying about charging. The feel of the keys and responsiveness make it a top choice among wireless keyboards.

I do enjoy using the Apex Pro Mini Wireless, but I‚Äôve faced some bugs with the SteelSeries GG software. Overall, the keyboard itself performs excellently, but the software experience could use improvement.

The Corsair K65 PRO MINI has become my go-to keyboard for FPS gaming. Its compact design allows me to move my mouse freely, while the key switches offer a crisp and tactile feel. Can't recommend it enough!

I really appreciate the build quality of the K65 PRO MINI. The key switches are responsive, and it‚Äôs lightweight, which is perfect for transport. The RGB lights are a bonus too, making it look really attractive.
The K65 PRO MINI is a decent keyboard but it feels a bit basic for the price. While it works for gaming, I expected more premium features at this price point. Not bad, but not great either.
I love my Corsair K65 PRO MINI! It offers everything I need for both gaming and typing. The compact size is convenient and the key response is excellent. Plus, the customizable RGB is a nice touch.

While I enjoy using the Corsair K65 PRO MINI, I feel it lacks some customizability compared to other brands. It performs well, but I wish it had more software features for setting up profiles and macros.

The NuPhy Air75 V2 is a compact keyboard that balances portability with premium features. It offers a satisfying typing experience and sound dampening, making it suitable for both travel and office work.
This keyboard supports connecting to multiple devices wirelessly, making it perfect for my work setup. The low-profile design is comfortable, and the quality is impressive for the price.
I am pleasantly surprised by the quality of this keyboard, especially the tactile feedback and customizable RGB lighting. It‚Äôs fantastic for long typing sessions without causing fatigue.

The NuPhy Air75 V2 combines good design and functionality. However, it can feel a bit cramped for users accustomed to full-size keyboards. Overall, it is a solid product for anyone looking to save space.
As a software engineer, I've used numerous keyboards, but the NuPhy Air75 V2 stands out due to its responsive keys and stylish look. It‚Äôs a fantastic option for anyone seeking a portable keyboard.
The ASUS ROG Azoth offers an incredible typing sensation with its gasket mount design and excellent sound dampening. This keyboard feels premium and performs exceptionally well in gaming scenarios.
The build quality of the ROG Azoth is impressive, featuring a solid aluminum top plate and dual-tone PBT keycaps that feel very sturdy. It also includes a comprehensive accessory kit.
While the keyboard itself feels and sounds great, the user experience is significantly hindered by the ASUS Armoury Crate software, which can be frustrating to use.
I was surprised by the battery life of the ASUS ROG Azoth. Even with screen and RGB on, it lasts well beyond expectations, making it perfect for long gaming sessions.
The combination of pre-lubed switches and a unique OLED display makes this keyboard stand out. It's a great choice for both gamers and typing enthusiasts alike.
The Razer BlackWidow V4 Pro offers impressive customization options, with the new hot-swap capability allowing for easy switch changes, a welcome addition for gaming enthusiasts.
I was blown away by the build quality of the BlackWidow V4 Pro. It feels premium and has a great tactile response thanks to the new Razer switches.
While the features like customizable RGB and a detachable wrist rest are fantastic, the price point of the BlackWidow V4 Pro feels quite steep for what‚Äôs offered.
This keyboard performs well in gaming scenarios. The responsiveness is excellent and the new orange tactile switches provide great feedback during intense gameplay.
The Razer BlackWidow V4 Pro isn't just for gaming; it's also an excellent typing keyboard. I enjoy using it for both work and play with its comfortable layout.
The Corsair K70 RGB TKL provides a great balance between functionality and size. The key switches are responsive, making it a solid choice for gamers and typists alike.
With stunning RGB lighting options, the K70 RGB TKL stands out visually. It's easy to customize the effects via Corsair's iCUE software, enhancing the overall experience.
While I appreciate the overall quality of the K70, the keycap material could be improved as they feel a bit less premium compared to other high-end keyboards.
I love the Corsair K70 RGB TKL! The feel of the keys is fantastic, and the overall build quality feels very durable. Perfect for my gaming sessions.
This keyboard's compact size makes it perfect for my desk space. The performance is great for both gaming and typing, making it a versatile addition.
The AULA F99 offers great value for a wireless mechanical keyboard, with solid performance and decent build quality. It's a fantastic choice for budget gamers.
I really appreciate the design of the AULA F99. It‚Äôs stylish with RGB lighting and works well with multiple devices thanks to its tri-mode connectivity.
The compact design of the AULA F99 makes it easy to carry around, and it doesn‚Äôt take much space on my desk, which is a plus!
While the AULA F99 has solid features, the switches feel a bit off compared to more premium options. However, for the price, it‚Äôs hard to complain.
The hot-swappable capability is a standout feature of the AULA F99. I enjoy being able to easily change switches to suit my typing needs.
The Logitech MX Keys S delivers a solid typing experience with great key feedback. It feels comfortable to type on for long periods, making it ideal for work.
The backlighting and auto-adjust features on the MX Keys S are a game-changer for typing in low-light conditions. It enhances usability significantly.
While I really like the feel of the MX Keys S, I think the price is a bit high for what it offers compared to other similar keyboards.
The Logitech MX Keys S is perfect for my Mac setup. The keys are comfortable and quiet, making it suitable for working from home.
The battery life of the MX Keys S is impressive, lasting weeks on a single charge. It's reliable for everyday use and office settings.

I have nothing but good things to say about this keyboard. It's got such a nostalgic colorway and the switches are some of my favorites. I do like clicky switches and these have a satisfying pop that makes typing a treat. The keyboard itself is spectacular.

I took a shot and bought this for my kid. I love the retro look and feel of this. The clicking sound of the mechanical keyboard is truly amazing. The controls for volume are superb. He has been using it for games, and he absolutely loves this.

It‚Äôs a really good keyboard. It sounds really good and looks good if you're going for a retro setup. I highly recommend getting it. The only downside is it doesn‚Äôt work on PlayStation or Xbox, but it works well on PC.

This thing is cool in so many ways. Great build quality. The hotkeys are so fun to use. As someone who writes reports all day, I genuinely enjoy using this keyboard. The key sound is satisfying, and it has a really smooth and easy setup.

I love this keyboard, mostly for subjective reasons. I love the look, the sound, the feel of the keys, and even the wireless USB plug that is stored magnetically in the base. If you like loud clacky keys and the NES theme, you will love this board.

If I had to pick one board it would be the Glove80. I think this is going to be my go-to for the foreseeable future. It's incredibly well designed and the most ergonomic keyboard on the market, hands down.

I have owned and been using a Glove80 keyboard for about three weeks now. It made me realize problems I didn‚Äôt even know I wanted to solve until I started using it. The design is wonderful and truly ergonomic.
The MoErgo Glove80 is the best ergonomic keyboard for enthusiasts we've tested. If you're looking for an advanced keyboard that can be fine-tuned to suit your needs, look no further.
After just 10 days using the Glove80, I had full, pain-free range of motion in my wrists again. It makes a huge difference considering how much time I spend using a computer every day.
Embodying a thoughtful, humanistic design, the Glove80 provides a comfortable, efficient typing experience that works well for various hand sizes. I'm immensely satisfied with my purchase.

The SteelSeries Apex Pro has an excellent build quality, and the customizable actuation point feature makes it stand out among competitors. It's a great choice for gamers who need quick response times.
I love the versatility of the SteelSeries Apex Pro. The ability to change the actuation point for each key is a game-changer, making it suitable for both gaming and typing tasks. Highly recommended!
While I appreciate the design and features of the Apex Pro, the software tends to be a bit buggy. If they improve the software experience, it could truly be a perfect keyboard for everyone.
I've been using the SteelSeries Apex Pro for a few months, and it's fantastic for gaming. The feel of the keys is excellent, and the RGB lighting adds a nice touch.
The build and aesthetics of the SteelSeries Apex Pro are stunning. I love its sleek aluminum body, and the customizable lighting options are vibrant and enjoyable.
The Logitech G PRO keyboard is an excellent choice for both typing and gaming, thanks to its sturdy build and clicky switches that provide satisfying feedback. The RGB lighting is a plus as well.
I've found the latency on the Logitech G PRO to be outstanding. It feels incredibly responsive in competitive gaming scenarios, making it a solid choice for eSports enthusiasts.
While the Logitech G PRO has great build quality, I was disappointed by the lack of additional features like dedicated media controls. It‚Äôs a simple setup, which may not appeal to everyone.
The typing experience on the Logitech G PRO is great, providing responsive keystrokes and good stability. However, it would be nice to see more customization options in the software.
The durability of the Logitech G PRO is impressive. I‚Äôve had it for a year now, and it still feels as good as new. Definitely worth the investment for serious gamers.

The Glorious GMMK 3 is an outstanding modular keyboard. It allows for easy switch replacement, giving me the ability to customize my typing experience extensively. The RGB lighting is vibrant and dynamic.
I really enjoy the customization options available with the GMMK 3. Being able to swap out switches is a game-changer for someone who likes to tailor their equipment to their preference.
The design of the Glorious GMMK 3 is quite sleek and modern. It fits perfectly on my desk and the customizable features make it versatile for gaming and everyday use.
While I love the hardware, the software experience could improve. Occasionally, I run into bugs while trying to customize the lighting settings, but the performance overall is satisfactory.
The Glorious GMMK 3 provides a fantastic typing feel. The key switches are smooth and responsive, making it an excellent choice for long gaming sessions or typing marathons.
The Logitech G915 X LIGHTSPEED is an incredible wireless keyboard. The battery life is phenomenal, lasting me weeks on a single charge, and the performance remains stellar with no lag.
I really appreciate the low-profile design of the G915 X. It feels very comfortable to type on, and the layout is user-friendly. Plus, it looks great on my desk setup.
The RGB lighting options for the Logitech G915 X are impressive and highly customizable. It adds a personal touch to my gaming experience that I find really enjoyable.
While the Logitech G915 X is on the expensive side, I think it's worth it for the build quality and performance. Just be aware of the price before purchasing.
I've used the G915 X for several months now, and it has held up remarkably well. It's robust, and I love the feel of the keys. Definitely my go-to keyboard.

I was trained as a touch typist 55+ years ago, and this particular Logitech keyboard is bar none the best I have used in all that time. Excellent touch, action, size, and layout - and the numeric keypad is a definite plus.

Fantastic piece of hardware for my home office! I upgraded from MX Keys for the semi-clicky and tactile feel of a mechanical keyboard. Each keystroke offers the perfect amount of resistance and travel that makes typing a pleasure.

review_title: Quality Work Keyboard, Few Annoying Nitpicks
review_text: Good typing feel and material choice. Doesn‚Äôt feel cheap, has the same build quality as the MX Keys I also own. I would recommend going with the Linear switch for a more consistent typing feel.
Great keyboard overall. The simple design with backlighting makes it look nice. Setting it up was real easy, and it came with its own cords.

review_title: An amazing keyboard and typing experience
review_text: PROS - Superb typing experience with excellent feedback. Backlighting is great and the full-sized keyboard includes a numpad for extra functionality. Works with both Mac and Windows.
Amazing keyboard with great connectivity, backlighting, and both Windows and Mac support. The performance is excellent, and I love how it switches between devices easily.
The Logitech G915 X LIGHTSPEED excels with its build quality and impressive low wireless latency. It's very comfortable to use and perfect for any competitive gaming setup.
The typing experience is only decent, with noticeable key wobble, but the RGB lighting and build quality are impressive. It's a solid choice for gaming but has some trade-offs.
This keyboard has really exceeded my expectations, especially the low-profile design and tactile feedback. It's the best I've used for both gaming and typing tasks.
For the most part, this keyboard has been great; the tactile feedback is nice, but the backlighting isn't as dim as I would like it to be. Overall, I'm satisfied.
Nice design with lighted and silent mechanical keys. It allows me to work, play, and even use multiple devices seamlessly, which is perfect for my workflow.
It feels solid, and the typing experience is great. The only downside is that the software could be improved for better performance, but overall a good product.
The keyboard is great for coding and typing long documents. The keys have a nice feel to them, and the backlighting is a geek-inspired bonus. I'm really happy with my purchase!
I have found the tactile quiet switches to feel really good while typing, and the ability to switch between pairs on my two devices seamlessly has improved my experience greatly.
My first mechanical keyboard, and I'm not disappointed! It takes a little time to get used to the feel and size of the keyboard, but after that it's just great!

I'm giving this rating because I think this keyboard is actually one of the best I've bought in my entire life, the keyboard is light, fast as it should be, the switches are satisfactory, and it lasts a long time, I've had no problems so far.
This keyboard has a great design and is perfect for small offices. It's also very quiet. I'd definitely recommend it.

A top-quality product, Ducky is a safe bet when it comes to small keyboards. The SF version is an excellent compromise between gaming and office use, and although the price may seem high, I'd recommend it.
It's so quiet that even my laptop keyboard is louder than this keyboard. If that's what you are looking for, get it.
The Ducky One 2 RGB TKL is an outstanding keyboard for gaming. The Cherry MX Brown switches on our unit have low pre-travel, and the RGB backlighting is fully customizable.
Ergonomics are decent, and while there's no wrist rest, the design should be comfortable enough for most people. Overall, it's built solidly with PBT keycaps that feel stable.
I had no complaints with the features. Every key is macro-programmable, and the straight design works well for typing and gaming.
I really appreciate that it's available in various switches. The outstanding typing quality and solid build make it a great choice for programmers too.

review_title: Absolutely recommended if you are interested in a 60% keyboard!
review_text: I tested several keyboards and finally came across the Ducky One 2 Mini. I ordered it and can say that it is by far the best keyboard I have ever used for gaming.

review_title: A dream for gaming and office use!
review_text: This is my first mechanical keyboard, and I'm more than satisfied! It's super quality with configuration options that are complex but effective.
The keys don't make too much noise and it's a very compact keyboard suitable for playing, as well as use in an office without taking too much space.
The keyboard is very responsive and looks beautiful. It comes with additional keycaps, which is a great bonus. Highly recommend for anyone seeking a quality 60% keyboard.
I've been using this for both gaming and coding, and it functions brilliantly! It's a great versatile keyboard that doesn't clash with my desktop aesthetics.
The Ducky One 2 SF is a compact and portable keyboard that's easy to use. It's great for both competitive gaming and typing, delivering an exceptional feel.
When you first open the box, the amount of extras included is impressive. It's clear Ducky cares about the user experience with this keyboard.
The 65% layout is the ideal compromise for gamers like me who need the arrow keys but want a small, compact keyboard. It's incredibly portable.
Each keyboard comes with a keycap puller, additional keycaps for customization, and a detachable USB-C cable which adds to the overall usability and aesthetic.
This keyboard is fantastic for my battles on the go, but I do wish the included cable felt a little more premium. Otherwise, a solid choice for gamers.

review_title: Excellent Successor Ticks All the Boxes
review_text: The NuPhy Air75 V2 is a compact wireless mechanical keyboard with an impressive 4000mAh battery. Its customization through VIA software and low-profile design make it the perfect portable keyboard.
The Air75 V2 offers a fantastic typing experience with its low-profile design. I recommend it for both laptop users and anyone seeking a compact mechanical keyboard for travel.
The NuPhy Air75 delivers an exceptional gaming experience with great latency thanks to low-profile switches. It feels well-built and is comfortable for long periods without a wrist rest.

This keyboard's low-profile design is comfortable for prolonged use during work hours. The quiet switches help maintain a productive environment. However, the key legends are hard to see in low light.
The NuPhy Air75 is perfect for traveling and using with tablets, with its multi-device pairing capabilities. It‚Äôs slightly heavier than some portable keyboards but worth it for its build quality.
The NuPhy Nos75 offers excellent functionality for both casual and professional needs. With its customizable features, it meets a variety of user preferences seamlessly. Highly recommend!
This keyboard is built with high-quality materials, giving it a solid and premium feel. The typing experience is comfortable and responsive, making it a great addition for daily tasks.
Tested with various games, the Epomaker TH80 Pro delivers amazing performance. The switches are responsive, and the design is ergonomic, making long gaming sessions enjoyable.
The TH80 Pro excels in both gaming and office tasks. Comfortable key presses and a well-built frame make it a reliable companion for all-day usage.
The Logitech G513 provides exceptional typing performance with tactile feedback. The backlighting is vibrant, and it functions flawlessly in both gaming and productivity settings.
This keyboard has a robust build and feels premium. It responds quickly during gameplay and looks stylish on any desk setup.
The G513 has a satisfying typing experience, and its programmable keys are a bonus for gamers. However, I do wish the software was more user-friendly.
The Razer BlackWidow V4 offers an unbeatable gaming experience with exceptionally smooth key presses and remarkable RGB customization options that enhance the overall aesthetic of my setup.
I love using the BlackWidow V4 for extended gaming sessions. The comfortable wrist rest and excellent build quality make it suitable for hours of use without fatigue.
The HyperX Alloy Origins is a beastly gaming keyboard that does almost everything right. It earns high praise for its robust RGB customizations and performance.
I love the minimalistic look and feel of the HyperX Alloy Origins. It provides a fantastic typing experience, and the spacebar, while cranky, is manageable.
The custom HyperX mechanical switches provide a smooth typing experience, and I appreciate the RGB lighting. The build quality is solid and it feels very premium.
As a dedicated gamer, the Alloy Origins has exceeded my expectations in responsiveness and tactile feedback. The actuation force is perfect for fast-paced games.
While the typing feel is excellent, the stabilizers could be improved. There‚Äôs some wobble on larger keys, but overall it's still a solid choice.
The Logitech G Pro X keyboard is fantastic! The ability to swap out switches is a game-changer for customization. I use it mainly for gaming and it works perfectly.
The G PRO X offers a great typing experience with tactile feedback. The build quality feels premium and it's responsive, which enhances gameplay tremendously.
I really like the G Pro X keyboard but feel they could have made some aesthetic changes from previous models. It performs well, though.

review_title: Fantastic for both gaming and typing
review_text: I love how customizable this keyboard is! The hot-swappable feature makes it easy to tailor the keyboard to my preferences for both gaming and typing tasks.
This keyboard represents an evolution in Logitech's lineup. It has low latency and the customization options are impressive. The only downside is the price of extra switches.
The Logitech Keys-To-Go is my favorite wireless keyboard for iOS. It's lightweight and pairs effortlessly with my iPad. Perfect for on-the-go use!
This keyboard offers great usability and has a long battery life. It's very slim and easy to carry around, making it ideal for travel.
I find the Logitech Keys-To-Go extremely simple to pair with my Apple devices. Its durability is impressive and it enhances my productivity significantly.

review_title: Great for typing on the go
review_text: It connects immediately and is very compact. Despite its small size, I can type comfortably. The build quality is nice, although it could be a bit sturdier.
I‚Äôve had many portable keyboards but this one stands out for its lightweight design and long battery life. It makes typing on my iPad a breeze.

Probably one of my best purchases. I travel a lot and use my tablet for work when I'm not at home, and this has been a game changer. It's easy to use, easy to transport, and cute! I don't have a problem typing at all (unlike some compact laptop keyboards), and being able to seamlessly switch between my tablet and phone is an unexpected bonus.
The keyboard is functional and good-looking. Bluetooth connectivity is almost instant, and it is also very comfortable to type on. Highly recommend!
Small and compact, easy to connect to my tablet, computer, or phone. Perfectly suited to my needs, and it‚Äôs lightweight enough to carry around.
Small footprint, easy setup, satisfying touch keyboard to take with you or use for your iPad or laptop. It matches my Pebble mouse beautifully, too!
Best keyboard-mouse combo I've had so far. Takes me some time to get used to a layout, but it's awesome. Would gladly buy it again.
Works really well! Compatible with Mac OS, makes typing fun and easy. I love how it connects to multiple devices effortlessly.
This is my second K380 keyboard. I like the size and the spacing between the keycaps, which are very similar to those on Apple keyboards.
Very solid and appears high quality. I just wish it had the back legs to elevate it slightly. Love that you can toggle between Bluetooth devices!
This is honestly a great feel, silent keystrokes and overall amazing. The only problem is that it's too small for me to type on comfortably.
Nice, compact, full-size keyboard. Works great! It replaces a lower-end Logitech one, which I recycled for a one-time discount, so I got a good deal. Very happy with it.
Using this keyboard is a genuine delight! The overall design is elegant but entirely functional, and its solid and sturdy build is quite welcome in a world full of plasticky-feeling peripherals.
I love this little wireless keyboard. I got it to use with my work computer, and it is small enough to fit where I need it to.

review_title: Good Keyboard - Hard to Find White Mouse Pairing
review_text: With a good touch and the ability to switch between devices, this keyboard is almost perfect. However, the printed legends may wear off over time.

review_title: Perfect blend of work and play
review_text: The Logitech G515 combines functionality with great gaming performance. The keys feel great, and it looks nice enough for an office setup. I enjoy using it daily!

review_title: Great for casual gaming and typing
review_text: The G515 is a solid low-profile gaming keyboard with a comfortable layout. It lacks some advanced features like a volume wheel but is still a joy to use.
While the G515 offers excellent typing feedback and build quality, I was disappointed by the absence of dedicated media controls. It‚Äôs a solid keyboard, though.
Typing on this keyboard is a pleasant experience. The low-profile keys are comfortable, but I wish it had a wrist rest included given its price point.
The RGB lighting is bright and effective. The wireless technology works well, and I appreciate how smooth the keys feel during both gaming and typing sessions.
The Dell KB216 is a great keyboard that offers excellent functionality. The keys are responsive, and the design is sleek. It's great for both gaming and typing.
I love my Dell KB216! The build quality is solid, and the keys provide good tactile feedback. It's perfect for everyday use and gaming at this price.
The Dell KB216 is simple yet effective. It has a compact layout and works well for my desk setup. I appreciate the reliable performance during my work hours.
This keyboard gets the job done, but key presses can feel a bit mushy. For the price, it‚Äôs a decent option if you need something basic.
The Dell KB216 is one of the best keyboards I‚Äôve used for typing. The keys are quiet and have a good feel, making it a pleasure to use for long sessions.
The SteelSeries Apex Pro Mini is a fantastic gaming keyboard with its adjustable actuation points. The RGB is incredibly bright, and it feels sturdy on my desk.
Really impressed with the features on the Apex Pro Mini! The build quality is premium, and I love the rapid trigger function. Highly recommend!
I enjoy the customization of the SteelSeries Apex Pro Mini, but the key noise can be distracting. Perfect for gaming, but also good luck using it in a quiet environment.
The adjustable actuation points on the SteelSeries Apex Pro Mini are a game-changer. It allows for personal customization that satisfies both my gaming and typing needs.
The SteelSeries Apex Pro Mini has exceeded my expectations. The analog switches are quick, and the keyboard feels substantial. Happy with this purchase!
The ASUS ROG Falchion RX Low Profile has fantastic performance for gaming. The switches are incredibly smooth, and it has dedicated media controls that work great!
This keyboard is both stylish and functional. The layout is well-designed for minimal desk space, and the typing experience is surprisingly satisfying for a low-profile keyboard.
The ROG Falchion RX Swift is comfortable to use for working and gaming. The battery life is also impressive, lasting through long sessions without needing a charge.
Initially, I struggled with the key spacing and shorter shift key, but it‚Äôs a well-made keyboard. Overall, it offers good performance for the price.
I've typically disliked low-profile keyboards, but the ASUS ROG Falchion RX has changed my mind! It's lightweight yet feels durable, and the media controls are a great feature.
The ROCCAT Vulcan II Max is by far one of the best gaming keyboards I've ever used. The keys are rapid and responsive, making it a joy to game on!
I appreciate the sleek design and great RGB lighting of the ROCCAT Vulcan II Mini. It's not only aesthetically pleasing but also performs exceptionally well during gaming.
The ROCCAT Vulcan II has a great feel, but I did experience some key issues over extended use. I'll keep using it until a better option comes along!
I use the ROCCAT Vulcan II Mini for competitive gaming, and it has delivered great responsiveness. The customization options are impressive and make it versatile.
This keyboard sounds fantastic, and typing feels very satisfying. The ROCCAT Vulcan II Max has helped improve my gaming performance significantly.
I was excited to try the ROCCAT Vulcan II Mini but was underwhelmed by its performance. The keycaps feel cheap and the typing experience is subpar compared to others in its price range.
The RGB lighting on the Vulcan II Mini is impressive; however, the overall build quality felt flimsy. The absolute worst part was how much it rattled‚Äîdefinitely not worth the price.
This keyboard does not fit the requirements of a good gaming keyboard. The key presses are noisy and the overall experience is uncomfortable during long gaming sessions. I expected more.
The key feel on the ROCCAT Vulcan II Mini lacks tactile feedback and feels cheap. It is not satisfying for typing or gaming. I regret my purchase.
While the design and RGB features are eye-catching, the typing experience left much to be desired. The keycaps and build quality don't justify the price for a gaming keyboard.
The Razer Huntsman Mini has a very compact design, making it perfect for gamers with limited desk space. The keys feel responsive, and I appreciate the customization options.
I've been using the Razer Huntsman Mini for a few weeks now, and I'm amazed at its performance. The speed and accuracy of the keystrokes are impressive‚Äîdefinitely a great choice for gamers.
The clicky sounds are fantastic! It‚Äôs satisfying to use while typing and gaming. I would recommend it for anyone who enjoys mechanical keyboards and prefers a compact model.
The Huntsman Mini performs well, but it lacks some features found on more expensive models, such as customizable key lighting. It's good overall, but not perfect.

review_title: Nice Keyboard with a Learning Curve
review_text: Transitioning to the Razer Huntsman Mini has taken a bit of getting used to because of its size, but once I did, I found it a pleasure to use. Highly recommend!
The NuPhy Gem80 offers a unique typing experience that feels premium. The key feel is smooth, and the customization options make it fun to configure for my preferences.
This keyboard feels solid and well-made. The sound from the keys is satisfying, and I enjoy using it both for gaming and work. It's a bit pricier but worth it.
I really liked the customization options available, but the initial setup can be confusing. If you‚Äôre not tech-savvy, it might be a bit overwhelming.
The Gem80 allows for great customization, making it my go-to keyboard. I can easily adjust the sound and feel to fit my typing style, which I love!
I am impressed by the features of the NuPhy Gem80, like the hot-swappable switches. The overall design is stylish and modern, fitting perfectly on my desk.

The Das Keyboard 4 Professional is beautifully designed, featuring a sleek aluminum top panel and excellent build quality. The Cherry MX Brown switches are incredibly satisfying to type on. Plus, the volume knob is a game changer; it makes adjusting audio levels an effortless experience.

After using the Das Keyboard 4 Professional, my typing speed improved significantly. The tactile feedback of the Cherry MX switches is fantastic, and the keyboard itself feels solid and durable. It‚Äôs a bit pricey, but absolutely worth it for serious typists.

The lack of printed keycaps on Das Keyboard 4 Professional adds to its unique aesthetic appeal. I find it enhances my typing experience as it forces me to rely on muscle memory rather than looking at the keys. It has a great look on my desk!

As a developer, I've transitioned to the Das Keyboard 4 Professional, and it has made my coding sessions much more enjoyable. The responsiveness of the keys and the solid build have transformed my workflow. Highly recommended for anyone spending long hours typing.

Although it‚Äôs on the higher end in terms of price, the Das Keyboard 4 Professional is an investment that pays off. The typing feel is incomparable, and the features are customizable to enhance my productivity during work sessions.

The Keychron V5 Max is a superb keyboard if you‚Äôre looking for a relatively affordable option that has the typing experience of a premium board. Despite its affordable price, the standard PBT double-shot keycaps feel great, adding to the overall satisfaction of use.

The V5 Max is an excellent choice for those looking for a high-performing keyboard without breaking the bank. Its performance is surprisingly good for the price, and it features wireless versatility and impressive overall build quality.
I find the Keychron V5 Max well-balanced in terms of price and features. It has a solid build quality and performs well in everyday tasks, making it a decent investment for people who type a lot.

As a writer, the Keychron V5 Max has improved my typing speed and accuracy significantly. I highly recommend it for anyone who spends long hours typing. The tactile feedback feels great, and the layout is user-friendly.

The features and customization options are impressive for the price point. Despite being a budget keyboard, it delivers a satisfactory typing experience and even allows for some modifications if desired.

The Kinesis Freestyle Pro has been a revelation for my typing comfort. Its split design significantly reduces strain on my wrists, and I can easily adjust the angle to suit my preferences when working for long hours.
I love the ergonomic design of the Kinesis Freestyle Pro. It has allowed me to type for hours without discomfort, which has dramatically enhanced my productivity and overall experience while working.
The Kinesis Freestyle Pro is excellent for long typing sessions, as it allows for a more natural hand position. The key response is good, and I appreciate the dedicated features for function keys.
A solid choice for a keyboard if you're looking for comfort during extended writing sessions. The split layout took a bit to get used to, but now I can't imagine going back to a standard keyboard.
I highly recommend the Kinesis Freestyle Pro to anyone who suffers from wrist pain due to prolonged typing. It has changed my life! The customization options are also an excellent bonus.
The Logitech K400 Plus is a great keyboard for casual use, particularly when combined with smart TVs or home entertainment systems. The built-in touchpad makes navigation effortless.
This keyboard has been perfect for my media setup. The wireless functionality allows for seamless navigation from my couch, and the keyboard is compact without feeling cramped.
The convenience of the Logitech K400 Plus is excellent, especially with its touchpad feature. It's lightweight and easy to use while lounging, making it an ideal addition to my living room.
I've experienced impressive battery life with the Logitech K400 Plus. It's straightforward to connect, and it's quite durable. Ideal if you want something practical for the home.
The user-friendly design and layout make the Logitech K400 Plus easy to use. The touchpad works well, and there‚Äôs no fuss with wires, which is a big plus for me.

The Lenovo ThinkPad TrackPoint Keyboard II offers a classic typing experience. The TrackPoint is an excellent addition, allowing for precise navigation without moving my hands away from where they need to be.
I appreciate the key feedback on the Lenovo ThinkPad TrackPoint Keyboard II. It feels solid, and I am able to work for extended periods without experiencing fatigue or discomfort.
The ergonomic design of the ThinkPad TrackPoint Keyboard II is fantastic. It fits my hands perfectly and the keys are responsive, making typing a much more enjoyable experience.
The Lenovo ThinkPad TrackPoint Keyboard II enhances my productivity significantly. I love the tactile feedback and find it easy to navigate, which is great for multitasking.
A robust keyboard! The Lenovo ThinkPad TrackPoint Keyboard II is reliable and built to last. It feels great to type on, and I particularly enjoy the integrated TrackPoint.

Honestly, I do like this keyboard a lot. It's nice and clicky, with a few extra little buttons for you to customize to your liking on the ICUE app! The little armrest on it is also great for longer periods of use.

review_title: In love with the Corsair K70 RGB MK.2
review_text: This keyboard has excellent performance, and the key switches are very responsive for gaming. The extra features like RGB and macro keys make it top-notch for any gamer.
The K70 RGB MK.2 is a great keyboard for both gaming and office use. I'm impressed with the build quality and the quiet tactile feel from the keys.
The keyboard has a solid build with nice lighting features. The layout took a little getting used to, but overall, I've had a good experience with it.
While the keyboard is aesthetically pleasing and has various features, the sharp edges on the aluminum plate could use some refinement.
If you're looking for a solid gaming keyboard, the K70 RGB Pro is a fantastic choice. It feels sturdy, and the Cherry MX switches offer a great typing experience.
The Corsair K70 RGB Pro delivers in every aspect ‚Äì low latency for gaming, comfortable wrist rest, and solid build quality. I'm very satisfied with my purchase.
While the keyboard has great features, I've noticed a fair amount of pinging noise which detracts from its overall quality.
This keyboard is perfect for competitive gaming, thanks to its fast response time and solid design. I've been enjoying it a lot!
I love the features and customization options, but the software could definitely be improved to make setup easier for new users.
The Razer Huntsman V2 offers great performance for gaming. The responsiveness of the keys is impressive, making it a solid choice for any gamer.
The additional media keys and customizable RGB lighting make for an immersive gaming experience. I really enjoy using this keyboard.
While the performance of the Huntsman V2 is excellent, I feel the price is a bit high compared to other options out there.
The sensitivity and actuation of the keys are perfect for gaming. Once you try this keyboard, it‚Äôs hard to go back to others.
This is the best keyboard I've ever used. I type all day, and the tactile feel of the device is excellent. Pressing the keys feels good, and it's comfortable for extended use.
The Keychron Lemokey L3 is well-built and has great typing quality. However, the larger keys wobble more noticeably and can be inconsistent, which can be distracting.
I enjoy using the Lemokey L3 for gaming due to its low latency. The RGB lighting is bright, and I appreciate the dedicated macro keys, but it takes up more desk space than I'd like.
I find the Keychron Lemokey L3 suitable for programming tasks. The build quality is excellent, and its typing feel is quite soft. However, it can be a bit bulky on the desk.
The keyboard has good features and is comfortable for long typing sessions. Unfortunately, the software can be buggy, making it frustrating at times when trying to configure settings.
Finally! I've been waiting for Logitech to create a truly ergonomic keyboard. This design has significantly improved my typing comfort and responsiveness at work.
Using the K350 has been a good experience. The keys are soft, and the spacing feels comfortable. It took me a few days to get used to the layout, but now it's smooth sailing.
This keyboard is perfect for physical typing. The keys respond excellently, and my hands feel great after extended use. I highly recommend it for anyone spending hours at their desktop.
Overall, the K350 is a solid ergonomic keyboard. However, it‚Äôs a bit bulkier than I expected, and I wish it had better multimedia controls. Still, it helps with my wrist strain.
The Logitech K350 keyboard is just okay. While the design is nice, the responsiveness isn't what I hoped for. I would prefer something with a more mechanical feel.
The Logitech ERGO K860 is fantastic for typing. The split design helps keep my wrists in a natural position, and the palm rest is comfortable for long hours of use.
I really enjoy using this ergonomic keyboard in my office. It does take some time to adjust to the layout, but once you do, it feels much better on the wrists compared to standard keyboards.
This is the best keyboard I've ever used. It's comfortable, easy to type on, and the keys are soft to touch. My wrist strain has significantly reduced since I started using it.
The build quality of the ERGO K860 is impressive. I appreciate the wireless feature and how it connects seamlessly to my devices. However, I expected backlighting at this price point.
While I appreciated the ergonomic design, I struggled to adapt to the split keyboard layout. The price feels steep, especially since it lacks backlighting. Still a decent keyboard overall.

This keyboard is very smooth. The switches in it are smooth with typing as well. It's not extremely loud but it gives you that clickety clackety you want with a Mechanical keyboard. No double typing as the first one I purchased did. Just smooth loud typing that you would like. Also, the fact that you can change out the keycaps and switches with no problems makes it customizable. I would recommend this keyboard to everyone.

OMG, I cannot really describe how amazing this keyboard is, the quality of the build feels absolutely premium, it has a nice weight to it and the stock keys that come with it just feel way better than any regular switches I've tried before. The fact that you can swap out the switches to your liking so easily makes it worth every penny. The only downside I could think of is the backlit LED is not the brightest but is still pretty solid.

Keyboard has good switches, good build quality and bright backlit RGB. I can type fast in it to finish my assignments. Highly recommend. I love the mechanical switches and how smooth they feel; the sound that it lets off is satisfying. Great product!

I now own two of these keyboards and love each one. I have one for work, and now one for gaming at home. Very responsive keys, and very customizable to fit my personal style of gaming and productivity. I would absolutely recommend this to anyone.

Nice and solid keyboard. It‚Äôs heavy enough that it does not move when gaming or typing. I use it for work now as well. The LED color and the keys are easy to change and customize. Great clicky keys, just the right sound and response. I'm very satisfied with this purchase.

The Logitech MX Keys S is impressive and one of the few third-party keyboards that can truly compete against Apple's Magic Keyboard. It feels great to type on and has unique features, such as customizable function keys that are very useful in everyday tasks and productivity.

The Logitech MX Keys S provides a significant upgrade over the feeling of Apple's Magic Keyboard, which I've used for years. Its keys are rounded at the edges, which some high-speed typists, like me, prefer. The keys have a matte finish, giving better tactile feedback.

The MX Keys S has proximity sensors that detect when hands approach the keys, which turn on the backlight. This feature extends battery life dramatically, lasting ten hours with backlighting on. It's a practical and thoughtful design for a wireless keyboard.

The Logitech MX Keys S has good build quality and a comfortable low-profile design. I find the keypress responsive and satisfying, which helps with productivity. However, there's no Touch ID sensor, which is something I wish it had for added convenience.

The features packed into the Logitech MX Keys S make it better than most keyboards out there. The software allows for customization, and I appreciate being able to switch between multiple devices seamlessly. The typing experience is quite good overall.

The Ducky One 2 Mini is an extraordinary keyboard. Its build quality is impressive, with a sturdy feel and double-shot PBT keycaps. I love the sleek design, and the RGB lighting is vibrant and customizable. It feels great to type on, and the compact size saves space on my desk.

The Ducky One 2 Mini is the best compact keyboard I have ever used for gaming. The key action is smooth with Cherry MX switches, and I appreciate the onboard profiles and RGB customization. However, the lack of software makes it slightly inconvenient to manage settings.
This keyboard is excellent for the office, providing a very comfortable typing position without causing fatigue. Its split design takes some getting used to, but it‚Äôs worth it for comfort.

I switched to the Ducky One 2 Mini from a full-sized keyboard, and I couldn't be happier. It takes up less space while still providing a fantastic typing experience. The customizable keys and color options make it fun to use, and it's quite portable.

While the Ducky One 2 Mini has incredible build quality and a beautiful design, I find the RGB settings a bit convoluted without accompanying software. Nevertheless, if you want a solid mechanical keyboard compact enough for travel, this keyboard fits the bill.

review_title: Perfect for Both Work and Play
review_text: As a daily typist and gamer, the Ducky One 2 Mini excels in both areas. The tactile feel of the keys enhances typing speed, and gaming performance is top-notch. It's definitely worth the price tag for anyone serious about their keyboard choice.

The Redragon K552 KUMARA RGB is a fantastic budget keyboard. For under $40, you get mechanical switches and RGB lighting that works perfectly. It's surprisingly well-built, and the clicky Outemu Blue switches give a satisfying feel. I've had mine for months with no issues!

This keyboard is great for gamers like me. The keys are responsive and have a decent travel distance. The RGB lighting is a nice touch, though it doesn‚Äôt have software customization. Overall, it‚Äôs a solid mechanical keyboard for the price.

If you're new to mechanical keyboards, the Redragon K552 is a great starting point. It offers a satisfying typing experience with its clicky switches, and the build quality feels robust. However, there could be better customization options for the RGB lighting.

I've been using the Redragon K552 KUMARA RGB for over six months, and it has been fantastic. The build is sturdy, and the keys click nicely without feeling too loud. It handles gaming perfectly, and I highly recommend it to anyone looking for value!

review_title: Good for the Price, But Lacking
review_text: The K552 is a decent mechanical keyboard for its price, but it does lack advanced features like software customization. The RGB lighting looks good enough for casual gaming, but serious gamers may want to invest in something more premium for additional functionality.

review_title: Great keyboard, quality equipment and great price.
review_text: I‚Äôve spent a lot of time using this keyboard for various tasks like programming and gaming. The feel is very much like a mechanical keyboard while being quieter, which I really needed. The response on both the down and up stroke is excellent. I strongly recommend this keyboard for anyone wanting a quality product.

If you‚Äôre looking for a smooth quiet keyboard for an office setting, this is a great budget option. I primarily use this keyboard in an office, and my coworkers appreciate it. The RGB isn‚Äôt too bright and can be dimmed.

review_title: Perfect Full Size RGB Keyboard for the price!
review_text: This is the perfect full-size RGB keyboard at that price point. The buttons are quiet and tactile, and the volume control scroller is a nice touch!

The SteelSeries Apex 3 exceeded my expectations. The keys are quiet yet responsive, making both typing and gaming very comfortable. The RGB lighting is stylish and adjustable, making it look great while also being water-resistant.
We are extremely happy with this keyboard. After a month of use, it still works great. The keys are easy to push, the colors are bright, and I love the magnetic wrist pad.

The K95 RGB Platinum XT has a classic design yet feels pretty premium with its PBT keycaps and robust build. I really like the individual RGB customization, but with the $200 price tag, it makes me hesitant to fully recommend it unless you're serious about gaming.

review_title: The best mechanical keyboard I've used!
review_text: Corsair has truly nailed it with the K95 RGB Platinum XT. The keycaps feel sturdy, and the buildup is excellent. The software is intuitive, which enhances its RGB settings. It might feel a bit heavy due to its solid structure, already evident from the first use.

After using it, I found it quite heavy and a bit cumbersome to move. The keys were quite mushy and the sound was surprisingly loud, which was disappointing. The RGB effects are great, but I expected a quieter experience.

review_title: Pricey and not wholly worth it.
review_text: In my opinion, the K95 lacks the necessary ergonomics for hours of use, and the taller keycaps can strain wrists. At this price point, I expected features that make life a bit easier, like wireless connectivity, but they're missing.
I love the aesthetic of the K95 Platinum XT, especially with the RGB customization. It's extremely functional and adds flair to my setup. However, the price remains a tough pill for many to swallow.

review_title: The Freestyle Edge is absolutely fantastic.
review_text: The Kinesis Freestyle Edge RGB has completely transformed my typing experience. The split design allows for a comfortable ergonomic position, and the RGB lighting is a lovely touch. This keyboard is ideal for those who spend hours typing daily.

review_title: Great for programmers and economical too.
review_text: I discovered the Freestyle Edge through a coworker, and I couldn't be happier. The mechanical switches are incredibly responsive and the programmable macros make it perfect for coding tasks. However, I wish the build was a bit sturdier.

review_title: Unique design, but takes getting used to.
review_text: While the Kinesis Freestyle's ergonomic design is admirable, it certainly requires an adjustment period. Typing feels both unique and liberating, but I faced challenges with re-learning my key placements. Overall, a solid keyboard for those focused on ergonomics.

Kinesis nailed the split ergonomic design with the Freestyle Edge. Typing feels less strenuous, and the RGB lighting options are a joy. Highly recommend this for anyone experiencing discomfort with traditional keyboards.

review_title: Excellent keyboard, but not for everyone.
review_text: I have enjoyed using the Freestyle Edge, but I can understand why some might not prefer this style. It's fantastic for prolonged typing sessions, but its unique split design may not suit every user‚Äôs preference.

review_title: Comfortable typing experience with some quirks.
review_text: The Microsoft Surface Ergonomic Keyboard provides a decent typing experience. Its shape feels comfortable for long hours, and it reduces wrist strain. However, I found the keys a bit too soft for my preference, leading to some accidental keystrokes.

I've been using the Microsoft Surface Ergonomic Keyboard for a while now, and I absolutely love it. The wrist support is fantastic, and it feels great while typing. Ideal for those with wrist problems. Would recommend if you prioritize ergonomics.

The ergonomic design is brilliant but I was disappointed by the lack of customizable features. For someone looking for programmable keys, this keyboard may fall short. Overall, it‚Äôs solid for regular office use.
The Surface Ergonomic Keyboard took a week to get used to, but now I can‚Äôt go back. Once I adjusted to the layout, typing became more comfortable. The keys are fairly quiet but could be sturdier.

This keyboard helps avoid wrist strain during long working hours. The design is sleek and modern, making it a nice addition to my desk setup. Highly effective for anyone looking for an ergonomic solution.

review_title: Best investment for work and play!
review_text: The Dygma Raise is incredibly customizable, allowing me to adjust key mappings and lighting to my preference. Typing feels fast and responsive, which greatly enhances my productivity while gaming as well. Highly recommend.

Dygma Raise has a premium feel, but it's also quite expensive compared to traditional keyboards. The ergonomics are effective and the build quality is high, making it good for long typing sessions, but the price could be a deterrent.

Love my Dygma Raise! The adjustable split layout has really helped my wrist pain, and the tactile feedback is superb. The RGB options are fun too! Definitely a high-end keyboard for serious typists and gamers.
While the Dygma Raise has distinct features like split capability and RGB backlighting, it's priced higher than comparable models. Great for ergonomics but might not fit everyone‚Äôs budget or needs.

The Dygma Raise is fantastic! The comfort level provided by its split design and the ability to customize keys serve me well both in gaming and during long work hours. I can see this lasting a long time.

review_title: A satisfying, sublime, and exceptional typing experience.
review_text: The Model M is a great keyboard with an outstanding typing experience, featuring buckling spring switches. It can be loud, but its exceptional feel and durability make it a recommended choice.
This keyboard is a relic of a prior age, far surpassing modern alternatives in typing quality. The sound might be off-putting to some, but I appreciate its retro design and solid construction.
While I appreciate the nostalgia this keyboard brings, its lack of modern features like dedicated software and RGB backlighting really limits its usability in today‚Äôs tech landscape.
This keyboard is very heavy and feels incredibly sturdy, making it perfect for daily heavy typing. The tactile feedback is satisfying, and the keys don‚Äôt wobble much.

review_title: A love-hate relationship with the noise.
review_text: I love the feel of the Model M, but its noise level is definitely something to consider if you're in a shared workspace. Still, the typing experience is hard to beat.
The Razer Huntsman V3 Pro offers great key customizability with its analog optical switches, making it great for gamers. However, it's not the best choice for office use due to its clicky sound.
I love the responsiveness of the Razer Huntsman keyboards! They have very low latency and the customizable lighting is a huge plus. Great for FPS games and feels durable.

review_title: Good performance but not the best for typing.
review_text: While the Huntsman is an excellent gaming keyboard, I found it doesn't excel at everyday typing tasks. The sensitive switches can lead to typos if you're not careful.
The build is solid, and it feels substantial. The RGB options are stunning, but I wish it had more features for productivity since it's primarily designed for gaming.
The Razer Huntsman is a fantastic gaming keyboard with superb performance. The ability to adjust actuation distances makes it perfect for competitive gaming.
The Glorious GMMK is an impressive keyboard. The hotswappable switches allow for ultimate customization, making it a must-have for gamers and typists alike.
This keyboard is perfect for those who love to customize. I replaced switches easily, and the build quality is top-notch. The RGB lighting is also a great feature.
The GMMK is a solid choice with fantastic performance and ease of use. It's slightly heavier than expected, but still very comfortable for long typing sessions.

review_title: Good keyboard with a few quirks.
review_text: While the GMMK is very good, I did find the software a bit tricky to navigate initially. However, once you get the hang of it, it‚Äôs a joy to use.
This keyboard has transformed my gaming experience. The sound and feel are just perfect, and being able to swap out switches is a big plus for modifying.

review_title: Fantastic keyboard from a great company!
review_text: The Razer BlackWidow is one of the best we've used. The tactile feel and clicky sound are excellent for gaming‚Äîdefinitely a product to consider if you're serious about gaming!
The Keychron K2 easily pairs with multiple devices. I appreciate the seamless switching between my PC and MacBook, though the USB-C port is a bit awkward.

review_title: Solid gaming keyboard, but needs a volume control.
review_text: While the BlackWidow performs excellently for gaming, I found that it lacks a dedicated volume control button, which can be inconvenient during intense gaming sessions.
The Razer BlackWidow delivers on performance. I appreciate its responsiveness, but the RGB lighting could be brighter for my liking. Overall, a solid choice for gamers.

review_title: Good keyboard but can be too loud.
review_text: This keyboard has a great build quality, but the clicky keys can get pretty loud. Be cautious if you're working in an office environment; it might disturb others.
The feel of the Razer BlackWidow is fantastic! I‚Äôve owned several others, but this one hits the perfect balance of key response and comfort during gameplay.

Simply put, amazing keyboard. I love tactile keyboards, and the keys feel perfect with a great click. The RGB customization is very in-depth if you're into that, including matching the colors of your games, though I always leave it on a rainbow gradient wave. I will say the volume wheel is horrible though, spinning in one direction constantly switches from increasing to decreasing volume.

Great keyboard, the aesthetics on it are top-notch. Typing with it is full-on ASMR heaven. This keyboard is one of the best I have owned as it fulfills my everyday needs. If I am not gaming on my PC, I can bring it to work and easily connect it to another device via Bluetooth without the need to bring the 2.4 USB.

I LOVE this keyboard. The action of the green switches are fantastic. It has just the response and clickiness that I was looking for in a mechanical keyboard. I've tried several brands, and I couldn't find the right feeling anywhere else.
I have used this for over a year. Love the feel and touch of this keyboard. Colors are amazing and super easy to customize.

The BlackWidow V3 Pro screams Razer, from its premium build and flashy RGB to its comfortable wrist rest. However, it's very expensive and needs software to change the RGB. The performance is overall outstanding, but the wireless connection can be finicky when the battery is low.
Amazing keyboard... the mechanical feel makes this keyboard such a joy to type with. I rated this 4 stars because if I didn't have to use the wrist rest then I think it would be much better.
Razer makes decent keyboards, and this is a good entry model for anyone looking for a full-sized mechanical keyboard. The price is justified, and the RGB lighting offers excellent customization.

Fantastic keyboard, and feels like it's a genuine premium product. I don't think I can recommend it unless it's on sale as the competition is quite good. The dollar to dollar value for it gets trumped by others.
Overall the keyboard works for what it does well. I fell the quality is not quite as high as I would hope, particularly with the hand rest pad and the switches which aren't personally to my liking.
I adore this keyboard! I love the color, the lighting, and the sound of the keys! I don't use it for gaming, but it's perfect for daily use.

The Razer BlackWidow V3 is an exceptional gaming keyboard that strikes the perfect balance between form and function. From the moment you lay your hands on it, you can feel the quality of its construction.
This keyboard honestly exceeded my expectations by a long shot. The keys are insanely responsive, and the extra volume roller/buttons are appreciated.
This is a really cute keyboard that I really enjoy using. It's easy to customize. The only thing I do not like is the wrist rest doesn't attach to the keyboard itself.
Exactly what I was looking for, has number and f row, it's very slim, good response. I would recommend this to a friend.
I just wish replacement keycaps and switches were easier to come by. Keyboard itself works great. Wireless is hit or miss. I would recommend this to a friend.

review_title: Possible skip for Mac Owners without USB-A
review_text: Feels pretty nice to type on but takes noticeable amount of time to connect when using bluetooth. Would disconnect almost immediately if screen went to sleep. No, I would not recommend this to a friend.
The Keychron Q6 Max is a pretty darn good keyboard for the price, so that tells me I'm on the right track if I'm trying to fit in with all the cool kids.

I recently purchased the Keychron K3, and it has quickly become my favorite mechanical keyboard. The typing experience is very tactile and satisfying, especially with the red switches I chose. The compact design makes it great for travel too.

The Keychron K3 is a fantastic keyboard for office tasks. It connects to multiple devices easily via Bluetooth and has a sturdy build. However, the battery life could be improved, as I find myself charging it frequently with the backlight on.

I‚Äôve been using the K3 for a couple of weeks now. The low-profile design is nice, but I do miss the tactile feedback of traditional mechanical keyboards. Still, overall, it's a solid keyboard for typing and occasional gaming.

The variety of switches available for the Keychron K3 is impressive. I opted for the optical switches, and they provide a smooth typing experience. The RGB lights are also a nice feature, adding flair to my setup.

While the Keychron K3 looks great and has a solid build, its battery life is a downside. I need to charge it almost every day with regular use, which can be annoying. It's stylish but has practical shortcomings.

The Roccat Pyro represents incredible value for money. Thanks to its decent linear switches, sturdy build, and sharp lighting, this is one of the best gaming keyboards I‚Äôve tested in a while. However, for the more seasoned gamers willing to spend more, the higher-end products from Razer and Steelseries may just suit a smidgen better.
The Roccat Pyro delivers a solid gaming experience and looks cool on the desk, but rattly stabilizers, poor keycaps, outdated software and minimal macro support leave much to be desired.

The Roccat Pyro RGB gaming keyboard impresses immediately with its sleek metal finish and ultra-responsive keys. The customizable RGB is handled perfectly, contrasting nicely against the all-black design of the keyboard.
The Roccat Pyro is an excellent choice for value-conscious gamers, and seems almost like it was secretly designed to respond perfectly to my small criticisms of other keyboards.

I‚Äôve used this keyboard for a full week of gaming and work, and I haven‚Äôt noticed any shininess or other wear issues with the keys. This is an excellent keyboard option for those seeking an impressive, affordable take on keyboard fundamentals.

Received this as a gift! Love it! Quality, our son said he knew I wanted a gaming keyboard; he said he went to our local Best Buy and the guy there gave him options after he explained the kind of gaming I do, the son picked this one!
A comfortable keyboard with Razer Chroma support. It's clicky, it's got a soft wrist rest, and it has a numpad. That's all I need. I got it on sale for $30, which made it an insane deal.
I'm a sucker for RGB colored things. I love the clicking noises the keys make, and how customizable the keyboard is with the colors. I love it!!!
Bought this because the mechanical one I got was too loud. This one was mushy enough but clicky without being loud. Love it. Wish it were wireless.
Got this as a gift for my brother's new gaming PC. Can't beat Razer for quality, features, and price here. Responsive with cool RGB and such.

review_title: Excellent keyboard for professionals and gamers!

This keyboard has a sturdy design and smooth key presses, making it perfect for long hours of typing in the office, though some features are lacking compared to gaming keyboards.

The aesthetic of the Varmilo VA87M is gorgeous, with various color options available. It performs well, although I wish it had more features for gamers.
The Razer Cynosa V2 provides vibrant RGB backlighting and an overall comfortable typing experience. I love the dedicated media controls, making it a great addition for gamers.
As an entry-level gaming keyboard, the Cynosa V2 does not disappoint. The lighting options are beautiful, and it is comfortable for extended use, though the build quality feels a bit plastic.
I bought the Razer Cynosa V2 as my first gaming keyboard, and it‚Äôs a great choice. The RGB lights are customizable, and the keyfeel is excellent for gaming and typing.
The Cynosa V2 offers so much for its price point. I appreciate the customizable keys and backlighting. It‚Äôs not the highest quality, but works flawlessly for everyday use!
I use the Razer Cynosa V2 for both gaming and work. The keyboard is lightweight, and the customizable RGB options are enjoyable, but I would prefer better key quality.

The Microsoft Surface Keyboard feels light and responsive, but it lacks programmable keys, making it unsuitable for MMO gaming. Its build quality is excellent, but it has no software for customization and lacks backlighting.

For programming tasks, the Microsoft Surface Keyboard does not shine. It has a great typing feel, but the absence of programmable keys and software customization makes it less versatile.
This keyboard offers an excellent typing experience with low profile keys that feel great. However, it lacks backlighting and software for any sort of customization.
The Microsoft Surface Keyboard can connect via Bluetooth, but it‚Äôs not ideal for mobile devices as some key functionalities don't work, and its size makes it hard to carry around.

Transitioning to the Microsoft Sculpt Ergonomic Keyboard requires adjustment. Some users may find certain key placements odd, but overall, it offers a decent typing experience for regular users.
The Microsoft Sculpt Ergonomic Keyboard has a good build quality, but I was disappointed with the software support. It limits customization options which affects usability for advanced functions.
