For a membrane keyboard, I think it is great. It has an anti-ghosting feature and multimedia keys for pause, fast forward, and volume buttons. The RGB is cool too. I wish it worked with the Ngenuity software. It feels solid and sturdy.
I love all the different possible color modes and the quiet keys. Typing and gaming is a breeze! The keyboard is comfortable and responsive, making it great for both gaming and office work.

review_title: A High Quality Keyboard at the Price
review_text: Like the quality of the keyboard, it feels sturdy and well-constructed. The lights are pretty and easy to customize. It's more than what I expected for the price. Definitely recommend it!

I love my new keyboard. The light-up feature is amazing, and the keys are very comfortable. It's a fantastic addition to my gaming setup. Highly recommend this keyboard for gamers looking for affordable options.
Easy plug-in and play. Light options are great, and my son loves it! The keyboard is sturdy and well-built, and the lighting makes it visually appealing while I work or play.

I would say best keyboard for the price point, but it's simply better than just an affordable keyboard. Responsive keys, the lighting is really well done and works great. Would buy again and highly recommend it.
The keyboard is visually appealing and the keys are really soft, not requiring much pressure to press. I am very satisfied and would consider buying another one in the future.

review_title: Love the way the key feels
review_text: For $40 it's hard to beat the price. No fancy extra buttons or macros, but RGB is satisfying and I love how the keys feel. I have no regrets at all.
I‚Äôve had this keyboard for a few days now and it‚Äôs awesome. It's not loud and offers great color customization. I highly recommend it for anyone looking for a quiet gaming keyboard.
Absolutely LOVE this keyboard! I bought it for gaming and streaming and it's perfect. It's smooth and comfortable to use. The RGB lighting is beautiful and very satisfying.

The Razer Pro Type offers exceptional typing experience with its Razer Yellow switches. It's quiet, smooth, and perfect for gaming and work alike. The build quality is solid, and it's comfortable for long hours.

I love how the Razer Pro Type blends gaming functionality with office aesthetics. It's well-built, very comfortable to type on, and the wireless feature is super convenient. Highly recommended for those in need of a versatile keyboard.

This keyboard is perfect for my daily tasks. The typing experience is smooth with good key feedback. The wireless functionality works well, but I would prefer it to have RGB backlighting instead of just white.

Razer Pro Type is solidly built and offers great performance. It has a nice feel while typing, though some may find it slightly heavier than other office keyboards. Overall, a great investment for productivity enthusiasts.

While I appreciate the Razer Pro Type's build quality and the smooth key feel, I encountered some connectivity issues occasionally. It still serves my purpose, but I expected a bit more reliability for a wireless device.

The HyperX Alloy Origins TKL is easily one of my favorite keyboards. The aluminum construction feels sturdy and high-end. The RGB lighting is vibrant and customizable. Overall, it's a fantastic choice for both gaming and typists.

I have been using the HyperX Alloy Origins for over a year and it still feels like new. The aluminum body is incredibly sturdy, and the typing experience is excellent. The red switches are quiet and responsive.

The Alloy Origins TKL has impressed me with its performance. It‚Äôs lightweight but solid, and the red switches are perfect for my gaming sessions. The RGB is beautiful, but could use more customization options in the software.

This keyboard is responsive and feels great while typing. I love the switch options and the LED lighting is phenomenal. However, I would have preferred a magnetic wrist-rest for added comfort during long sessions.

review_title: Good, But Has Room for Improvement
review_text: The HyperX Alloy Origins TKL is a good keyboard, but I faced some issues with the software. Sometimes my custom lighting settings don‚Äôt save properly. Despite this, it performs well in games and casual use.

The ASUS ROG Strix Scope TKL is a great choice for gamers. Its compact size maximizes desk space while maintaining good key responsiveness. I particularly enjoy the customizable RGB lighting, which adds a personal touch to my setup.

I absolutely love using the ASUS ROG Strix Scope TKL for gaming. The feel of the keys is satisfying, and the build quality is impressive. It's compact yet full of features I need for optimal performance.
Great keyboard overall. It looks fantastic with the RGB lights and feels very sturdy. The only downside is the height; it feels slightly taller than I expected, which took some time to get used to.
The ASUS ROG Strix Scope TKL has a great gaming feel, but I did notice some ghosting with certain key combinations. If you play competitive games, this might be an issue for you.
I find this keyboard excellent for gaming due to its fast switches and compact form factor. The software is decent, allowing for customization, but I wish it was a bit more user-friendly.
The SteelSeries Apex 3 TKL is an amazing keyboard for the price. The features are decent, and it performs well in games. I appreciate the soft-touch finish and the overall aesthetics of the keyboard.

This keyboard suits my casual gaming needs quite well. The keys are quiet, making it suitable for late-night gaming sessions with little noise. The RGB effects are solid, bright, and plenty customizable.

The SteelSeries Apex 3 TKL has a good tactile feel. It doesn't have the premium feel of more expensive models, but for the price, you‚Äôre getting a solid product. The RGB lights are also vibrant and easy to adjust.

While the Apex 3 TKL has good features for everyday use and gaming, it lacks some premium features like dedicated media keys or USB passthrough. Still, it‚Äôs a reliable and good-looking keyboard for the price.

The SteelSeries Apex 3 TKL is a great entry-level gaming keyboard. The key presses are satisfying, but I wish it had more customization options in the software. Overall, for entry-level gamers, it‚Äôs highly recommendable.

review_title: Great keyboard but needs wrist support
review_text: The Keychron Q4 is a very good office keyboard. It offers an excellent typing experience and feels incredibly well-built thanks to the premium materials used. Just be aware you'll need a wrist rest.

The Keychron Q4 provides an excellent typing experience with its solid build quality. It features customizable RGB backlighting and is compatible with multiple operating systems, making it an ideal choice for programmers.
As a compact keyboard, the Keychron Q4 offers great portability with all essential features. However, its lack of dedicated arrow keys can make navigation less convenient when working with documents.
Though primarily designed for typing, the Keychron Q4 performs surprisingly well for casual gaming. It has quality RGB lighting and is highly customizable, perfect for a personal touch.

review_title: Good build, but some ergonomic issues
review_text: The Keychron Q4 has a nice design and feels robust but lacks ergonomic features like adjustable height or wrist support, which can lead to discomfort during long typing sessions.
The Keychron Q7 is a wonderful keyboard with an all-metal construction that makes it feel robust and sturdy. The OSA-profile keycaps are highly comfortable, making typing and gaming a joy.
The Keychron Q7 weighs a lot due to its all-metal build, which gives it a premium feel. However, this makes it less portable. Perfect for a desk setup where it won't be moved around.
The Keychron Q7 has proven to be excellent for gaming. The responsiveness of the Gateron G Pro switches enhances my gaming sessions tremendously. I love its quick actuation and durability.
Typing on the Keychron Q7 is highly pleasurable, thanks to its comfortable keycap design and fast response time. It might be pricey, but the quality justifies the expense, in my opinion.
The Q7 offers great features, but as a wired-only keyboard, it limits versatility. Overall, it performs excellently for my work and gaming but lacks wireless connectivity options.

The Logitech G413 is well-built with a nice brushed aluminum frame and offers a good typing experience with tactile feedback. However, it is limited to red backlighting, which may be a letdown for those wanting RGB options.

The Logitech G413's mechanical switches provide a tactile feel which is helpful for programming. It lacks a wrist rest, making it less ergonomic for long typing sessions. Overall, it is a sturdy keyboard for its price.

While the build quality of the Logitech G413 is solid, it lacks full RGB lighting and has limited macro settings to function keys only, which may frustrate some gamers. It works well but does not stand out against competitors.

A good entry-level mechanical keyboard with tactile switches and solid construction. The red lighting is simple but effective. A lack of advanced features keeps the cost low but may limit enthusiasts. Still a good choice.

The Logitech G413 is a practical keyboard with a good typing experience, but the lack of RGB lighting and dedicated function for macros is disappointing. It's decent for office use, and it‚Äôs quiet enough not to disturb others.

It works well, but it needs replacement batteries every now and then. Not sure if it‚Äôs a real battery drainer but it seems to not hold up for 2 months unlike the promised year-long performance. I would recommend this to a friend.

I bought my Mom an iPad for Christmas then paired it with this cover/keyboard and she loves it. The keyboard has a very good tactile feel, and it has a genius design. I would recommend this to a friend.
Flexible, durable, and travels well. The product is lightweight and the color is compatible with most other accessories. I would recommend this to a friend.

I wanted easier typing and the ability to sit my iPad on the table and use a trackpad for quick selection or scrolling. The multi-gestures using the trackpad make for quick switching. I would recommend this to a friend.

The keyboard case offers full protection on all edges while still offering access to the USB-C port. The keys feel great when typing, and the build quality is what you would come to expect from Logitech. I would recommend this to a friend.

review_title: Hands down WAY better than Apple keyboard.
review_text: The ONLY choice for your iPad! Logitech is actually a very nice case with a built-in keyboard. A very convenient trackpad too. I would recommend this to a friend.
The keyboard attaches easily and the touchpad is very responsive. Detachable keyboard and stand makes iPad very slim and fun to use. I would recommend this to a friend.
My wife loved this as a gift. It fit her iPad perfectly and protects the device. The keyboard works the way it should, and the stand-up feature is great. I would recommend this to a friend.

This is a great product for under $50; we really enjoyed typing with this keyboard. I think this keyboard is the one for you if you need a full-size and affordable option with a number pad. I would recommend this to a friend.

It serves as a good temporary option, but you can definitely tell it's made to a budget. After using it for a while, I don‚Äôt think it will last indefinitely, but for now, it does the job and it looks good. I would recommend this to a friend.

It's a basic keyboard and works just fine for casual use or light gaming. The keyboard feels good but is not as responsive as higher-end models. Still, it gets the job done at this price point. I would consider recommending this to someone on a budget.

If you're looking for a budget mechanical keyboard, this does the trick, but don‚Äôt expect anything amazing. Tactile feel is okay, but it could be better. If I were on a tighter budget, it would work for now. I would recommend this to a friend.

Excellent for beginners as a mechanical keyboard. A great entry point to understanding what mechanical keyboards feel like without spending a lot. Yes, there are better ones out there, but I find this to be a practical starting point. I would recommend this to a friend.

It's more than usable in its stock form, but I bought this to mod. You have to buy Akko switches, but I like them anyway. It comes with everything to pull the caps and switches. The brown switches are okay, and the shine-through for the stock caps is excellent.

I had this keyboard for about 2-3 weeks, and it‚Äôs honestly amazing. It makes gaming smooth and typing is great. I definitely recommend this, especially a brown switch keyboard. Plus, the lights on it are very cute!
It's okay since the price isn't RGB; it's a single-color LED (purple) but doesn't affect me since the color of my setup matches. It has several modes and you can customize your own mode.
It‚Äôs a good thing to have and everything; I love the keyboard. This keyboard is really great, especially for the price.

The Redragon Dragonborn K630 is excellent for gaming. The tactile Brown switches feel light and responsive, and you can customize the RGB backlighting. However, the keys wobble and feel unstable at times, especially larger keys.

The tactile Brown switches are quiet and provide decent feedback while typing. Customization is easy with backlighting options. For the price, this keyboard has been fantastic, but it could benefit from more stable keys.
I've found it satisfactory for office use, but the key wobble can be distracting during typing sessions. The macros and RGB options add great value, but you do need a wrist rest for comfortable use.

The Redragon K630 has been a delight for casual gaming. The compact size saves desk space, and the Brown switches make typing a joyful experience. The RGB lighting is a nice touch if customizable options are available.

For just under $60, this keyboard has impressive build quality and features. It's very responsive, and while the key wobble could be better, it‚Äôs still a great deal. I'd recommend it for anyone looking to save space.

review_title: My Favorite IPad Case with Keyboard
review_text: I have tried many iPad cases with a keyboard and I do believe this is my favorite. The keyboard is magnetic, and I love that it is detachable when needed. Very functional and efficient!

The Matias Ergo Pro is a comfortable keyboard that‚Äôs great for typing and gaming alike, and I‚Äôd definitely recommend you check it out. The Matias Ergo Pro has nice features but poor reliability. After a few weeks, the left-hand shift key stopped working, and the keyboard would occasionally register incorrect keystrokes. I expected better for the price, especially considering that I had cheap keyboards that lasted much longer without issues.

The build quality was solid, but I did have some issues with ghosting while typing quickly.

The Claymore II's wireless connectivity is a game-changer. Being able to customize every aspect of the keyboard is a huge benefit for gamers.

The K70 RAPIDFIRE has a strong design and great ergonomics. The keys are responsive, and it feels great during long gameplay sessions.

Look if your looking for a good keyboard and lighting this is it. I would recommend this to a friend.
I loved the keyboard, it‚Äôs my first time upgrading my set up and it‚Äôs a pretty good keyboard to get for gaming! I would recommend!!

review_title: Overall, it provides for a good gaming and typing experience
review_text: Overall, it provides for a good gaming and typing experience, other than the lack of a numpad. The keyboard is functional with great build quality.

If you're on a Mac, the LG UltraFine 4K is a dream come true. The integration is seamless, and the monitor provides stunning sharpness and color fidelity. Perfect for all my editing and design work. I couldn't be happier with this purchase!

The MSI Optix MPG27CQ is a game-changer. The 144Hz refresh rate and low response time have made such a difference in my gaming experience. The colors pop beautifully, and I have yet to experience any motion blur. Highly recommended for gamers at any level.

I‚Äôve been using the MSI Optix MPG27CQ for a while, and it delivers excellent performance for gaming and regular tasks. The curved display is immersive and enhances the experience, although there was some difficulty in getting the color settings just right. Overall a solid purchase.

This monitor is unreal! The MSI Optix MPG27CQ delivers beautiful visuals and super smooth performance. I love the curved design, it truly makes me feel like I'm inside the game. I‚Äôd highly recommend it for both casual and serious gamers.

I bought the MSI Optix MPG27CQ for my dual-monitor setup and it fits perfectly. The image quality is sharp and colors are very vibrant. While configuring the settings took some time, I‚Äôm content with my purchase and it has improved my work and gaming significantly.

Love the MSI Optix MPG27CQ! The curved display really gives depth to my games, and the graphics are stunning. I‚Äôve also used it for movies, and the experience is equally impressive. I can't recommend it enough for anyone looking to upgrade their monitor!

I did not buy this monitor for gaming as most of the reviews that I read prior to my purchase. Once setup and I got used to it, I absolutely love it. Dell makes a solid product, well built and looks great.

I own this monitor for almost a year now. I bought it for a multiple display setup in my messy home office. Plenty of work space due to the UW screen, great resolution, and color is good out of the box. Minor issues but not a big deal.
The curved screen is very comfortable, and the 3440x1440 resolution is crisp and clear. Multitasking is a snap with the presets, and I get lots of compliments on the quality and resolution.
This is the second monitor I have purchased from Dell, and the graphics are terrific. Overall appearance is excellent, although it did not come with an HDMI cable.
This monitor is one of the best I've ever used. It's nearly perfect right out of the box with minimal calibration needed, great viewing angles, and top-notch build quality.
The Dell U4919DW has transformed my productivity. I love the expansive screen that has replaced my dual-monitor setup seamlessly. The picture quality is exceptional, no regrets in this purchase.

This monitor gives me great room for productivity and offers solid build quality. While it does not have HDR support, the color accuracy is excellent enough for my graphic design tasks. I have enjoyed using it.

I appreciate the KVM switching feature, allowing easy use between different PCs. The resolution is sharp, and while not geared for gaming, I still enjoy casual play without issues. A solid option overall.
Using the U4919DW for my work has been fantastic. The 32:9 aspect ratio has allowed me to have two full windows open side-by-side without any bezels, which is exactly what I was looking for.

This monitor makes gaming even better. It was pretty easy to setup and the picture quality is amazing. When set to the highest resolution, it is super clear with no distortion or picture problems. Well worth the extra money compared to traditional monitors.

Good picture, great price. Easy to set up. Works well for games. Highly recommended if you're looking for a solid monitor. The motion clarity during gameplay is impressive, eliminating lag while pushing my graphics card to its limit.
Looked at monitors for a while and saw this one. By far the best deal and quality you can get period. 144Hz, 1440p, 27-inch. Premium build with a nice stand and adjustable height. Perfect for gaming.

It has really good resolution the only thing that's not so great is when the screen is white and you‚Äôre not facing straight at it, it turns yellowish and nasty. Still, overall, a fantastic monitor for gaming and work.

review_title: Nice display, but I have a dead pixel.
review_text: I like this display a lot for a TN panel. The color accuracy isn't perfect, but I don't need it to be. I really only have one gripe with this monitor. With how much I paid for it, I would expect a higher level of quality.

The AOC AGON AG271QX feels extremely responsive due to the high native refresh rate and low input lag. The monitor also supports FreeSync to adjust the refresh rate to the game, which is great and removes screen tearing.

The AOC Agon AG271QX gets bright to overcome reflections, which is great. It also has a light-matte finish which handles direct glare well. The edges of the screen look non-uniform due to poor viewing angles.

The colors need to be adjusted manually, and there are a few settings that need to be altered. Overall it provides crisp images with great contrast. However, it doesn‚Äôt support the wider Adobe RGB color space and loses accuracy at angles.
Good picture, great price. Has a fast refresh rate and performs well for gaming. Picture quality holds up well even in direct light. Great value for money considering the features.
I have used this monitor for several months now, and I enjoy the performance for gaming and media consumption. The adjustment options are convenient and it looks sleek with a modern design.

The HP OMEN 27 features a great design and fantastic performance. Coupled with the black frame insertion feature, it reduces blur during fast action nicely. A solid option for serious gamers looking for performance.

I found the HP OMEN 27 to have excellent motion handling during gameplay. While it lacks some ergonomic features compared to other models, the picture quality is sharp and responsive, which makes up for it.

Excellent gaming monitor with a solid build and good features. The refresh rate keeps gameplay smooth, and the picture quality is top-notch. It is worth the investment for serious gamers or content creators.

Overall satisfied with the HP OMEN 27. The performance is great for both gaming and watching movies. I wish it had better color accuracy out of the box, but after adjusting settings, it worked well for my needs.
Good contrast and color depth, but the viewing angles could be improved. While it performs decently overall, there are better options for the price if you prioritize wider angles in your setup.

The ASUS ROG Swift PG348Q offers incredible gameplay performance with its high refresh rate and G-Sync support. Its color output is fantastic, making games look vibrant which enhances immersion significantly.
This monitor is very well designed with superb build quality. The stand is adjustable, allowing me to find the perfect viewing angle for my setup. An excellent choice for both gaming and work.
I appreciate the OLED responsiveness, and the picture quality is outstanding. However, it is a bit on the pricier side compared to other options in the market, so it may not fit everyone's budget.
The level of detail in games is breathtaking. The colors are vibrant and brightness is perfect for both bright and dark environments, enhancing the overall experience tremendously. Highly recommend!
If you're into graphic design or video editing, this monitor is amazing for color accuracy and detail. The wide screen is perfect for multitasking without losing any quality.
Let's not beat around the bush, this is one of the BEST monitors I've ever had! The high resolution combined with the IPS panel provides vibrant colors and sharp text. Truly a sight for sore eyes.
Unfortunately, the first U2415 unit I received had something loose inside that rattled when rotating the display, and the screen appeared blurry. However, the replacement unit was much clearer.
The ASUS PB277Q provides a high refresh rate and decent picture quality. While it may wash out slightly at angles, the low input lag is great for casual gaming and general use.

The Dell P2417H is a decent choice with a wide viewing angle and ergonomic adjustments. However, its picture quality is mediocre, especially when viewing in black rooms due to noticeable backlight bleed.
This is my review after using the Dell P2417H for 2.5 months. The built quality is good, and the IPS panel offers excellent viewing angles. It has a 3-year warranty, which is a plus.
This is a very functional monitor, besides its great picture it contains USB ports for added functionality. I would recommend this to a friend.
I love the fact that this monitor can be used both vertically as well as horizontally. Easy set up and easy to use daily even when flipping between both views. I would recommend this to a friend.

I love the rotating aspect of this monitor. I wanted a dual setup but didn't have a lot of space. Resolution is good and it has an auto feature that I turned off. Great deal and great product. I would recommend this to a friend.
Seems like a nice monitor but I returned after realizing it's too small for my needs. Ended up going for the 24" model. No, I would not recommend this to a friend.
